title: Catering Consultant, Fantasyland Hotel
company: West Edmonton Mall Property Inc. (West Edmonton Mall and Fantasyland Hotel)
description:
The Catering Consultant is responsible for supporting the Director of Sales with the day-to-day tasks including guest interaction, document preparation, catering lead inquiries and any other necessary tasks.


Primary Responsibilities:

• Managing client requests in an accurate and timely manner while ensuring the appropriate documents and correspondence is completed.

• Maintaining a positive and friendly relationship with Hotel clients and guests and ensuring all questions, concerns or problems are handled accordingly.

• Ensuring all catering events is entered into the appropriate booking system and creating Banquet Event Orders (BEO’s) or contracts and sending to the event contact for approval.

• General administrative responsibilities including collecting payments or deposits if required, filing, calendar updates, answering the telephone, site tours and other duties as assigned.


Desired Qualifications:

• Minimum High School Diploma, diploma or degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in Business Administration or Hospitality/Tourism is preferred.

• Three (3) years-experience in an administrative catering or banquet role or similar.

• Experience using Sales Systems, Microsoft Office including Outlook, Excel and Word with the ability to easily learn new software programs.

• Ability to communicate clearly in both written and verbal form with strong attention to detail, grammar and spelling.

• Excellent interpersonal, customer service and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize multiple requests or orders.


Terms of Employment:

• This is a full-time position that is required Monday through Friday, 8:30am – 5pm with occasional evening and weekend availability.

• This is a salaried position that will depend on experience and qualifications,

• Must be able to pass a basic security clearance.

title: Dining Room/Catering Server
description:
Sodexo is growing! We are looking for a Catering Server to join our dynamic team. This position is a full-time, or part-time role. You will be offered is a great team environment, work/life balance and the ability to ensure customer satisfaction.



Qualifications

You are an experienced server who enjoys working in a team environment ensuring high quality service and customer satisfaction. You will be expected to provide prompt, friendly and professional service. You will be asked to remove dirty dishes, linens, glassware and flatware from tables and counters and transport items to the designated area.

You will be responsible for operating and maintaining equipment as needed in accordance with established guidelines and safety regulations. You will be required to maintain the level of operating supplies (china, dishes, glassware, utensils), condiments, and paper supplies for each serving station, obtaining replacement stock from the stock room according to established guidelines. You will also be asked to reset tables with silverware, tablecloths, napkins and glassware in accordance with established dining room table rules.

You have a minimum of 1 year of experience in high-end banquet and event management and excellent customer service. A high school diploma - GED - or similar experience will be considered an asset.

What's Next?

If you're looking for a role where you can truly impact the lives of others, click "I'm interested" for a quick 5-minute online application.



Additional Information

Sodexo is committed to Employment Equity and Diversity. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of national origin, race, religion, ethnicity, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other federal, provincial, or local protected class.

We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates who participate in all aspects of the selection process. 

Thank you for your interest in Sodexo.

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.

Follow us on social media to see first-hand what we are all about!  

Instagram: @SodexoCanadaCareers

Twitter: @SodexoJobsCA

LinkedIn: Sodexo Canada Careers

Facebook: Sodexo CA Jobs

title: Food and Beverage Server
description:
At Saltlik, our team is deeply connected to their craft and seek purpose through serving others. Join a team of experts who are passionate about quality and committed to curating rare experiences.

As a server, you anticipate guest needs, go above and beyond what is expected to deliver an iconic and quality dining and special event experience. You are an expert of our product, and deliver a curated experience for each guest. Building on your passion for hospitality, join a team of experts in a fast-paced, performance-driven environment.

Requirements

3-5+ years fine dining service experience (If you have the potential and less experience, we still want to meet you.)

A passion for hospitality and creating world-class experiences

A desire to learn and grow through personal and career development

An entrepreneurial mindset. You see things from a new perspective

Beverage and wine knowledge an asset

Liquor Service certification

Core Values

You value honesty and humility. You have integrity and do what you say.

You approach life with fearless determination and a sense of fun.

You are creative, risk-taking, visionary and cutting edge. You choose to lead.

You contribute to a strong culture and are committed to the team.

You are passionate about quality and professionalism.

You believe in unleashing the potential in others.

Perks

Flexible scheduling to accommodate your personal and family needs

Competitive compensation opportunity

Ongoing mentorship to support personal and professional goals

Fun, Team-driven and inclusive community

Dynamic, fast-paced, and agile work environment

World-class Culinary, Service and Wine training

Compete through culinary and bar challenges

Meal discounts

Fitness membership discounts

Recruiting & Referral bonus program incentives

SALTLIK is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We thank all candidates for their time and interest in working at SALTLIK however, only candidates under consideration for opportunities with SALTLIK will be contacted to participate further in this process.

About Saltlik

Built on an elevated guest experience and culinary mastery, Saltlik has been a leader in developing the best for over 15 years. We create an atmosphere where culinary passion is unleashed. Saltlik is in the heart of downtown Calgary, where you can expect a warm and comfortable dining experience. Our menu offers an array of hand-crafted items using fresh, quality ingredients. We offer exclusive catered events in our private dining with every detail of service skillfully curated. Careful thought and consideration has gone into every part of what we do here at Saltlik, and it starts with our people.

Saltlik is a part of the JOEY Restaurant Group, who are family-owned and operated since 1992 and have grown into an iconic multi-concept brand throughout North America with continued growth and expansion planned into 2030.

At Saltlik, we pride ourselves on training those driven to become professionals in the pursuit of culinary and service excellence. Taught by the best in the industry, our partners establish and evolve depth of knowledge through the practice of their skills. Career driven, our partners have an emotional connection to what they do and seek precision in their quest for culinary greatness. We offer a stage to create and develop, while growing in a diverse range of experiences. Partners are valued and recognized for their commitment to the team and their entrepreneurial spirit. We are home to future industry leaders, mentors and professionals.

title: Event Venue Supervisor
description:
Introduction:

Evergreen Brick Works is looking for a strong hospitality candidate for the role of Event Venue Supervisor. This person has proven experience managing events including BEO execution, vendor management and client relations.


About Us:

Evergreen is a national not-for-profit helping make cities flourish.  Cities that are low carbon, inclusive to all and sustainable at their core. 


For 30 years, Evergreen has been making Canadian cities better places to move, work, live, play and grow.  We’ve worked from coast to coast with governments, neighborhood groups, school boards, developers and residents, collaborating to create better communities. 

 

Evergreen Brick Works is one of Toronto’s most sought-after reception and event facilities. Nestled in Toronto’s lush ravines in a setting of awe-inspiring heritage buildings, Evergreen Brick Works offers a truly unique setting for events. Our spaces offer various capacities, from an intimate gathering in the BMO Atrium to a 2,000-person standing reception in the Pavilions or CRH Gallery.


About the Role:

The Venue Supervisor will be the main Evergreen point of contact during Events. The role will include providing support to the Event Manager and catering team as well as overseeing all venue related event logistics. The Venue Supervisor will communicate with event clients and suppliers as an Evergreen Ambassador to facilitate their needs during the event.

 

Key Responsibilities:

Customer Service

  • Ensure client and guest satisfaction throughout the event
  • Assist clients and guests with special requests as required
  • Problem solve event issues that arise on site
  • Represent Evergreen in a professional and courteous manner


Venue and Operations

  • Client point of contact for all venue related event logistics
  • Evergreen point of contact for all suppliers at the event including but not limited to caterer, staffing agency, Audio visual, security and décor
  • Ensure the venue is at a state of readiness at beginning and end of event
  • Supervise load in and out of equipment, rentals, etc.
  • Liaise with Event Manager to ensure event set up and itineraries are followed and on track
  • Supervise beverage staff and reconcile opening and closing beverage inventory
  • Liaise with event suppliers as necessary
  • Facilitate the support of facilities as required by the event
  • Liaise with off-site emergency contacts as necessary (flood, site manager, etc.)
  • Ensure compliance with all requirements of the provincial liquor legislation at all time during the event
  • Ensure that the venue is run in a safe, orderly and disciplined manner in accordance with Evergreen’s policies and Health & Safety requirements


Team Accountability

  • Support the Hospitality Team with event execution
  • Contribute to positive workplace culture and great internal communication
  • Model Evergreen’s core values of sustainability, innovation and connection


About You:

You excel in the following areas:

  • Analytical/Decision Making/Problem Solving skills. Draw insightful conclusions from information. Assess situations to determine the importance, urgency and risks, and make clear decisions which are timely and in the best interests of the organization.
  • Attention to detail. Does not let important details slip through the cracks.
  • Calm under pressure. Demonstrate composure in stressful situations.
  • Communication. Communicate in a clear, confident, respectful, thorough and timely manner using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques.
  • Customer-focus. Anticipate, understand, and respond to the needs of internal and external customers/donors to meet or exceed their expectations and receives positive feedback from internal and external customers/donors.
  • Proactivity/Enthusiasm/Persistence. Act without being told what to do. Passionate and excited over work. Can-do attitude. Tenacious and goes the distance to get something done.


You have the following qualifications:

  • 1+ years in a team supervisor role
  • Demonstrated background in customer service
  • Hospitality experience a must, with a preference to catering, staffing agency or event venue experience
  • Smart serve certified
  • First-aid/CPR certification an asset


﻿Additional Information:

Reporting Relationships:

  • Supervised by: Senior Manager, Events & Event Logistics


Working conditions:

  • Able to work anywhere across the 11-acre site including outdoors
  • Fast paced environment
  • Working hours are varied and depend on event bookings – availability on evenings and weekends, some early mornings may be required 


Physical requirements:

  • Standing for extended periods of time
  • Some lifting heavy objects


Contract:

  • Casual, hourly. Varied hours based on event schedule.


Hourly Wage:

  • $22-$25 per hour, dependent on experience

This person has proven experience managing events including BEO execution, vendor management and client relations.', 'Proactivity/Enthusiasm/Persistence.\xa0Act without being told what to do. title: Catering Driver - Part-time
description:
The Catering Delivery is responsible for receiving products from the OB Caters team and delivering products to the appropriate offsite location/venue within Toronto and the Greater Toronto Area in a timely manner ensuring that all products are handled with care.

PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Communicate with the Catering Chef and culinary team regarding delivery details
  • Packages, receives and loads products onto the company vehicle in a safe and timely manner
  • Safely deliver products via foot and/or vehicle while meeting deadlines
  • Practice road rules and follow directions while driving the company vehicle
  • Arrive safely at location, unload and deliver products to on-site management
  • Assist in properly receiving and storing delivered items
  • Follow Health & Safety regulations
  • Additional duties as assigned or required

Qualifications

  • Valid G Drivers License
  • Must provide positive drivers abstract/record
  • Criminal/credit check required
  • Ability to lift 20kg with ease
  • Ability to take direction and work calmly and effectively under pressure

Additional Information

** We thank all applicants for their interest in Oliver & Bonacini Hospitality; however, only suitable candidates will be contacted to continue the application process. **

title: Building Restoration Labourers
description:
Looking for High rise building restoration workers for Balcony repairs, hot rubber membrane waterproofing, and general labor as well as people with a bobcat and mini excavator experience.

This is a long-term position for the right individuals and allows for personal growth within a rapidly expanding company.

Benefits Available For The Right Candidates.

Salary is competitive and based on experience and capabilities.

High Rise building Restoration and Demolition contractors

title: Gérant(e) de la restauration
description:
Temps plein et/ou temps partiel

Relevant de la Gérante de la Restauration, la personne en poste coordonne le travail quotidien des employé(e)s du restaurant, du bar et du comptoir pour emporter et du service aux chambres. Plus particulièrement, elle supervise les employé(e)s, prépare les horaires de travail et coordonne les différentes tâches afin d’assurer la qualité du service ainsi que le respect des normes établies.

Aperçu Des Tâches
  • La personne supervisera les opérations, en plus d'assurer un service attentionné et professionnel respectant les standards de service, faire la gestion de plaintes, développer les techniques et opportunités de vente;
  • De plus, la personne aura à participer au développement des départements au niveau de l’offre et du service offert, développer l’implantation des mesures de service, participer aux prévisions budgétaires ainsi qu'aux achats;
  • La personne aura également à faire le suivi au niveau des mesures disciplinaires ainsi qu'à participer au développement du personnel en matière de formation;
  • Elle aura finalement à assurer la qualité du service et l’adhésion complète des employés envers notre vision, notre mission et nos valeurs.
Exigences Du Poste
  • Deux années d’expérience dans un poste en hôtellerie et/ou en restauration, de l’expérience en supervision est un atout important ;
  • Détenir un diplôme en Technique de Gestion hôtelière ou en Gestion d'un établissement de restauration est un atout ;
  • Démontrer une bonne capacité à résoudre les problèmes et à travailler sous pression ;
  • Posséder un bon sens de l’initiative et des responsabilités ;
  • Un anglais avancé ;
  • Bonnes connaissances sur les techniques de service, la nourriture et les boissons.
Work Locations

Hilton Quebec

Schedule

Full-time

Brand

Hilton Hotels & Resorts

Shift

Full Availability

Job Level

Supervisor/Team Leader

Job

Bars and Restaurants

title: Catering Server (Pacific National Exhibition)
description:
Catering Server

Part-Time, Event Based

Wage & Pay Grade

$16.02/hour plus 10% in lieu of benefits & vacation

Date Posted: March 1, 2022

Who We Are…

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 112-year old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of approximately $58 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams: the 15 day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events. The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance. The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best we can be.

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organization’s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution. With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to “Deliver Memorable Experiences” for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees or the community.

The Catering Servers of the Food & Beverage department will be serving our guests for various events such as, Banquet Functions, Concerts, Sporting Events, and various Special Events. We are seeking creative and hard-working individuals that have a passion for customer service and the events industry. Our ideal candidates are team players that are enthusiastic about the food service industry and the PNE. Join our team, and help us create extraordinary events for our guests to remember!

Why join our Team?
  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Flexible work hours
  • Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more
  • Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to create lasting memories and friendships!
What will you do this year?

In your role as a Catering Server, your primary accountabilities will be to:
  • Service of a variety of food and beverage to guests in banquet halls, concert, sporting events, and other special events.
  • Greet and assist guests in a friendly and courteous manner.
  • Assist with room and table set up and cleaning as required.
  • Ensure complete guest satisfaction by providing exceptional service.
  • Ensure work area and equipment is clean and organized at all times (i.e., wiping and washing counters, shelves, cupboards, machines, etc.).
  • Ensure PNE Uniform and Appearance policy is adhered to at all times.
  • Perform other related duties as required.
What else?
  • Must have 2-3 years of serving experience; previous catering experience considered an asset.
  • Must have successful completion of Grade 12.
  • Must have a valid Serving It Right (SIR) certificate.
  • Must have previous billing and cash handling experience and be familiar with billing systems.
  • Must have knowledge of serving techniques and proper serving etiquette.
  • Must be able to work efficiently while standing for long periods of time.
  • A Valid FoodSafe certificate considered an asset.
  • Ability to hand complaints from guests and deal with them in a courteous and professional manner.
  • Ability to foster effective working relationship with peers, subordinates and relevant external contacts.
  • Ability to function with some independence and under pressure and ability to meet multiple service demands at the same time.
  • Knowledge of the rules and regulations regarding the preparation and serving of food in a public place.
  • Must be available to work a variety of shifts including evenings (as early as 4pm) and weekends.
  • Proven ability to provide exceptional customer service.
Who are you?
  • Customer-centric
  • Out-going
  • Skillful communicator
  • Proactive
  • Organized
  • Committed
  • Reliable
Where and when to APPLY?

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the roles are filled.

We look forward to hearing from you!

The PNE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at hr@pne.ca.

Value

title: Food & Beverage Server
description:
You are an ambassador for the exceptional service and cuisine that are hallmarks of our food & beverage experience. Your warm, personal attention and knowledge of our outstanding offerings makes guests feel unique and valued.

Covid-19 Safety Policy

In order to keep our employees and the general public safe from the threat of Covid 19 and the rise of variants in the community, the Hotel has implemented a Covid-19 Safety Policy.

Opportunities Available
  • Banquets
  • In Room Dining
  • Mallard Lounge
  • Portobello Cafe
  • Wildflower
What Is In It For You
  • Employee accommodation available
  • Full time employees will be eligible to join the benefit plan which includes extended medical through Canada Life (Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Short Term Disability)
  • Full time employees will also be eligible to participate in Fairmont Pension Plan, which includes matched employee contributions
  • Employee benefit card offering discounted rates in Accor worldwide for you and your family
  • Learning programs through our Academies designed to sharpen your skills
  • Ability to make a difference through our Corporate Social Responsibility activities, like Planet 21
  • Career development opportunities with national and international promotion opportunities. The sky is your limit
What You Will Be Doing
  • Assist guests regarding menu items in an informative and helpful way
  • Have full knowledge of beverage lists and promotions, menu items and preparation methods
  • Follow all safety and sanitation policies when handling food and beverage
  • Other duties as assigned
Your Experience And Skills Include
  • Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times
  • Strong interpersonal and problem solving abilities
  • Ability to work well under pressure in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to work cohesively and collaboratively as part of a team
  • BC Serving It Right Certificate required prior to commencing employment
  • Required to be of legal age (19 years old) to serve alcohol in British Columbia
Physical Aspects Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Constant standing and walking throughout shift
  • Frequent lifting and carrying up to 50 lbs
  • Occasional kneeling, pushing, pulling, lifting
Your Team And Working Environment

Nestled at the base of Blackcomb Mountain, Fairmont Chateau Whistler resort defines mountain luxury in the heart of Whistler, British Columbia - Host Mountain Resort of the 2010 Winter Olympics. Located in the spectacular coastal mountain range, Whistler is Canada’s premier, year-round outdoor adventure destination - just two hours north of downtown Vancouver. Offering ski-in, ski-out convenience and on-site championship golf course, Fairmont Chateau Whistler is Whistler’s largest conference resort hotel with 519 guestrooms and suites, exceptional dining in five unique outlets and full resort amenities including a slopeside Health Club. Since opening its doors in 1989, this landmark destination has welcomed guests and colleagues to an unforgettable mountain adventure- start yours today!

Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization.

Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for Accor?

We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. title: Restoration Site Supervisor
description:
Job description

Looking for a supervisor/lead staff member to lead a restoration/cleaning crew.

Lead Staff Duties and Responsibilities

· Oversee day to day operations of on-going jobs; keeping detailed records of on-site job activities

· Provide for site safety and security

· Responsible for getting necessary equipment and supplies to complete tasks to and from job site

· Conduct regular inspections and maintenance of systems and equipment

· Handle emergencies appropriately according to established procedures; file accident reports

· Coordination and supervision of staff; keep accurate records of employee attendance and timesheets; provide positive direction to motivate quality performance; discipline personnel when necessary and appropriate

· Interview candidates as requested; onboard and train new hires

· Oversee projects to completion; track assignments

· Handle sensitive information with confidentiality

· Ensure compliance with company or government regulations

· Communicate with customers regarding products and services

· Liaise with contractors, managers, and other stakeholders, ensuring that all parties remain coordinated

· Able to work hours of operation Monday to Friday 8:00-4:30

· Responsible for completing Hazard Assessment Forms

· Responsible for driving and maintaining Company vehicle; interior and exterior of vehicle should be cleaned and maintained

· Responsible for Company gas card to be used as needed and receipts submitted at time of purchase

· Responsible for providing before and after photos for all jobs

MUST HAVE/NOT NEGOTIABLE

Valid driver's license and vehicle

Ability to communicate with customers and staff

Relatable job experience

Proper construction PPE

Restoration experience with current certifications/tickets

$25/hour to start

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $25.00 per hour

title: Catering Assistant
description:
Summary

Assist other departments when needed to ensure optimum service to guests. Maintain cleanliness of work areas throughout the day, practicing clean-as-you-go procedures. Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time or for an entire work shift. Read and visually verify information in a variety of formats small print). Enter and locate work-related information using computers and/or point of sale systems. Exchange information with other employees using electronic devices pagers and two-way radios, email). Engage guests in conversation regarding their stay, property services, and area attractions/offerings.

Follow all company safety and security policies and procedures; report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; and complete safety training and certifications. Follow all company policies and procedures, ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional, maintain confidentiality of proprietary information, and protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards, anticipate and address guests’ service needs, assist individuals with disabilities, and thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language, prepare and review written documents accurately and completely, and answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others, support team to reach common goals, and listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.

At Marriott, we are committed to putting our associates first and their health and safety are our highest priorities. This position requires associates to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 per current Public Health Agency of Canada standards or approved for a Human Rights accommodation.

title: Server, F&B Venues (Dual Citizen and 43 Down) - Part Time
description:
Summary

 Explore our very big world

We welcome you to join our global and diverse family. Whether you’re new to hospitality or a seasoned professional, you can come to us knowing that you will always be appreciated for your natural talents. Your positive energy and people-pleasing mindset are an important part of why our guests stay with us again and again.

Rewards For Work, Benefits For Life

You’ll be supported in and out of the workplace through:
  • Discounts on hotel rooms, gift shop items, food and beverage
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Recognition programs
  • Wellbeing programs
  • Encouraging management
  • Team-spirited colleagues
The impact you’ll make

You know the finest details of our menu and can’t wait to share your expertise with our guests. When they dine with us, your warm greeting, flawless table settings, and your friendly demeanor do not go unnoticed. No matter the day, you set out to provide each guest with a dining experience that will be remembered long after their stay.

What You’ll Be Doing
  • Welcome guests and promptly attend to tables
  • Serve food and beverages to guests making recommendations if needed
  • Share your menu knowledge to assist guests with questions and special requests
  • Record transactions in the MICROS system correctly and timely
  • Check-in with guests to assure satisfaction with each course and beverage
  • Clean tables, complete closing duties and re-stock tableware and other supplies
What We’re Looking For
  • Great conversational skills and teamwork-oriented
  • Positive outlook and outgoing personality
  • Previous serving experience is a big plus
This role requires the ability to move and lift up to 25 lbs. Standing, sitting or walking for extended periods of time and ensuring a professional appearance in a clean uniform are also required. Prior to employment, we’ll ask you to complete safety training and certification.

Connect your passions with a rewarding opportunity

You’re a food and beverage enthusiast who really enjoys making others feel at home. When you work with us, you'll get to entertain and meet people from all over the world as you build your experience. Join us and grow through opportunities to explore the business, opening yourself to various career options. No matter your path, we’ll make sure you feel right at home.

At Marriott, we are committed to putting our associates first and their health and safety are our highest priorities. This position requires associates to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 per current Public Health Agency of Canada standards or approved for a Human Rights accommodation.

title: Gérant(e) restauration & bar
description:
Quel sera mon rôle ?

La personne en poste coordonne le travail quotidien des employé(e)s du département de la restauration (restaurant, bar, comptoir pour emporter et service aux chambres. Vous aurez également la responsabilité du bon fonctionnement des bars (CABU boire et manger, CABU sur le toit et les bars banquet).

Aperçu Des Tâches
  • Superviser les opérations de soir du restaurant, du bar et du comptoir pour emporter;
  • Coordonner le développement des bars au niveau de l’offre, du service offert, de l’implantation des mesures de service et de la formation;
  • Responsable de la création de la carte cocktail;
  • Responsable des achats d’alcools et de vins et de la gestion de la cave à vin;
  • Développer des stratégies pour activer les 5 à 7 et responsable des évènements du bar piscine en été.
  • Deux années d’expérience dans un poste en restauration d’hôtellerie et de l’expérience en supervision d’équipe de travail;
  • Connaissance en mixologie;
  • Détenir un diplôme en Technique de Gestion hôtelière ou en Gestion d'un établissement de restauration est un atout;
  • Posséder un bon sens de l’initiative et des responsabilités;
  • Démontrer une bonne capacité à résoudre les problèmes et à travailler sous pression;
  • Anglais avancé.
skills: ['Responsable des achats d’alcools et de vins et de la gestion de la cave à vin;']

title: Food & Beverage Server's Assistant
description:
You are an ambassador for the exceptional service and cuisine that are hallmarks of our food & beverage experience. Your warm, personal attention and knowledge of our outstanding offerings makes guests feel unique and valued.

Covid-19 Safety Policy

In order to keep our employees and the general public safe from the threat of Covid 19 and the rise of variants in the community, the Hotel has implemented a Covid-19 Safety Policy.

Opportunities Available
  • Mallard Lounge
  • Wildflower
What Is In It For You
  • Employee accommodation available
  • Full time employees will be eligible to join the benefit plan which includes extended medical through Canada Life (Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Short Term Disability)
  • Full time employees will also be eligible to participate in Fairmont Pension Plan, which includes matched employee contributions
  • Employee benefit card offering discounted rates in Accor worldwide for you and your family
  • Learning programs through our Academies designed to sharpen your skills
  • Ability to make a difference through our Corporate Social Responsibility activities, like Planet 21
  • Career development opportunities with national and international promotion opportunities. The sky is your limit
What You Will Be Doing
  • Assist guests regarding menu items in an informative and helpful way
  • Assist Food & Beverage Servers in all aspects of the dining experience including but are not limited to serving dishes to tables, clearing and re-setting tables and maintaining side stations
  • Setting, replenishing and maintaining product offerings on buffets according to Fairmont Hotels and Resort standards
  • Follow all safety and sanitation policies when handling food and beverage
  • Other duties as assigned
Your Experience And Skills Include
  • Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times
  • Strong interpersonal and problem solving abilities
  • Ability to work well under pressure in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to work cohesively and collaboratively as part of a team
  • BC Serving It Right Certificate required prior to commencing employment
  • Required to be of legal age (19 years old) to serve alcohol in British Columbia
Physical Aspects Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Constant standing and walking throughout shift
  • Frequent lifting and carrying up to 50 lbs
  • Occasional kneeling, pushing, pulling, lifting
Your Team And Working Environment

Nestled at the base of Blackcomb Mountain, Fairmont Chateau Whistler resort defines mountain luxury in the heart of Whistler, British Columbia - Host Mountain Resort of the 2010 Winter Olympics. Located in the spectacular coastal mountain range, Whistler is Canada’s premier, year-round outdoor adventure destination - just two hours north of downtown Vancouver. Offering ski-in, ski-out convenience and on-site championship golf course, Fairmont Chateau Whistler is Whistler’s largest conference resort hotel with 519 guestrooms and suites, exceptional dining in five unique outlets and full resort amenities including a slopeside Health Club. Since opening its doors in 1989, this landmark destination has welcomed guests and colleagues to an unforgettable mountain adventure- start yours today!

Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization.

Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for Accor?

We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor’s limitless possibilities.

By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS

title: Catering Worker
description:
SAIT's School of Hospitality and Tourism is consistently recognized as one of the best hospitality schools in the world. We are proud to be the only institution in Canada to hold a Top 50 hospitality school ranking with both CEOWORLD Magazine and QS University Rankings.

Our prestigious reputation has been built on our progressive curriculum, strong relationships with industry and our unparalleled approach to applied education.

The Opportunity

The School of Hospitality and Tourism is a passionate and dedicated team of professionals committed to delivering on SAIT’s promise of applied education and student success. With an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit, the school trains nearly 1,200 students each year in addition to operating five food and beverage outlets and North America’s only student-run travel center, add continuing education and corporate events to the mix, and you’ve got a one-of-a-kind school that attracts top talent from around the world.

This position can support either front of house (FOH), or back of house (BOH) duties. When supporting FOH this position provides our guests with efficient, friendly and professional food and beverage service while following all policies and procedures of SAIT. When supporting BOH this position provides cleaning, food prep and basic cooking to our outlets, while following all policies and procedures of SAIT.

Note: This is an hourly position for a 6 month term. The role will be located at The Tastemarket

The Role

Serving/Bartending Duties:
  • Knowledge of menu items and preparation methods
  • Processing all guest orders in the Micros Point of Sale (POS)
  • Execute delivery of all food and beverage in an efficient and professional manner
  • Provide guests with exceptional customer service
  • Process all customer bills and payments
  • Complete end of day cash-out procedures, ensuring accuracy of deposit
  • Maintain a high level of safety and sanitation standards
  • Cleaning of tables/counters
  • Monitor and order packaging supply inventory
  • Stocking of beverage coolers, coffee station/take out supplies, and retail
  • Assist with the opening and closing duties of the outlet
  • Setup and teardown of tables, chairs, décor and AV
  • Assist with replenishing buffet items and all necessary serving utensils
  • Assume related duties as required

Stewarding / Prep Cook Duties:
  • Cleaning of kitchen equipment, hand washing of dishes, operating dishwasher and overall maintaining a high level of safety and sanitation standards
  • Food preparation
  • Deep cleaning of all equipment
  • Knowledge of menu items and preparation methods
  • Packaging of prepared foods, labeling & pricing
  • Assist with the opening and closing duties of the outlet
  • Assume related duties as required

Qualifications
  • Minimum High School Diploma with previous work experience
  • Preferred ProServe Certification

Classification: Catering Worker

Hours per week: Varies

Salary range: $15.60/hr

# of positions: 20

Posting closing date: Until suitable candidates are found

Position end date: 6 months after start date

About SAIT

SAIT is a global leader in applied education. Named one of Alberta’s Top Employers, we offer the chance to work with a purpose — preparing the next generation of industry leaders, entrepreneurs, advocates and explorers.

Building on our 100+ year history, we’re looking for innovative, bold and collaborative employees who embrace change and deliver world-class customer experiences. Your future starts now at SAIT.

Equity, diversity and inclusion (EDI) is essential to achieving SAIT’s vision to be a global leader in applied education. It creates the conditions for a healthy campus where everyone feels welcome, respected and empowered to succeed. SAIT values fairness, shared accountability and the importance of representation. The institution expects a commitment from its students and employees to continuously develop an equitable and inclusive mindset that celebrates diverse experiences and perspectives. Learn more about EDI at SAIT.

For information on the collection and use of your personal information, please see our Privacy Policy.

BEWARE FALSE POSTINGS AND RECRUITING OFFERS

SAIT has been made aware of individuals or organizations posing as SAIT using false postings to attract job seekers and collect personal information. Please be aware that SAIT will never request sensitive personal information beyond what is required for an application.

Career opportunities at SAIT will always be posted on the SAIT career site and we encourage applicants to only apply directly through there. When your application is completed you will receive an email confirmation, if you did not receive one please check your junk mail or try applying through the SAIT career page again.

title: Gérant(e) de la restauration
description:
Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre excellent service à la clientèle et votre capacité à travailler dans un environnement de travail rapide et dynamique? Vous ne craignez pas les défis et vous possédez une belle expérience en restauration?

On a un poste pour vous!

Croisières AML est une entreprise familiale établie au Québec depuis 50 ans. Nous sommes LA plus importante compagnie de croisières et d'excursions au Canada ! Notre mission : offrir un service personnalisé et un accueil chaleureux à tous nos clients.

Ce Que Vous Ferez
  • Assurer le respect de l’excellence du service à la clientèle selon les standards de qualité de l’entreprise en outillant les gestionnaires et leurs équipes respectives;
  • Assurer la bonne gestion des plaintes des clients à bord et en assurer le suivi hebdomadaire;
  • Assurer la planification et la coordination complète des événements spéciaux;
  • Établir et assurer le respect des normes de présentation des assiettes et des présentoirs de service;
  • Participer à l’élaboration des budgets en début d’année;
  • Suivre de façon hebdomadaire le respect des budgets alloués, incluant les salaires et coûts de vente;
  • Superviser et contrôler le suivi des inventaires, des réquisitions et des commandes;
  • Superviser et diriger une gestion des opérations efficace;
  • Proposer des idées et des recommandations afin de maximiser l’efficacité des opérations;
  • Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes.
Vous Êtes Reconnu(e) Pour
  • Votre excellent service à la clientèle;
  • Vos habiletés communicationnelles;
  • Votre dynamisme;
  • Votre capacité à gérer les priorités;
  • Votre capacité à prendre des décisions et de résoudre des problèmes;
  • Votre sens de l’organisation irréprochable;
  • Votre leadership positif.
Les Compétences Qui Sont Requises
  • 4 années d’expérience dans un poste de direction de la restauration;
  • Un permis de conduire valide;
  • Bonne maîtrise de l’Anglais (atout majeur).
Nous Vous Offrons
  • Travail saisonnier à temps plein;
  • Horaire de jour, de soir et de fin de semaine;
  • Hébergement fourni si vous habitez à l’extérieur de la région;
  • Formations offertes sur place;
  • Primes de références pour les employés;
  • Un environnement de travail hors du commun!
Bienvenue à bord!
skills: ['Travail saisonnier à temps plein;', 'Assurer la planification et la coordination complète des événements spéciaux;']

Located in the spectacular coastal mountain range, Whistler is Canada’s premier, year-round outdoor adventure destination - just two hours north of downtown Vancouver. Offering ski-in, ski-out convenience and on-site championship golf course, Fairmont Chateau Whistler is Whistler’s largest conference resort hotel with 519 guestrooms and suites, exceptional dining in five unique outlets and full resort amenities including a slopeside Health Club. Since opening its doors in 1989, this landmark destination has welcomed guests and colleagues to an unforgettable mountain adventure- start yours today!

Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization.

Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for Accor?

We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor’s limitless possibilities.

By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS

Zarky's Fine Foods has been making authentic Italian foods since 1985. With 3 locations across Hamilton we looking for high energy and self- motivated individuals to join our team. Currently we are seeking staff for our store located at 20 Hempstead Drive in Hamilton on the East Mountain.

We are on the search for talented staff to contribute to the growth and success of our unique offering of authentic foods. As a member of our team you will enjoy a family oriented environment that will provide meaningful work and opportunities to learn. We are currently looking for full time permanent Caterer to perform the following duties within our Kitchen and Catering Department:

description:
The Mixing Bowl has been in business for 22 years. We have worked hard and remained committed to our passion for food and our will to inspire others to think outside the cookie cutter box. Creating menus that are specifically suited to your needs is what we do best. Over the years, we have established ourselves as one of Ottawa’s top catering companies.

We are the preferred caterer to many Embassy’s and top dignitaries in the area. Our personalized service professional staff and dedication to our clients throughout the years has continued to propel us forward. We remain one of Ottawa’s most respected caterers and look forward to continue serving our clients for many years to come.

We are looking to add to our service and front of house team: Servers, Coordinators, Event Captains.

  • Ability to take direction
  • Proven ability to prioritize tasks, solve problems, cooperate with team members, and deliver quality food and beverage items consistently
  • Should be flexible in their work schedule (open availability AM & PM) and be able to lift heavy trays and equipment (up to 60 lbs).
  • Valid Licence and own transportation an asset

Job Types: Part-time, Casual

Salary: $18.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Tips

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

  • Venue & Attractions Associates: 1 year (preferred)

title: Agency Account Manager
description:
At g[squared], we passionately align ourselves with people who do good in the world, from socially responsible brands to nonprofits. Since 1996, g[squared] has partnered with hundreds of clients, becoming one of Alberta’s most accomplished business strategy, communications and marketing firms. Whether we’re working with nonprofits or businesses, we make a meaningful and measurable impact.

Why work for us?

Life experience has shown us that people matter more than anything else. Many of our clients have been with us since the beginning, receiving more than 24 years of service, stability and success. Our team is made up of the most accomplished, bright and caring folks in the business, with some contributing to g[squared] for a decade or more. As authentic leaders, only a culture of respect, community and collaboration will do for our amazing clients and staff.

The role: Agency Account Manager

Are you an enthusiastic, organized and self-proclaimed “attention-to-detail” fanatic looking for a great place to grow your career? Do you enjoy managing a number of tasks for a variety of causes and industries? If so, we’d love to chat with you. We’re recruiting an Account Manager to join our client services team.

At g[squared], you’ll have the opportunity to work on nonprofit and for-profit clients and campaigns, alongside a team of seasoned professionals. Bringing together your organizational and interpersonal skills, you’ll help our clients’ organizations grow and reach their audiences in a number of ways.

Duties & responsibilities:

  • Act as a direct client contact for projects.
  • Learn and understand our clients’ businesses.
  • Assist with the development of clients’ marketing strategies.
  • Responsible for project execution, according to g[squared]’s standards, within established budgets and timeframes.
  • End-to-end project management of campaign requirements, from strategy to delivery, including forecasting and maintaining budgets.
  • Ensure g[squared]’s procedures are followed.
  • Schedule and prioritize projects with a high level of detail, to ensure timely completion, which involves assigning, meeting and tracking deadlines.
  • Accurately and consistently enter time in our time management system.
  • Prepare and maintain client updates on a regular basis and send to clients.
  • Conduct regular meetings with clients.
  • Facilitate effective communication between our team and the client.
  • Provide suggestions, recommendations and advice to clients with regards to all marketing plans and activities, including media buying, promotions and event planning.
  • Develop relationships with various media reps and suppliers and provide feedback/recommendations on proposals, as required.
  • Review and provide feedback/recommendations on all proposals submitted by media reps.
  • Handle all printing and production coordination for clients.
  • Request and review quotes from suppliers and ensure we’re getting the best price for our client.
  • Ensure the end product meets the expectations of the client and g[squared].
  • Coordinate events; Handle all the details of events for clients by working in partnership with suppliers, caterers, rental companies, entertainment etc.

Requirements:

  • You have a minimum of three to five years’ related experience, ideally gained in an agency environment.
  • You’re proactive and resourceful—a proven “self-starter.”
  • You’re highly organized with outstanding attention to detail.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are comfortable managing multiple deadlines at once.
  • You’re an effective and confident communicator who is able to work with clients and staff at all levels.
  • You have experience working in a Mac environment.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000.00-$70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Culinary Staff
description:
Job description

WHY JOIN US?

  • Competitive (Guaranteed) hourly pay
  • Many locations around Toronto
  • Work at high end, exclusive events and venues and with Toronto's top Chefs
  • Gain valuable industry experience
  • Work with the largest hospitality staffing company in Ontario

Duties & Positions Available

  • Lead Cook
  • Prep Cook
  • Pastry Cook
  • Line Cook
  • Porter/Dishwasher

We at Red Culinary assist hospitality venues, hotels, caterers, and food service professions with the help they need to execute their events

*
Red Culinary standards of excellence include

  • Black Chef outfit, Cap, jacket, pants and apron including black green patch - non slip safety shoes - this is required for all positions - Can be purchased from us and deducted from your paycheque
  • A knife kit that is safe and portable - this is required for all positions except Porter/Dishwasher

We always arrive 15 minutes early and are ready to work at the designated start time. We are required to stand for long periods of time and are expected to be able to lift heavy objects on occasion.

Being on time in your uniform with a good attitude, confidence in your skill set, and a big smile is best way to start every shift with Red Culinary
*
*
Recommended certifications

Lead, Prep, Pastry, Line Cook must have or get their Food safety Certificate

Porter/Dishwashers must have or get their WHMIS - Safe handling of Chemicals certification
*
*
For events out of the city we pay travel time and can arrange carpools

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Casual
Part-time hours: 20-40 per week

Salary: $18.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Hiring Deckhands and Food & Beverage Staff
description:
Muskoka Steamships & Discovery Centre is hiring seasonal staff for the following positions onboard our ships RMS Segwun and Wenonah II:

- Deckhands. Assist with docking and disembarking, perform cleaning and preparation of ship for cruising, maintain cleanliness throughout voyage, assist in performing maintenance, and other duties as assigned.

- Serving Staff. Greet passengers, take drink orders, deliver meals to tables, clear tables, clean dining room, reset for next service, process payments, and other duties as needed.

- Food Prep Staff. Working in the galley you receive food from the caterer, store it properly, plate meals, practice safe food handling, clean galley, stock supplies, clean dishes, and other duties as needed.

- Purser/Host: Responsible for managing all food and beverage service onboard during cruises and private events. Hospitality experience would be an asset, good organizational skills and time management is essential. Must be able to work under pressure.

- Bartenders: Stock and manage bar inventory, mix and serve drinks, process payments, sell snack bar items, and other duties as needed.

- Bus Staff: Responsible for clearing tables, assisting with setup, assisting with cleaning, and other duties as needed.

All staff hired needs to be available from the middle of May to the week after Thanksgiving.

Must be available to work a variety of shifts including days. evenings. weekends, and holidays.

All positions require strong teamwork skills, ability to work under pressure, and dependability.

Smart Serve certification is required for Servers, Bartenders, and Pursers.

Training will be providing by employer.

Must be able to work a mix of days, evenings, weekends, and holidays.

Employment would be from mid-May to mid-October.

Applicants should apply with a resume and list any relevant experience and certifications.

We are sorry, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Work Remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Seasonal
Contract length: 5 months

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Language:

  • English (preferred)

title: newAdministrative Assistant
description:
Summary

The Stó: lō Xwexwilmexw Government (SXG) requires an energetic and motivated Administrative Assistant to work as administrative support for the SXG’s Executive Assistant and SXG staff. The Administrative Assistant will be responsible for performing a wide variety of administrative and office management duties in support of the Team. Responsibilities will include some standard receptionist and clerical duties, in addition to more complex functions and services, such as being involved in minute-taking during confidential meetings, and scheduling appointments.

Working closely with the Executive Assistant, the Administrative Assistant is co-responsible for overseeing the planning, promotion, and overall coordination of SXG meetings and events. The Administrative Assistant handles the sourcing and booking of venues and arranges proper accommodation and transportation for event participants such as speakers, and SXG attendees. The Administrative Assistant is also present at SXG events attended by leadership, to ensure the smooth running of events, and provides support as needed to events participants.

Job Duties

  • Provides administrative and office management support to the Executive Assistant, including, but not limited to the following: handles bookings for meetings and events; completes expense reports, pays invoices, and handles other monetary duties as required; receives incoming mail; reviews, evaluates, and distributes correspondence requiring priority attention, as directed by the EA; and other such clerical duties
  • Prepares minutes for meetings. NB: the prospective candidate must be a proficient minute taker
  • Helps coordinate the logistical aspects of SXG events (including formal Leadership workshops, and all meetings of the SXG Board of Directors)
  • Assists with the coordination of unique engagements
  • Sources venues and contractors, obtains quotes and conducts site visits where necessary
  • Liaises with event contractors, including caterers etc.
  • Helps with arrangements for speakers, entertainers, exhibitors, delegates etc.
  • Helps manage all invoicing, honoraria forms, travel reimbursement forms etc. for key participants
  • Keeps a record of events-related invoicing and provides necessary paperwork to the SXG Executive Assistant
  • Helps handle event details (including such things as participant contact information)
  • Ensures that the necessary equipment is in place for speakers’ presentations etc.
  • Helps schedule, coordinate and manage attendance for meetings etc.
  • Maintains detailed and accurate event files, e.g. exhibitor and participant databases
  • Helps ensure that the overall client services delivery presents an exceptional customer service experience
  • Provides administrative support to the Executive Assistant, including minute-taking and helping with the preparation of agendas etc.
  • Attends meetings as required
  • Performs other duties as necessary

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree preferred. High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent required
  • 2 years’ direct work experience in an office environment
  • 2 years’ experience as an administrative assistant

· Openness to on-going learning in relation to Stó: lō culture and history required

· Ongoing knowledge of the BC treaty process as asset

· Strong knowledge of general office procedures involving travel arrangements, budget management, reports, and so on

  • Superior typing skills [at least 30 wpm with one-year practical experience]
  • Able to write and format correspondence, including memos, letters, etc.
  • Superior time management skills, multitasking skills, and the ability to prioritize tasks with minimal supervision
  • High level of sound and independent judgment, reasoning, and discretion
  • Ability to interpret and implement company policies and procedures
  • Professional, responsive, and positive work attitude is essential
  • Resourcefulness and flexibility
  • Previous experience in handling confidential or sensitive information
  • General budgeting skills
  • Able to maintain filing systems and basic databases
  • Meticulous records maintenance skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills to communicate with all levels of staff, management, executive and leadership teams, along with the public (community members) at large
  • Strong customer service orientation

· High level of integrity, confidentially, and accountability

  • Ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with key business partners and customers/community members
  • Other duties as required

Work Conditions

  • Overtime as required for meetings
  • Driver’s license required

Salary: $25-30 per hour, depending upon experience
Application deadline: May 20, 2022
Start date: ASAP

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $25.00-$30.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Chilliwack, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • Front desk: 1 year (preferred)
  • Administrative experience: 1 year (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-20

title: Key Account Executive
description:
Unilever is hiring for Key Account Executives in different locations across the UK

Job Title: Key Account Executive
Location: Leatherhead Remote
Function: Food Solutions - Marketing



JOB PURPOSE

Operating in over 70 markets around the world, Unilever Food Solutions is the dedicated foodservice business of Unilever . Our portfolio encompasses many of the world’s leading food brands including Knorr, Colman’s, Hellman’s, Marmite, Walls, Ben & Jerrys, and The Vegetarian Butcher. Through combining a world-class product portfolio, knowledge of our customers and investment in our staff, we deliver year-on-year growth through offering chefs and caterers tailored solutions, helping them to expand their business and do what they love.

The ‘Away f rom Home’ channel is a dynamic and exciting environment. It involves working with customers ranging from Michelin star restaurants, hotels, through to pub chefs and workplace, school or hospital caterers - as well as the wholesalers and cash and carries who service the ‘Away f rom Home’ industry. Unilever Away f rom Home’ business is ambitious for growth and for the right individuals, we offer great development opportunities, both within the local business and beyond.

  • Are you passionate about food and passionate about building relationships with customers and offering them solutions based on their needs?

  • Do you want to work with iconic brands?

  • Are you ambitious and willing to learn?

  • Do you have bags of energy and a desire to succeed?

  • Do you want to be part of a successful team?

  • Are you a flexible individual with an entrepreneurial mindset?

If the answer to all these questions is YES , then this is a fantastic opportunity for you!

Unilever is the one of the most popular UK employers on LinkedIn for a reason. Regardless of experience or role, we encourage ownership of your career and offer a wealth of opportunities to expand your knowledge and network. We will give you an in-depth induction, including time in our kitchens and will invest in your individual career aspirations and development needs through our numerous training opportunities. A career with us is a career you shape and promises to be tailored and fulfilling, much like the solutions we offer to our customers.

Our working culture embraces diversity and acknowledges that work is an activity and not a place and encourages all employees to balance the entirety of their life commitments. As such we offer generous family-friendly policies (including parental, elderly care and enhanced maternity/paternity leave) and agile working is the norm, facilitated by up-to-date technology.

As a Key Account Executive, you will join a talented group of people who are always willing to go that extra mile for their customers. The purpose of the Key Account Executive is more than just selling products. You are required to seek out new business opportunity for Unilever whilst maintaining your existing business . You would be expected to deliver growth by opening new accounts within your agreed territory within the ‘Away from Home’ market.

You will need to meet your volume and financial targets and deliver excellent service to your customers

Within this role you may be asked to spend time off your territory if a specific target / product needs support in other high footfall areas.

RESPONSIBLITIES

  • Win new business whilst retaining existing business within your defined geographical territory

  • Expand customer base to reach more customers and drive product penetration

  • Implement customer business plans aligned to Unilever strategy & customer needs

  • Use internal systems as the basis for all customer investment and activity decisions

  • Daily completion of activities, opportunities & risks within CRM system

  • Attend and network at external industry forums to drive new business opportunities

Key Relationships

  • Customer contacts across all level s

  • MD / Finance Director / Marketing / Operation Managers / Chefs

  • Sales Controller / Distributive Sales Reps / National Account Managers, Sales Director, Culinary & Marketing Team s

ALL ABOUT YOU

  • Degree level preferable, Education to A level or International Equivalent

  • Experience in the Food Service desirable but not essential

  • Preferred experience in end user sales / distributive accounts

  • Hunger to succeed with a passion for winning new business

  • Flexible & Entrepreneurial mindset

  • Able to multi-task and manage multiple priorities.

  • A demonstrable customer focused attitude

  • Ability to build relationships with strong listening and communication skills

  • Resilience and tenacity to deliver.

  • Strong organisational skills, including diary and administration management

  • Ability to work independently & with a team

  • Strong IT skills, particularly in MS Office suite.

Standards of Leadership

  • Purpose & Service - enabling yourself & your people to find purpose and meaning in work

  • Personal Mastery - manage your own mood and motivations and those of the people around us

  • Agility – challenge, reinvent, explore & learn new (micro-) skills to unlock opportunities

  • Business Acumen - passion for & understanding how businesses operate in our connected world

  • Talent Catalyst – invest time into ‘always-on’-development to unlock the power of our people

  • Consumer Love - obsessively bringing the voice of the consumer into everything we do

  • Passion for High Performance – eagerness, extra energy & commitment to make a difference

Key Performance Indicators

  • New Business Wins

  • Delivery of annual individual goal plan ( OKR ), to be defined in discussion with your L ine M anager

  • Delivery of Sales Targets

  • Completion of all required admin – including, CRM system, Customer invoices, data approval letters , pricing forms and any other business requests

Additional Information

  • Extensive national travel and overnights required

  • Time off territory when required to drive products in other high footfall locations

  • Full manual driving licence required

  • Ad hoc attendance at Team Meetings (UK)

NOTES

About Unilever

Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 2 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world, including Dove, Tresemme, Lynx, Lifebuoy, Shea Moisture, Persil, Domestos, Ben & Jerry’s, Magnum, Marmite, The Vegetarian Butcher, Graze and Pot Noodle.

Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. That’s why our purpose is ‘to make sustainable living commonplace’

Location

In September 2020, Unilever announced the intention to build a new sustainable campus site in Kingston, London to house the employees who currently work in 100 Victoria Embankment in Blackfriars, Lever House in Kingston, Unilever House in Leatherhead and Graze in Richmond. We are creating our own Unilever sustainable, agile work environment, purposefully bringing us together in our own Unilever ecosystem. The campus is due to be completed in December 2023 and will consist of two interconnected buildings, as well as landscaped surrounding areas.

What We Offer

Not only do we offer a competitive salary and pension scheme, we also offer an annual bonus, free gym, a discounted staff shop and shares. You’ll have the opportunity to work directly with our renowned and exciting brands in a flexible and hybrid working environment.

Whilst the role is advertised on a full-time basis, we would be happy to discuss possible flexible working options and what this may look like for you. We are a key advocate of wellbeing and offer a variety of support for our people including hubs, programmes and development opportunities. We strive to achieve a family-friendly and inclusive workplace and to, above all, create possibilities for all.

Diversity at Unilever is about inclusion, embracing differences, creating possibilities and growing together for better business performance. We embrace diversity in our workforce. This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity. We are also more than happy to provide reasonable adjustments during our application and interview process to enable you to be present your best self.

Recruitment Fraud

Cyber criminals advertise fake job adverts with prestigious employers as a way of stealing information or even defrauding individuals out of money. In the most sophisticated cases, they will set up fake websites, which have a similar address to companies like Unilever. They even conduct fake telephone interviews and then offer candidates a role with the proviso they pay a fee for background checks or to cover work visa costs. These types of attacks are becoming more common as more people are looking for employment in the economic climate.

How is Unilever tackling this?

Many of Unilever’s recruitment sites publish a warning to candidates about recruitment fraud. The Cyber Security team also proactively scan for signs of people setting up fake Unilever sites and act to close them down.

What can I do?

If you become aware of potential recruitment fraud, spot fake Unilever recruitment adverts or fake LinkedIn profiles, report them via Una Live Chat.

Unilever does not accept responsibility or liability for any candidates who are financially impacted by recruitment fraud. Your vigilance is key!

#LI-Remote

title: newOffice Administration
company: Kate Dewhirst Health Law/Something Orange Training...
description:
Full-Time Office Magician – Come Join our Admin Team!

We are excited to recruit an additional administrative member who is eager to showcase their ability to support, collaborate and grow within an entrepreneurial team. This is a full-time position with benefits. Salary will be negotiated depending on experience.

This is a shared position with Kate Dewhirst Health Law (law firm) and our sister company Something Orange Training Inc. (training company) that both serve the health sector.

We need a collaborative, tech-savvy candidate who can carry out:

Scheduling:

  • Schedule all meetings and appointments for lawyers and trainings for instructors and liaise with clients

New Client Intake:

  • Open files and send information to new legal clients

Training, Events and Course Support:

  • Send emails to prospective clients to explain training options and fees
  • Send preparation information to booked clients to explain what to expect and how to prepare for training and receive their responses
  • Support trainers on Zoom – organize breakout rooms and accommodation of people who need special service in the session
  • Send follow up information and design satisfaction surveys for participants
  • Edit Zoom recordings
  • Post recordings and handouts on our training site (the platform is Moodle)
  • Support in-person events by liaising with vendors, caterers, locations and tech support
  • Sends marketing emails for events

Workflows:

  • Create, manage, update and follow workflows for office tasks in Monday.com and MyCase (a legal software)
  • Assist team members to manage their tasks by taking their work and transforming it into step-by-step actions and automation

Tech Support:

  • Liaise with external consultants on automation efforts and with IT service providers
  • Monitor, manage and stay up to date with our online systems and technology to support all team members including Outlook, Microsoft Suite, Adobe, Google docs, Zoom, Moodle, SendinBlue, word press, Survey Monkey, Monday.com, and others

Document design and formatting:

  • Make our content look beautiful (with the help of our design consultants)
  • Formatting including Excel spreadsheets and large word and PDF documents
  • Update website content of upcoming events
  • Collaborate with our external marketing coordinator on all social media/marketing initiatives

The successful candidate will love technology and learning new programs. You will have an advantage if you are a Monday.com pro and if you know how to create and manage workflows.

The candidate will have strong organizational, technical, administrative, time management and project management skills, be proactive, be a great communicator, be optimistic and kind to people, be accessible and friendly and be eager to learn and grow in a dynamic, ever-evolving environment.

This position is perfect for you if your natural instincts are to: see a project through to completion; identify inaccuracies; ask questions and confirm observations; rearrange transactions to speed up the process and design repeating patterns, sequential steps and procedures.

This position is not good for you if your natural instincts are to: stick with what’s working without questioning how it could be better; generalize; talk in the abstract; abandon projects after you start them; or provoke the unforeseen.

We encourage candidates from historically underrepresented groups.

About Kate Dewhirst Health Law and Something Orange Training Inc.

We are a law firm and training company for the health sector.

KDHL’s Mission is to build trust in the health sector. Our Values:

  • Wisdom: We reassure our clients with our deep lived experience.
  • Leading Change: We see the future and forge a path forward even when the way is bumpy.
  • Connection: We build relationships.
  • Colourful: We spark joy, beauty and inclusivity.
  • Service: We deliver more than expected.

SOTI’s Mission is to build confidence in the health sector. Our Values:

  • Simplicity: We create content that is easy to digest and implement.
  • Legacy: We leave a lasting impact.
  • Community: We believe individuals thrive in community.
  • Exploration: We are out there experimenting and trying new things.
  • Colourful: We spark joy, beauty and inclusivity.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Extended health care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • Front desk: 1 year (preferred)
  • Administrative experience: 5 years (preferred)
