title: Jr. Buyer - Analyst
description:
Who are we?

At Gambles, produce is everything. Our business provides the widest assortment of top-quality fruits and vegetables for the wholesale, foodservice and retail sectors. With a history dating back to the early 1900s, Gambles has grown and evolved into one of the largest produce distributors in Ontario. Our goal is to not only be the supplier of choice for all of our customers’ needs, but also an employer of choice for “top talent” candidates and employees.

Why Gambles?

Our people are the backbone of our business, which is why we are continuously looking to develop our people and bring star talent into our teams. We have a “promote-from-within” mentality, which means we put extra focus on developing our people and on giving them unique career advancement opportunities. Just like our products and our customer base, we love to see our people grow.

We offer a competitive benefits package with an employer covered health and dental benefits and a company matched Pension Program for our full-time employees who have at least 12 continuous months of service.

Our Locations

We operate out of two locations – the Ontario Food Terminal located at 165 The Queensway and our Distribution Centre at 302 Dwight Avenue.

The Ontario Food Terminal is Canada’s largest wholesale Produce Terminal. It ranks amongst the top four Terminal Markets in Canada and the United States by volume of produce distributed.

Gambles services a variety of customers out of the terminal including local farmers, local fruit and vegetable stores, independent supermarkets, restaurants, caterers, farmers’ markets, farm gate markets, florists, garden centers, landscapers, convenience stores and institutions and other foodservice operators.

Our Distribution Centre operation caters primarily to our program retail and foodservice accounts. These customers are looking for additional services including packaged and processed fruits and vegetables, and all orders are delivered directly to their door.

Job Description:

We are looking for a Junior Buyer Analyst to join our team in the unique, ever-changing produce industry. We need someone who is interested in produce and excited to build relationships with customers and suppliers while representing the Gambles brand. This role will report to our Buying team to support all aspects of buying/selling and analytics, as we develop ‘best-in-class’ processes to serve the needs of the customers.

The Junior Buyer Analyst will work primarily Monday through Friday and will work out of the Ontario Food Terminal location.

Main Responsibilities include:

  • Understudy to a buyer(s) with primary functions, including issuing of PO’s to our suppliers, follow-up with Operations on issues, and communication to Sales on availability of product.
  • Use your skills to provide analytical thinking and trending analysis on revenue, volume, and margin.
  • Liaison with assigned suppliers to obtain product information such as price, availability, and market conditions.
  • Take the lead on minimizing shrinkage/spoilage of fresh fruits and vegetables; work with buyers on quality and quantity issues; and lead time for orders.
  • Using historical information, discuss strategies with our buyers to help communicate favorable sales opportunities to sales groups.

Candidate Requirements and Qualifications:

  • Strong analytics background, with an intermediate level of Excel
  • Entrepreneurial spirited, business background and strength with numbers
  • Very good computer skills with previous experience using an ERP system
  • Knowledge and understanding of Microsoft Office 365
  • College diploma or University degree would be an asset
  • Previous produce knowledge and experience would be an asset

Competencies and Personal Attributes:

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Proven problem-solving and decision-making skills in a fast-paced environment
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently
  • Ability to collaborate with team members at all levels
  • Detail-oriented and well organized

We thank all those who apply for their interest but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Please note that Gambles Ontario Produce Inc., is an equal opportunity employer located in a heritage building with our main office at 165 The Queensway, Suite 240. During the recruitment process, if you require any accommodation please visit the Gambles website in order to notify us of your required arrangements.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

title: newCatering Manager
description:
Employment Opportunity


Catering Manager

Toronto, Canada


TO Live has a full-time opportunity in its Patron and Event Services Department in the role of Catering Manager. We are looking for a talented Caterer to join our team. TO Live is one of Canada’s largest multi-art organizations, we are the team behind three iconic venues: Meridian Hall, St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts and Meridian Arts Centre.


The Catering Manager will work closely with the Executive Chef and the Patron and Event teams to create seamless events.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Coordinate and oversee all catering elements relating to corporate and private events.
  • Coordinate and oversee all elements of artist and event riders.
  • Prepare proposals/estimates as required.
  • Work with Executive Chef, and Client to determine a proper menu for each event and coordinate menu planning meetings as required.
  • Distribute Event Orders to all appropriate departments to facilitate efficient purchasing, planning, and employee scheduling.
  • Attend meetings as required.
  • Conduct weekly catering briefing to review menus and set up requirements and to ensure last minute changes are communicated.
  • Work with Event Manager to create floor plans for all food and beverage elements according to the event requirements.
  • Design and execute setups to create excellent patron experiences.
  • Coordinate external vendors to fulfill event requirements. (Linen, equipment, flowers, etc.)
  • Respond to patron and staff concerns.
  • Establish and maintain excellent rapport with clients, prior to, during and post event

Administration

  • In conjunction with Event Managers ensure that all costs and expenditures are within the budgeted levels agreed upon in the estimate.
  • Keep financial and administrative records of any changes that may affect the final billing for each event.
  • Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports as required
  • Review and monitor approved budget goals including revenues, cost of materials and payroll
  • Input and update relevant event information into EBMS (Event Business Management Software) including completion of service and purchase orders.
  • Ensure billing accuracy
  • Assist in the ordering and the maintaining of inventory
  • Any and all other duties assigned by the Director of Patron and Event Services or their designate.

Staffing

  • Organize, lead, and motivate the catering team including but not limited to internal and external staffing resources to deliver event requirements.
  • manage the payroll
  • Determine appropriate number of service staff required to deliver on event requirements.
  • Lead and direct the work of Event Attendants including hiring, training, scheduling and supervising
  • Ensure that all employees project a positive, approachable, friendly, and professional image.
  • Work with outside staffing agencies to supplement event staffing requirements
  • Ensure health and safety regulations are strictly observed by all staff working during set-up for events and event day, as per Toronto Public Health and TO Live Covid-19 Workplace Safety guidelines.

JOB SPECIFICATIONS

  • Smart Serve Certified.
  • Minimum 3 years experience as a Catering Manager or similar role
  • Strong Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, Explorer & Outlook in a Windows operating environment.
  • Understanding of food and beverage allergies, religious food restrictions, sensitivities, and current food and event trends
  • Understanding of basic food and beverage sanitation
  • Ability to communicate with employees and other business contacts in a courteous and professional manner.
  • Ability to multi-task and organize
  • Strong time-management skills

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Must be familiar with working in a union environment and be aware of the working conditions set out in the Collective Bargaining agreement.
  • Variable hours of work depending on performance and event schedules
  • Lack of natural light in workplace.
  • Travel between TO Live venues as required.
  • Adhere to the TO Live Health & Safety policies and protocols including Covid vaccine and guidelines.

THE ORGANIZATION:


TO Live is one of Canada’s largest multi-arts organizations, operating three iconic venues: Meridian Hall, the St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts and Meridian Arts Centre. In addition, TO Live presents a full range of performing arts, theatrical and concert events at these venues in both downtown and uptown Toronto. With these two hubs of creativity and content creation, TO Live has a unique place and perspective to activate creative spaces by inspiring local and international artists, connect audiences and to be the nexus for new ideas, elevate artistic potential, and be the catalyst for creative expression that is reflective of Toronto’s diversity.


HOW TO APPLY:


Interested applicants should apply through our TO Live careers website at: https://tolive.bamboohr.com/jobs/


No phone calls or emails please. TO Live thanks all applicants in advance. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


Together with the Toronto Public Service’s (TPS) initiatives, which TO Lives follows and adheres too, TO Live encourages applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, persons with disabilities, women, LGBTQ2S persons, and others who may contribute to fostering innovative ideas and solutions.


We ask that you complete the questions provided as part of the online application to assist us in ensuring our recruitment process and programs are equitable and accessible. Your responses are voluntary and the information that you provide is strictly confidential.


We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environment in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). The Human Resources department will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.


Date Posted: May 06, 2022

Application Deadline: May 19, 2022

Start Date: As soon as possible

title: Dishwasher
description:
Job Identification
65
Job Category
Red Table Kitchen
Locations
  • 3790 98 St NW, Edmonton, AB, T6E 6B4, CA
Posting Date
03/09/2022, 10:55 AM
Job Schedule
Full time

Key Responsibilities

  • Adhere to safety policies and follow the sanitation standard operation procedure (SSOPs) to clean the facility areas and equipment
  • Washing pots, dishes, glasses, cups and all other kitchen equipment
  • Maintains cleanliness and organization of kitchen
  • Ensure the dishwashing area is always clean and free of debris
  • Report any damage, theft and abandoned articles to the Supervisor
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications

  • High School preferred but not mandatory
  • Working fluency and command of the English Language
  • Experience working in the kitchen and/or using a large industrial dishwasher is an asset
  • Food Safety is required
  • Current, valid First Aid certification is an asset
  • Must be able to move, lift, carry, pull, push, and place objects away weighing up to 25 lbs

Red Table is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.

About Us

For more than four decades, the people behind Red Table have specialized in providing quality food services and customized catering for a vast array of requirements, tastes and group sizes.

We have fed groups ranging from small, private events to the security personnel at the 2010 Vancouver Winter Olympics, and currently provide daily food service to thousands of people around the world.

This experience, innovation and commitment to quality forms the foundation for Red Table. From daily food service to special-event catering of events large and small, Red Table provides food and service of unprecedented quality in Alberta, including Edmonton area, Calgary and Fort McMurray.

We are proud members of the Leading Caterers of America!

title: Receptionist and Office Coordinator - Danone Canada
description:
About the job

Mission :

You will be responsible for the quality of life and work environment of our employees in the Toronto office.


About the position :


Receptionist :

  • Visitors' reception
  • Office access management
  • Receive and redirect caterers and lunches ordered.
  • Is responsible for UPS and FEDEX shipments and for ordering the necessary materials for orders (purchase orders, etc.)
  • Is responsible for receiving packages and notifying the people concerned.

Coordination of office spaces:

  • Animation of health and safety rules
  • Organization of activities and services for employees (tire change, car wash, vaccination, etc.)
  • Coordinate the logistics of events in both sites (room preparation, decoration, coordination of service providers, etc.)
  • Animation of the food offer
  • Cleanliness and organization of spaces
  • Maintenance of equipment belonging to Danone
  • Office furnitures
  • Administrative support

#LI-NORAM

About you
  • Minimum experience of 5 years, ideally as a receptionist, office coordinator, administrative support, health and safety, human resources
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Autonomy, decision-making, agility, multi-tasking
  • Excellent command of the Microsoft Office suite and at ease with new information and communication technologies.
  • Ease of working in a team and interacting with multiple interlocutors.
About us

Danone Canada is a business unit of Danone and operates from headquarter offices in Boucherville, Quebec, and Toronto, Ontario. Danone Canada is the country’s largest consumer-facing B Corporation, demonstrating that the company meets the highest standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency. We have 500+ employees across Canada engaged and energized to deliver Danone’s mission: Bringing health through to food to as many people as possible, by working on strong brands such as Activia, Oikos, Danone, Silk, International Delight and many others Come join our movement for a healthier world: One Planet. One Health BY YOU.


Danone Canada doesn’t just welcome what makes you unique, we value it. We’re proud to provide equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to cultural background, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression or age. Faithful to our values of openness and humanism, all of our employees share in the commitment to engage one another with dignity and respect.


Danone Inc. is committed to complying with its obligations under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Danone Inc. will make reasonable efforts to provide accommodation throughout its recruitment process, to the point of undue hardship, and will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process. Questions concerning the availability of accommodation in the recruitment process may be forwarded to INFORMATION@danone.com


Please note that this posting has been written in the masculine form solely to shorten the text. We promote diversity and encourage all people with the skills mentioned in this posting to apply for this position.

title: newExecutive Director
description:
The Club
The Club, located in Vancouver, operates food & beverage service several nights a week with various special events for members throughout the year on weekends and other evenings. It also includes kayak and SUP equipment rental for members, plus other marina services. The lounge space is available for rent for private events such as meetings, weddings, and celebrations.

The Role
Serve as the poised, professional, inviting first point of contact for the club, a driven self-starter who exudes service and hospitality and works well independently with minimal supervision and can take the initiative to improve all aspects of the Club including administration, marketing, basic bookkeeping, operations, and executive support to create a friendly, casual, yet first-class Member Experience.

Manage all aspects of the club including its staff, activities and the relationships between the Club and its Board of Directors, Committees, members, guests, employees, contractors, community, government, and industry. Maintain the electronic files, database, update the member portal/website weekly.

Develop and implement marketing and sales strategies coordinate with Membership Director on recruitment strategies towards attracting new members.

Continuously raise the bar for member satisfaction/engagement, employee service levels, and overall quality of dining and other experiences, including creating a pristine yet casual clubhouse, office, and boardroom that can be proudly shown to potential members or event planners at any time.

Coordinate and administer the club’s policies as defined by its Board of Directors and ensure that they support the organization’s values. Follow and document efficient and effective Standard Operating Procedures and manage the staff and the work of all department heads including accounting and food and beverage.

Implement and monitor the budget to ensure financial performance is met or exceeded, monitor the quality of the club’s products and services, and ensure optimal member and guest satisfaction.

Perform daily bookkeeping duties including billing and other basic transactions.

Secure and protect the club’s assets, including facilities and equipment.

Flexible hours to accommodate daytime deliveries and walk-ins while also being an occasional visible presence during member nights to pick up the pulse of the Club.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Office Administration:

  • Manage general office functions including responding to telephone and online inquiries on behalf of the Club and the distribution and control over security fobs, parking passes, keys, mail, supplies etc.
  • Maintain control over the Club administrative files and documents, both electronic and physical, including correspondence as required by the Board of Directors
  • Ensure content on the Club’s website and member portal is updated regularly and that an online newsletter is distributed weekly.
  • Maintain the integrity of the membership database
  • Oversee accounting functions including basic bookkeeping and financial management including budgets, financial reports, and KPIs relating to membership fees and other charges, wages and creditors, process daily transactions.

House Management:

  • Management of staff including accounting, administrative and food and beverage.
  • Promote, sell and manage all facility bookings including preparation of contracts, liaison with external event planners, catering contractor, and staff scheduling.
  • Liaise with Social Committee to create schedule of members’ social evenings beyond regular member nights, deemed “Social Events”, plus create a calendar of “Special Events” which will attract non-members to the club.
  • Manage house inventories (including beverages in conjunction with the Lounge Manager), Club apparel, etc.
  • Oversee efficient scheduling and management of Lounge Waitstaff with the Lounge Manager
  • Actively liaise with and manage the working relationship with the Club caterer

Member Liaison:

  • Manage recruitment, sales, and onboarding for new members
  • Manage and document member inquiries and complaints in a timely manner and report to the Board, on member issues, complaints and requests as required.
  • Demonstrate solid understanding of the Club Bylaws and Regulations when responding to members.

Promotion

  • Assist the club's Board of Directors in developing and executing promotional campaigns to enhance club image and grow membership
  • Assist the club's Board of Directors with annual advertising and promotion campaigns, to include related budget planning.
  • Provide support to the club's Boat Show coordinator, in accordance with the annually issued VIBS instructions, and
  • Act as point of contact with marketing and/or promotion vendors.

Facilities Management:

  • Manage repairs and scheduled maintenance, by arranging vendors, contractors, and staff for all aspects of the Club, including dock maintenance as identified by the Wharfinger and/or Rear Commodore House.

Board Relationship:

  • Liaise and assist the Board of Directors as required to streamline and simplify the execution of their duties
  • Prepare a monthly summary and/or electronic dashboard for the Board covering each area of operation
  • Coordinate Board meetings and distribution of minutes and related documents to members.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Experience

  • Post-Secondary Education in Business Administration and/or hospitality
  • A minimum five years' recent experience in a similar position
  • Experience in successfully arranging and creating, managing, coordinating events
  • Proven track record of securing new clients and increasing bookings and sales
  • Proven ability to work with financial reports. Bookkeeping certificate and equivalent experience an asset.
  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite software and Google products such as Google Drive, Calendar and Gmail
  • Experience with Club Management systems is desirable.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Discretion and the ability to handle confidential documentation with a high level of professionalism
  • Proven ability to provide excellent customer service and create and maintain effective working relationships with members, clients, external stakeholders, and staff
  • Exceptional organization skills, accuracy, attention to detail, strong sense of good judgment, and high level of customer service
  • A tenacious problem solver with the ability to lead each staff member to highest standards of performance and job satisfaction for lounge operations and events
  • Ability to successfully handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines
  • Excellent written and verbal communications
  • Good negotiation skills
  • A good sense of humour desirable.

Compensation: base salary commensurate with experience plus performance-based bonus based on goals reached in areas of overall performance including membership growth, banquet sales, operations management, event management, member engagement, and overall leadership.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $75,000.00-$100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Flextime
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off

Application question(s):

  • Can you reliably communicate to this jobs location?
  • Can you work overtime if necessary?
  • Are you willing to undergo a background check, in accordance with local law and regulations?

Experience:

  • management: 1 year (required)

title: newFinancial Controller
description:
Who We Are:

We believe people should never settle for boring baked goods, ever.

Coco Bakery in Mississauga, ON started as a small store front shop with just five employees. In less than 10 years, we have grown to become North America’s largest manufacturer of French macarons and other European pastries. We offer private-label products to diverse clients, such as restaurants, caterers, and major grocery retailers across the continent and globally.

Our mission is to produce the finest pastries and provide our customers with uplifting, delicious products.

Coco Bakery is part of Bond Bakery Brands, a stakeholder-focused investment platform started by three friends, which include Pace Processing and Product Development, Holy Napoli, and Portofino Bakery. Together, we are building better bakeries.

The Role:

We are looking for a highly motivated leader to join Coco Bakery as the Financial Controller. A positive, hands-on approach to getting the job done and effectively leading the team is what is needed to succeed in this role. The Financial Controller will report directly to the President and will work closely with senior management in the preparation and control of all departmental budgets across the organization. The major focus of this role will be, but is not limited to:

  • Play a key role in SAP Business One implementation; manage the AR/AP processing in both SAP and SAGE50 until fully implemented.
  • Oversee the entire financial administration.
  • Prepare cash flow forecasts for Canadian & US bank accounts; purchase US funds for payables forecasted due.
  • Analysis, measurement, interpretation and reporting of cost inventory data.
  • Recommend accounting policies and procedures to maintain accounting controls and financial security by following internal controls.
  • Project controlling, monitoring the financial and administrative status of existing and new projects.
  • Liaise with banks, auditors, and insurance carriers, act as signing authority for credit applications on behalf of the Company.
  • Responsible for all major G/L account analysis and reconciliations.
  • Oversee the entire finance function (A/P, A/R) with 1-2 direct reports.
  • Monthly financial reporting (Income statement and balance sheet).
  • Prepare and manage product P&Ls to ensure profitable GM%.
  • Actively participate in developing Company’s strategic goals.
  • All other duties as assigned and required by the Company.

Requirements:

  • CA, CPA, or CGA designation required
  • Minimum 5 years financial accounting experience in a food manufacturing environment
  • Must have experience with Sage50 and SAP Business One or similar software
  • Exceptional financial presentation ability with strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong business acumen and excellent knowledge of excel
  • Solutions oriented with a result driven mindset
  • Ability to travel 5% - 10%, flexibility to work outside of regular business hours as required
  • Strong proficiency in MS Office and other systems.

Inclusivity Statement:
At Coco Bakery, we believe that diversity of experience, opinion and background is fundamental to our future growth. We believe success happens where new ideas can flourish – in an environment where people from various backgrounds can work productively together. Coco Bakery is committed to creating a diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, or age.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $90,000.00-$120,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • financial accounting: 4 years (required)
  • SAP: 2 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • CPA, CGA (preferred)

title: newAdministrative Coordinator
description:
Company:
Salesfloor is an award-winning virtual selling platform that combines clienteling, virtual selling and mobile point of sale tools. Store associates use Salesfloor to deliver personalized and convenient experiences for customers on any channel through live chat, video calling, e-mail, SMS and more.

Today, 45,000 product experts from stores around the world have driven more than $2 billion in sales (USD) using Salesfloor. Salesfloor is redefining the role of today's associate to drive sales and differentiate the customer experience.
Founded in 2013 in Montreal, Canada, Salesfloor is a profitable company, on a mission to unlock the power of today's omnichannel sales associates by connecting them with shoppers online and in-store. Our team of “Salesfloorians” believe that associates are product experts, trusted advisors and social influencers for customers in their local communities. In today's omnichannel world, retail chains have a unique opportunity to leverage their biggest competitive asset: their people.
Role Overview:
The Administrative Coordinator is an important member of the HR team who supports the day-to-day operations of the office and HR function. The Coordinator provides ongoing administrative support in a variety of functions such as office coordination, billing, expense reports, credit card reconciliations, recordkeeping/data entry, onboarding/offboarding, maintaining employee relationships, social event planning and supporting the recruitment function. The role requires someone with strong interpersonal skills, a positive attitude, professionalism and a naturally discrete approach in order to enhance the employee experience.
Responsibilities:
Office Management

  • Oversee and manage our office facilities and relationship with suppliers.
  • Order equipment and supplies for new hires
  • Manage licenses and accesses to Google Workspace environment and third-party cloud-based software.
  • Handle caterers for the office weekly lunches.
  • Coordinate CNESST Health & Safety (First Aid, Fire Drill, etc.) programs and processes.
  • Orchestrate internal and external events and activities.
  • Manage and upkeep our swag and office supply inventory.
  • Coordinate shipment of new hire swag and tech packages.
  • Coordinate travel for employees

Accounting Support

  • Responsible for expense reports review, reconciliation and posting to accounting system
  • Responsible for corporate credit card review, reconciliation and posting to accounting system
  • Responsible for accounts payable inbox, approval of vendors invoices and posting to accounting system
  • Responsible of vendors payments through credit card and printed cheques

Human Resources Support

  • Responsible for maintaining all electronic employee records.
  • Owner of the onboarding and offboarding processes to ensure a positive candidate/employee experience
  • Keep our HRIS system (BambooHR) up to date including new hires, transfers, salary changes, promotions, terminations, etc.
  • Assist with reviewing policies, procedures, and keep documents up to date
  • Lead our social committee, create the monthly newsletter, and ensure expectations are followed up on.
  • Respond to people-related inquiries or requests.
  • Prepares confirmation of employment letters, as requested.

Requirements:

  • 3 year(s): Administration support, Accounting, Customer Service or HR experience required.
  • DEC diploma or equivalent, Bachelor's degree preferred.
  • Excellent computer proficiency. (MS Office, Google Suite, Quickbooks Online)
  • Naturally curious, you are not afraid to step out of your comfort zone to learn new things.
  • You like solving problems and are self-motivated to make recommendations to improve things when you see opportunities for them to be even better.
  • Detail oriented and excellent communication and writing skills are required; fluent English and French (spoken and written).
  • Knowledge of Accounting basics skills and experience would be considered an asset
  • Knowledge of HR practices and familiarity of basic employment laws and compliance issues would be considered an asset.
  • Able to work independently, but you also enjoy teamwork and understand the importance of working collaboratively.
  • Strong organizational, analytical, problem solving and time management skills with the ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • You are able to deal with sensitive and confidential information.
  • Position requires presence to the office 2-3 days per week (Tuesday and Thursday mandatory)

Perks:

  • While our office in Montreal is available to everyone, a flexible work from home program is currently the norm.
  • Health care and dental coverage for all full time employees (Blue Cross)
  • National telemedicine service, paid for by the company for full time employees enrolled in our benefits program.
  • Generous compensation and remote work spending account.
  • Everyone at Salesfloor is agile, engaged and ready to contribute to impact the growth of our business.
  • Seasoned employees, new hires and founders all work together and help each other every day.
  • Founders and leadership team have a proven track record for successful start-ups and previous exits.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Kitchen Worker
description:
Job Identification
112
Job Category
Operations
Locations
    AB, Canada
Posting Date
01/31/2022, 01:06 PM
Job Schedule
Full time

Job Description

Key Responsibilities

The responsibilities of a Kitchen Worker include, but are not limited to:

  • Assist with putting away groceries using the First In, First Out method (FIFO).
  • Sanitize, sweep, and mop the kitchen/dining room floor as directed.
  • Maintain cleanliness and organization of kitchen and dining area.
  • Take out garbage and clean the garbage area.
  • Replenish desserts, beverages and condiments as needed.
  • Assist with inventory.
  • Report any damage, theft and abandoned articles to the Supervisor.
  • Adhere to safety policies and procedures by following company safe work practices and standard operating procedures.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Experience working in a kitchen is required.
  • Food Safety certification valid in the province of Alberta for the duration of your employment is a requirement.
  • Advance Food Safety is considered an asset.
  • Current, valid First Aid certification is an asset.
  • Excellent communication skills in English, both verbal and written.
  • Must be able to move, lift, carry, pull, push, and place objects away weighing up to 50 lbs.

Civeo is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.

About Us

For more than four decades, the people behind Red Table have specialized in providing quality food services and customized catering for a vast array of requirements, tastes and group sizes.

We have fed groups ranging from small, private events to the security personnel at the 2010 Vancouver Winter Olympics, and currently provide daily food service to thousands of people around the world.

This experience, innovation and commitment to quality forms the foundation for Red Table. From daily food service to special-event catering of events large and small, Red Table provides food and service of unprecedented quality in Alberta, including Edmonton area, Calgary and Fort McMurray.

We are proud members of the Leading Caterers of America!

title: newFood Store Associate
description:
Globally we deliver over 320,000 authentic, world-class meals every day, these meals are dished up by our portfolio of brands - dnata, Alpha Flight Group, Alpha LSG and En Route. Working to stringent deadlines and exacting standards, we take pride in every smile our dishes evoke - a trait recognized by numerous airlines around the world. Over the years we have been awarded best caterer by a wide number of airlines and are driven by a desire to deliver for our customers, and their customers, every day. We are excited to be opening our 64th dedicated catering unit in Vancouver, Canada. Our Vancouver start-up is a unique opportunity to be part of a new team that will help us write the next chapter of our success story!

Why join dnata?

  • Be part of a small start-up team, with great opportunity for growth
  • Be part of a global award winning group
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Cover
  • Additional co-contributions towards your retirement fund
  • Paid annual vacation
  • Over-time premiums
  • Free daily meal
Role

Food Store Associate will act as the first point of contact for food store items and will help staff with information and support in procuring food store items. This individual will ensure supplier's and staff compliance with store policies and regulations along with the followings:

  • Responsible for accepting, inspecting, stocking, and transferring deliveries.
  • Be able to unload material from incoming shipments/deliveries and organize materials appropriately.
  • Inspect all the contents for damages and volume.
  • BE able to stay (for long periods of time) in Freezer and chillers as required.
  • Collaborate with all relevant stakeholders, such as suppliers and shipper.
  • Manage and return wrong shipments.
  • Handle and document invoices with attention to details.
  • Keep records and help with inventory control.
  • Other duties include managing conditions of food store displays, ensuring the storage spaces are clean, stocking products, and processing orders.
  • Be mindful of all safety hazards/concerns within the work environment and ensure all safety issues are reported to the appropriate individuals.
  • Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities.
  • Adaptable and able to work within tight deadlines, demonstrating flexibility.
  • Other reasonable duties as requested by management.
Qualifications/ skills/ experience / knowledge:
  • High school diploma or equivalent qualification required.
  • Working knowledge of computer programs for entering data is an advantage.
  • Previous working experience as receiving clerk is an advantage.
  • Certification for operating forklift will be considered as an advantage.
  • Able to communicate effectively with colleagues and supervisors.
  • Must be able to work on a shift basis in a 24-hour operation.
  • Must be able to work in COLD environment, ranging from below 0 degrees (i.e., inside freezers) to 10+ degrees Celsius.
  • Must be able to lift, push, pull, and move product, equipment, and supplies.
  • Close attention to detail, the ability to use inventory software, and strong organizational skills.
  • Hand on experience with entry data software
  • Math and recording abilities.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills

title: newSenior Executive Assistant
description:
Senior Executive Assistant

The OFIFC is an award-winning leader in culture-based management providing innovative research, policy, training and community development to 29 Friendship Centres and other urban Indigenous service providers across Ontario. Located in downtown Toronto, the OFIFC engages all levels of government and mainstream agencies.

OFIFC is a purpose-driven organisation which offers unique and challenging work. A rewarding and enriching career awaits if you are skilled at critical thinking, building relationships, take personal accountability for getting things done and enjoy working as part of a team to collaboratively solve problems.

Responsibilities:

To provide effective and efficient varied administrative functions that support the Chief Executive Officer and ensures administrative processes are aligned with OFIFC’s long-range strategic plan.

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma/GED combined with minimum 5 years of senior executive administrative experience
  • Post-secondary education in office administration or a related discipline desirable
  • Past experience working in an Indigenous organisation is considered an asset
  • Outstanding organisational skills (includes time, space and task management)
  • Excellent communication skills (including listening, oral, written and telephone/email)
  • High proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, etc.)
  • Proficiency with office equipment (computer, fax, photocopier, scanner, etc.)
  • Strong listening, oral and written communication skills; and
  • Criminal Reference Clearance (CPIC) and Vulnerable Sector Clearance are requirements of the employment offer.

A job description is below

Posting Date: May 2022, until filled

VISION

Primary Objective:

To provide a wide variety of administrative duties, ensuring Chief Executive Officer administrative support requirements are met.

KNOWLEDGE

Core Competencies:

  • Culture - Takes personal responsibility to increase sensitivity, awareness and implementation of OFIFC’s Neha (bundle) including foundational teachings and organisational practices in both professional conduct and work-related deliverables.
  • Accountability - Takes personal ownership and responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work commitments.
  • * C*ritical Thinking - Applies systematic, logical reasoning when addressing problems or situations in order to arrive at an appropriate solution or outcome.
  • * B*uilding Relationships and Strategic Partnerships - Builds, develops and sustains business relationships / strategic partnerships that are mutually beneficial, reciprocal and grounded in trust and respect. It is recognising we are all interdependent and working towards the common good of the organisation.
  • * R*esults Orientation - Accomplishes established goals, delivers the outcomes required and achieves the results. It includes the efficient and effective use of all resources (time, financial, people and technology).
  • * Teamwork and Collaboration* - Works collaboratively with others and addresses conflict in a win-win productive manner. This includes a mindset of sharing with others whether it is knowledge, recognition, information and skills. Working towards a common purpose for the good of OFIFC and the communities of people it serves.
  • Communication - Effectively delivers information in a transparent, honest and clear manner. It includes actively listening, comprehending and responding appropriately when interacting with people. It is about being respectful when expressing opinions and points of view.

*
*Behavioural Competencies:

  • Dependability
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Confidentiality
  • Proactive / Takes Initiative
  • Judgement/Decision Making
  • Team Player

REASON

Work Environment:

Works in a safe and suitable office environment faced with constant interruptions and performs multiple tasks with simultaneous and tight deadlines. Exposed to mid to high level computer use requiring high levels of accuracy and attention to detail. From time to time is responsible for lifting supplies and materials.

Working Hours:

Flexible 40 hour work week that include evenings and weekends as requested for administrative support needs. Overtime hours may be necessary to meet work deadlines. Travel 3 – 4 times per year to attend Board meetings, OFIFC AGM within Ontario e support needs. Overtime hours may be necessary to meet work deadlines. Travel 3 – 4 times per year to attend Board meetings, OFIFC AGM within Ontario.

ACTION

Scope:

To provide effective and efficient varied administrative functions that support the Chief Executive Officer and ensures administrative processes are aligned with OFIFC’s long-range strategic plan.

Key Contacts/Relationships:

Internal

Primarily communicates with the Chief Executive Officer, the Management team and Administrative staff.

External

Communicates and coordinates with Suppliers/Vendors (including hotels, caterers, flight centres, etc.) to ensure administrative deliverable's are met. Assists in the contracting process by obtaining and researching quotes for promotional items. Communicates with Friendship Centre Executive Directors and Board members for travel and hotel logistics. Regular contact with Government schedulers and policy advisers to coordinate the Chief Executive Officer’s calendar.

Key Responsibilities:

Chief Executive Officer Administrative Support (75%):

  • Drafts, prepares, formats and distributes a variety of word documents, spreadsheets, and presentations as required;
  • Ensures that the Chief Executive Officer be kept aware of schedules, meetings, appointments and that required materials are provided;
  • Ensures appropriate follow up on tasks and assignments delegated by the Chief Executive Officer;
  • Schedules, coordinates, reconciles and sets up internal/external meeting room logistics involving senior level executives and/or Government Officials;
  • Attends meetings as required and ensures that agendas and other meeting materials are prepared;
  • Updates and maintains electronic databases (contact lists, Chief Executive Officer assigned work) and Chief Executive Officer Outlook calendar;
  • Assists Chief Executive Officer in management of issues/files by ensuring issues are tracked, priority access assigned and time management pressures are addressed;
  • Answers basic inquiries, including incoming and outgoing telephone/email communications, screens calls, assists callers and redirects calls as necessary;
  • Coordinates Chief Executive Officer’s travel and workshop logistics (includes registrations, reconciliations, materials, hotels, caterers, flights, transfers, etc.);
  • Files Chief Executive Officer correspondence in accordance with OFIFC’s Records Management program;
  • Retrieves filed documents in a timely manner when requested;
  • Researches, obtains quotes, purchases and maintains OFIFC promotional materials;

OFIFC Board of Directors Administrative Support (20%):

  • Assists Board members with hotel and travel logistics;
  • Attends Board meetings and Board committee meetings providing administrative and technical support including meeting minutes, preparation and distribution of records and that follow up occurs as directed;

Other (5%):

  • Maintains and upgrades professional skills;
  • Promotes a healthy, safe work environment; and
  • Performs other duties, related to the position, as assigned by the Chief Executive Officer or designate.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Event Coordinator – CDL-Rockies
description:
The Creative Destruction Lab-Rockies (CDL-Rockies) in the Haskyane School of Business invites applications for a Event Coordinator. This Full-time Fixed Term position is for approximately 1 year (based on length of grant funding), with the possibility of extension.

The Creative Destruction Lab-Rockies (CDL-Rockies) is a cohort-based, university-linked, new venture mentorship program at the Haskayne School of Business. CDL-Rockies helps innovators transition from science projects to high-growth companies, inviting some of the world’s top, early-stage technology ventures to Calgary for this innovative 9-month program. After a rigorous application and selection process, the CDL-Rockies program engages senior entrepreneurial leaders, as well as noted scientists, economists, investors and graduate students in the support of new venture founders with a goal to prepare these founders for seed stage financing and accelerated growth.

Reporting to the Associate Director, Engagement, the Event Coordinator will work closely with all members of the CDL-Rockies team to execute a variety of special events. This includes (but is not limited to) the planning, coordination and execution of events supporting the recruitment of ventures, alumni events, and other stakeholder engagement events.

This position normally works Monday to Friday, 8:30 A.M. to 4:30 P.M, 7 hours per day (35 hours per week), although extended or alternative hours (evenings and weekends) and travel will be required based on the needs of CDL-Rockies. This position is required to maintain complete confidentiality regarding all business matters and to exercise a high degree of professionalism in the execution of their duties.

Position description:

Summary of Key Responsibilities (job functions include but are not limited to):

  • Working closely and in collaboration with the Engagement Advisor to plan, coordinate and execute a variety of special events, both virtually and in person, for a variety of CDL-Rockies’ stakeholders
  • Advising on and coordinating all event logistics
  • Creating a budget and tracking expenses, managing the event to the budget
  • Managing all event RSVPs, calendar invitations, attendance lists
  • Providing excellent customer services to all involved stakeholders
  • Coordinating event debriefs and evaluation of event success
  • Make significant contributions to the CDL-Rockies Stakeholder Engagement strategy, including tracking KPI’s for reporting and strategy evaluation, and reviewing and analyzing stakeholder survey responses
  • Continuously seek to improve the CDL-Rockies’ stakeholder experience through new approaches or engagement opportunities and support the implementation of those improvements
  • Advise on and support the implementation and execution of various Stakeholder Engagement activities and initiatives, as required
  • Support the planning and preparation for CDL session days (4 times per year), either virtual or in-person
  • Fill a variety of session roles, including (in-person) attending the registration desk, interacting with external vendors (caterers, etc.), room setup; or (virtual) hosting small group meetings, digital check-in, or transcribing conversations into slack

Qualifications / Requirements:

  • A University undergraduate degree or equivalent in event planning and management and/or project management
  • A minimum of 3 years of full-time work experience, including experience coordinating high-quality, complex virtual and in-person events
  • Experience with Salesforce (or a similar CRM system)
  • Experience working with start-ups, technology accelerators, early-stage technologies companies, venture capital, or within an organization directly supporting early-stage or science-based technology
  • Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office applications, AirTable, and Slack
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) and excellent listening skills
  • Ability to handle ambiguity and work effectively in a large, complex, dynamic and sophisticated organization
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects or priorities simultaneously, strong organization and problem-solving skills
  • Demonstrated professionalism, tact and maturity in handling highly sensitive and confidential information ethically and with discretion
  • Must be a self-starter with the ability to independently move projects forward, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  • Previous experience working within the non-profit sector, alumni relations, or in a donor relations capacity is an asset

Application Deadline: February 18, 2022

We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.

Interested candidates can submit their applications using the following link.

title: newSupervisor, Office Services
description:
At McCarthy Tétrault, we offer challenging and rewarding career opportunities and are delighted to have been selected for the tenth consecutive year in 2022 as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers and one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers. Our culture is built on professional excellence, collaboration, innovation, thought leadership and entrepreneurialism. We embrace inclusion in all its forms and we provide the tools and opportunities to help our people develop to their full potential.

As a Supervisor, Office Services, you will be:

  • Supervising the coordination of all aspects of client and internal meetings, events, activities, visitor management and security for the McCarthy Tétrault Conference Centres, including:
  • Act as first point of escalation for internal and external clients related to attendance at the Conference Centres.
  • Ensuring all documentation, including Meeting and Event Summaries, security sign in, catering orders and all other meeting/event related documents are completed.
  • Ensure all activities related to meeting or events are executed according to plan, being proactive and raising issues as required
  • Coordinates the requirements of the Conference Centres with the kitchen and catering personnel.
  • Liaises with Facilities about the general maintenance and safety procedures of the Conference Centres.
  • Oversee the delivery and assist in defining the service offerings in the conference centres in a specific region.
  • Fostering strong internal and external client relationships as they relate to use of the Firm’s conference centres for client-initiated events.
  • Works with the outsourced teams and Events Manager, Conference Services to ensure successful planning, execution and review of all events.
  • Collaborating with events team to maintain a network of internal and external contacts (e.g. caterers, restaurants, equipment rentals, suppliers for specialty linens and other event-related incidentals).
  • Work in partnership with the Manager, Conference Services to manage and control all operating expenses and to prepare weekly and monthly summary reports.
  • Overseeing the smooth operation of all bookings nationally through the management of the front line team members, and providing support and backup when necessary.
  • Ensures compliance with all legal, legislative, health & safety, and employment handbook requirements.
  • Preparing team staffing schedules and allocating resources to maintain reception coverage for short-term needs Reporting unusual requirements, recommendations or resolutions to the Manager, Conference Services.
  • Other duties as assigned.

People Leadership

  • In collaboration with the Manager, Conference Services, promoting and maintaining positive employee relations within the national team.
  • Managing the performance of direct reports and providing continual feedback on outsourced employees at the Firm. Consistently model the leadership behaviors and reinforce the learning concepts needed to create a service culture.
  • Ensuring the ongoing development of team members’ skills to ensure functional and Firm objectives are met.
  • Managing all aspects of recruitment, selection, performance management (including goal setting), compensation and development for direct reports.

As our ideal candidate, you will have:

  • High school diploma. Post-secondary diploma or certificate in a hospitality/tourism management or business administration program preferred.
  • Three to five years of related experience, preferably in a professional services environment.
  • Two to three years’ experience in a supervisory position is preferred.
  • Broad and deep understanding of events and conference services.
  • Demonstrated computer proficiency. Excellent understanding of Microsoft Office computer software and other office equipment. Ability to learn new internal systems and software quickly and coach others on same.
  • Exceptional customer focus; strong professional judgement.
  • Works well under pressure and adjusts to changing needs. Proven ability to multi-task while demonstrating composure and the ability to handle stress and tight timelines.
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills and telephone manners, with a strong professional demeanour. Personable, approachable disposition.
  • Highly developed problem solving, decision making, conflict management and negotiation skills, including the ability to successfully resolve performance and disciplinary issues.
  • Confidence in making day-to-day decisions and judgement to know when to escalate and seek Manager’s input or assistance.
  • Ability to handle confidential information and exercise discretion in dealing with staff and/or sensitive issues.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop team capabilities and cohesiveness through coaching and mentoring.
  • Excellent communications skills in English (verbal and written) are required. Fluency in French would be considered an asset.
  • Flexible schedule to accommodate nights, weekends and public holidays as business dictates.

As a member of the McCarthy team, you will have access to:

  • Outstanding benefits from day one, including insurance premiums paid by the Firm and wellness and technology reimbursements.
  • Competitive compensation and generous time off, including a day off to volunteer and a day off for your birthday.
  • A commitment to professional development and growth opportunities for our people at all levels, supported by a culture that fully embraces and encourages two-way feedback.
  • Strong community involvement and a commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.
  • A collaborative, cohesive culture that connects lawyers and business teams through collective purpose.

We thank all applicants for their interest in McCarthy Tétrault; however, only chosen applicants will be contacted. We regret that we are unable to respond to individual inquiries about application status. McCarthy Tétrault is an equal opportunity employer that fosters an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment. Please notify us if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Operation Supervisor
description:
Seeking an individual who has strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of constituencies in a fast paced diverse community. CLS Catering Services (part of LSG Sky Chef & Cathay Pacific) offers you the opportunity to be part of the inner workings of an exciting industry in a diverse and dynamic environment.

Job Description:

  • Lead multifaceted teams towards achieving goals related to Health and Safety, Quality, and Productivity throughout the facility.
  • Manage retail department day-to-day operations to ensure on-time delivery according to MPS.
  • Review processes and implement process improvements in line with company best practices.
  • Develop, implement and maintain training activities.
  • Perform root cause analysis on any quality issues and report same to QA department.
  • Manage assembly processes according to optimal food cost control.
  • Conduct internal audits as required to ensure compliance with policies and procedures.
  • Ensure adherence to company policies regarding safety, security, and quality regulations.
  • Manage direct labour hours according to budget.
  • Create labour schedules according to business needs.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications/Experience:

  • Minimum 3 years of experience in food industry.
  • Valid driver’s license, and able to meet security clearance requirements for ramp access.
  • Must be able to supervise workforce including; coaching, directing and motivating.
  • Motivated self-starter with good communication skills (written and verbal).
  • Require to work in a cold environment (0 – 4 degrees Celsius).
  • Process oriented with good organizational abilities.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Excellent customer relations skills.

In return, we offer an excellent compensation program including competitive salary, safety shoes reimbursement, and hot meal supplied when working. Please note that all employment is contingent upon the selected candidate’s successful clearance of all compliance requirements such as a clear medical and criminal record.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Join the CLS Catering Services Team! CLS Catering Services Ltd. is a joint venture of Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd. & LSG Sky Chefs, the world’s largest airline caterer and provider of integrated services solutions. These include catering, buy-on-board, in-flight equipment logistics, consulting and lounge services. The company’s extensive know-how in culinary excellence and logistics has led to its’ successful entry in adjacent markets, such as train services and retail. In addition to providing catering service for airlines, we service retail customers such as Starbucks. CLS Catering Services operates in Toronto, Vancouver and Calgary airports and has been an industry leader in Canada well over 30 years.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (required)

Experience:

  • Supervising: 1 year (preferred)
  • Food Manufacturing: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Canadian Resident (required)

title: Specialist, Events
description:
Goodmans LLP is internationally recognized as one of Canada’s leading and most innovative law firms, offering market leading expertise in M&A, corporate, securities and finance, private equity, real estate, tax, restructuring, litigation and other business-related specialties. We are a community of committed, talented, hardworking professionals who are motivated by exceeding our clients’ expectations, with a law firm culture that is second to none.

Reporting to the Team Leader, the Specialist, Events is responsible for the planning, coordination and execution of a variety of firm events for both internal and external clients. The successful candidate will have strong communication and client service skills, and will be highly organized and adaptable. This position requires flexible hours to accommodate the firm’s needs.

Specific responsibilities include:

  • Approaching tasks and events with a creative mindset, looking outside the box to add unique and fun touches to firm events
  • Managing, planning, implementing and executing all aspects of onsite, virtual and offsite firm events, this includes; site inspections, catering, audio visual, signage, rentals, décor/ambience, entertainment, staffing requirements, etc.;
  • Managing and facilitating firm Zoom account for meetings and events;
  • Communicating with internal/external clients to identify needs and requirements to ensure guest satisfaction;
  • Hosting and managing event planning meetings with broader team and/or committee members;
  • Supporting facilitation of our Client Floor which includes; auditing/setting up of meetings & events, Reception coverage and Client Floor leadership as needed;
  • Creating and archiving appropriate planning documentation which includes and not limited to; event proposals, Banquet Event Order (BEO), budget sheets, critical paths, creation of invites, event posters, and floorplans;
  • Maintaining firm event calendar;
  • Maintaining relationships with suppliers, vendors, and caterers and staying up-to-date on market trends;
  • Managing and maintaining budgets, invoices, and inventory for all events and communicating to relevant parties;
  • Identifying opportunities for improvement and making recommendations to the Team Leader, Client Services;
  • Assisting with other firm projects, activities and events as needed;
  • Participating in industry associations such as TLOEPA, MPI, PCMA, etc;
  • Providing assistance to others during absences as needed;
  • Other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate possesses:

  • A college diploma or equivalency;
  • A Certified Meeting Planner (CMP) designation;
  • 3-5 years of relevant experience within a professional services environment;
  • Valid Drivers License;
  • Advanced proficiency in MS Office applications including Word, Adobe, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint;
  • Advanced knowledge of Zoom Meeting and Webinar functions;
  • Proficiency in role-specific software, including Visio, Canva and meeting room software scheduling program; and
  • Advanced written & verbal communication skills, a self-starter with a strong work ethic, and a team player with excellent client service skills.

Please note that in light of Goodmans LLP/Goodlaw Services Limited Partnership’s COVID-19 vaccination policy, applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment from the firm will be required to provide proof of being fully vaccinated with all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada. Individual requests for accommodation will be considered on the basis of medical grounds and/or because of creed/religion.

Goodmans LLP is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives. Goodmans LLP invites applications from all qualified candidates. For applicants with disabilities requiring accommodation at any point in the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Events Manager
description:
Events Manager


Job Description


About Penny Appeal Canada


Penny Appeal Canada is a relief organization with a really BIG vision for the world. We want to create the best societies we can and to break the cycles of need and poverty for good. That’s why we work to turn small change into a BIG DIFFERENCE. We are a proud member of a global Penny Appeal family that celebrated its 10-year anniversary in 2019. Penny Appeal was first set up to provide poverty relief across Asia, the Middle East, and Africa by offering water solutions, organizing mass feedings, supporting orphan care, and providing emergency food and medical aid. Since then, we have transformed lives and empowered communities around the world and right here at home. Our vision is a world that’s united and strong. Communities working together, supporting one another, leaving need and poverty behind for good.


Penny Appeal Canada’s approach to charity is simple, yet has a massive impact. We make charitable giving affordable and rewardable, ensuring everyone can help those in need by donating just a few pennies, or cents, each day. Penny Appeal Canada is one of the fastest growing charities in Canada.


Events Manager


Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, we are looking for a competent Events Manager to oversee and organize events that will make an impact on a target audience. You will ensure events are successful and cost-effective, paying attention to budget and time constraints. You are also a project manager who understands marketing and promotion techniques. We want to see enthusiastic candidates with fresh ideas and the organizational skills required to not leave anything about an event to chance.


Key areas of responsibility


  • Design, negotiate and manage nationwide tours
  • Design, negotiate and manage national conventions
  • Design, negotiate and manage Fundraising Banquets
  • Design, negotiate and manage Feedback tours
  • Design, negotiate and manage organizational meetings
  • Successfully source financial sponsorships for events
  • Create and manage national database of venues and event spaces
  • Create and manage national database of diverse talent in various fields
  • Inspect and evaluate all venues and lodging as well as any related services for national tours and events
  • Select key suppliers, prepare budgets, create contracts and arrange for payment in compliance with organizational guidelines and processes.
  • Must find the most productive, cost-effective venues with consistently high standard of quality and service formats for meetings and events.
  • Develop and maintain strong business relationships with resource and service providers, including: hotels, transportation companies, caterers, entertainment companies, audio/visual companies, etc.
  • Evaluate and select outside contractors and vendors who can provide quality products and services at the lowest possible prices, ensuring availability when needed.
  • Evaluate vendor quotations that utilize appropriate negotiation and purchasing techniques to ensure quality, price, delivery and service.
  • Execute administrative tasks including but not limited to Payment Requests, Fund Collection Forms. Event projection Forms, etc.
  • Work closely with the Marketing & Communications, #TeamOrange and Fundraising departments and other colleagues and serve as point of contact/liaison for all National Event Tours and Conventions.
  • Generate reports to monitor and evaluate success of events and programs.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Communications

  • Create promotion schedules to market events
  • Send out communication touchpoints to volunteers and staff
  • Lead staff and volunteer orientation prior to events
  • Lead staff and volunteer debriefing sessions


Requirements


Qualifications & Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent combination of education and work.
  • Excellent interpersonal communications skills, both verbal and written.
  • Strong attention to detail, time management, networking and multi-tasking skills.
  • Experience in creating and managing multiple event budgets.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and achieve objectives.
  • Project management experience preferred.
  • Strong people skills with the ability to motivate others and functions as a team player.
  • Able to coordinate with and delegate to others.
  • Proficient in MS Office Suite, Web research, Blackbaud CRM
  • Strong sense of ownership over projects and tasks, and be able to identify new opportunities.
  • Must be willing to work evenings and weekends
  • Must be willing to travel nationwide regularly
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada

Compensation and Start Date


This full-time position is remote based, with health benefits, and competitive salary compensation. Start date is March 2022.


Please Note: Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Desktop Publishing Assistant
description:
The BC Nurses’ Union (BCNU) is a strong, dynamic voice for nurses and nursing in British Columbia, representing more than 45,000 members. BCNU provides collective agreement negotiation and support to its members, as well as professional and advocacy services in the field of research, clinical practice, leadership and education. As the voice of the nursing profession in the province, we advocate for nurses and patients to ensure safe, quality, public health care for all.

Job Title: Desktop Publishing Assistant/ Graphic Designer

Maternity Leave Contract

Posting #: MOVEUP-012-22

Bargaining Unit: MoveUP

Pay Grade: Category 6

Starting: May 2022

Position Overview
This position is responsible for designing and producing materials within BCNU's Communications Department.
Key Responsibilities
Designs and produces materials within the Communications Department.
  • Produces a wide range of communications materials utilizing Adobe Creative Cloud, such as InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop.
  • Consistently applies the BCNU Brand Guidelines to the creation, customization and editing of graphics and photos for digital and print production including, but not limited to, the following channels:
  • Marketing collateral (posters, leaflets, etc.)
  • Website graphics
  • BCNU Update Magazine
  • Works collaboratively alongside fellow designers and department colleagues to complete tasks to a high standard of achievement.
  • Maintains the department’s database of videos and images.
Event organizing
  • May be required to administer the events application process and related communications.
  • Ensures all supplies and materials are available.
  • Liaises with suppliers, members, caterers, regional representatives, and other staff. Troubleshoots problems with members and equipment problems.
  • May be required to help organize large events, such as conferences and rallies.
Performs other related duties as required.
Qualifications

The successful applicant must have:
  • Relevant post-secondary education in design and publishing, current training in appropriate design software and three years of experience in an office environment, or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Knowledge of fundamental design and photography principles including implementation and adherence to organizational brand guidelines.
  • Proficiency using Adobe Creative Cloud, including illustration, image manipulation, and use of brand templates.
  • Knowledge of website design and maintenance procedures.
  • Ability to receive and incorporate constructive criticism and be solutions oriented.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with others in a team environment.
  • Ability to organize and prioritize work and manage multiple requests in a deadline-driven environment.
  • Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
  • Knowledge of standard office methods and procedures.
  • Ability to be creative and have fun!
Required Competencies
  • Functional/Technical Skills
  • Teamwork
  • Listening
  • Planning
  • Creativity
  • Technical Learning
  • Time Management
  • Dealing with Ambiguity
  • Interpersonal Savvy
  • Action-Oriented
  • Priority Setting
  • Approachability
  • Peer Relationships
  • Composure
  • Compassion
  • Problem Solving
  • Ethics and Values
Why BCNU?

BCNU values, respects and protects diversity. We take pride in representing a diverse membership and staff. We offer an inclusive and supportive workplace with opportunities for career development and professional advancement as well as a competitive compensation and benefits package.

If you are seeking an opportunity to join a passionate and committed team, we’d like to hear from you!

title: Events Coordinator, External
description:
Company Description


With over 20,000 members, SSMU’s role is to represent undergraduate students and to offer them services since 1908.


Job Description


POSITION SUMMARY:

Reporting to the Student Life Operations Director, the Events Coordinator, External, is responsible for the oversight and facilitation of events and activities contracted to be hosted externally by SSMU Clubs & Services.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Build strategic relationships with various external and community partners;
  • Meet with student groups in a timely manner as needed;
  • Refer organizers to various SSMU Committees for event-related support and sustainable practices;
  • Answer inquiries from SSMU Clubs and Services regarding external event protocols, supporting documentation and mandatory requirements in a timely manner;
  • Review contracts and agreements between venues and/or other event contractors (eg. caterer, DJ, rentals, etc.);
  • Carefully examine and assist in risk mitigation of each declared event;
  • Process event documentation and forms;
  • Process Independent Contractor Agreements for external events;
  • Request and process PAL Insurance as needed by SSMU Clubs and Services;
  • Coordinate invoicing for additional insurance costs;
  • Provide guidance in regards to proper Accounting practices (eg. collecting documentation for audit, purchase orders, paying venues and vendors and cheque requests);
  • Ensure post event follow up to ensure all invoices are paid, contracts are signed, and applicable forms submitted.

Qualifications


QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

  • College degree in Business Administration or any related field;
  • Minimum 1 year of experience in event coordination or in an administrative role;
  • Good knowledge of the McGill community and the Student’s Society;
  • High degree of organization and time management;
  • High level of patience and diplomacy;
  • Demonstrated initiative- ability to recognize problems quickly and apply sound solutions;
  • Strong customer service and communication skills.

CONFIDENTIALITY:

It is understood and agreed that all matters to the SSMU and those clubs association or groups forming part of the SSMU are to be kept in the strictest of confidence, and nothing regarding the operations, policies and general activities of the SSMU or its constituent groups shall be divulged to any third party without the express consent of the General Manager and/or the Executive Committee of the SSMU.


Additional Information


  • Full-time
  • Annual salary: $41 000 to $42 000
  • Position term: Permanent
  • Application closes March 31, 2022
