title: newSupervisor, Office Services
description:
At McCarthy Tétrault, we offer challenging and rewarding career opportunities and are delighted to have been selected for the tenth consecutive year in 2022 as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers and one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers. Our culture is built on professional excellence, collaboration, innovation, thought leadership and entrepreneurialism. We embrace inclusion in all its forms and we provide the tools and opportunities to help our people develop to their full potential.

As a Supervisor, Office Services, you will be:

  • Supervising the coordination of all aspects of client and internal meetings, events, activities, visitor management and security for the McCarthy Tétrault Conference Centres, including:
    • Act as first point of escalation for internal and external clients related to attendance at the Conference Centres.
    • Ensuring all documentation, including Meeting and Event Summaries, security sign in, catering orders and all other meeting/event related documents are completed.
    • Ensure all activities related to meeting or events are executed according to plan, being proactive and raising issues as required
    • Coordinates the requirements of the Conference Centres with the kitchen and catering personnel.
    • Liaises with Facilities about the general maintenance and safety procedures of the Conference Centres.
    • Oversee the delivery and assist in defining the service offerings in the conference centres in a specific region.
  • Fostering strong internal and external client relationships as they relate to use of the Firm’s conference centres for client-initiated events.
  • Works with the outsourced teams and Events Manager, Conference Services to ensure successful planning, execution and review of all events.
  • Collaborating with events team to maintain a network of internal and external contacts (e.g. caterers, restaurants, equipment rentals, suppliers for specialty linens and other event-related incidentals).
  • Work in partnership with the Manager, Conference Services to manage and control all operating expenses and to prepare weekly and monthly summary reports.
  • Overseeing the smooth operation of all bookings nationally through the management of the front line team members, and providing support and backup when necessary.
  • Ensures compliance with all legal, legislative, health & safety, and employment handbook requirements.
  • Preparing team staffing schedules and allocating resources to maintain reception coverage for short-term needs Reporting unusual requirements, recommendations or resolutions to the Manager, Conference Services.
  • Other duties as assigned.

People Leadership

  • In collaboration with the Manager, Conference Services, promoting and maintaining positive employee relations within the national team.
  • Managing the performance of direct reports and providing continual feedback on outsourced employees at the Firm. Consistently model the leadership behaviors and reinforce the learning concepts needed to create a service culture.
  • Ensuring the ongoing development of team members’ skills to ensure functional and Firm objectives are met.
  • Managing all aspects of recruitment, selection, performance management (including goal setting), compensation and development for direct reports.

As our ideal candidate, you will have:

  • High school diploma. Post-secondary diploma or certificate in a hospitality/tourism management or business administration program preferred.
  • Three to five years of related experience, preferably in a professional services environment.
  • Two to three years’ experience in a supervisory position is preferred.
  • Broad and deep understanding of events and conference services.
  • Demonstrated computer proficiency. Excellent understanding of Microsoft Office computer software and other office equipment. Ability to learn new internal systems and software quickly and coach others on same.
  • Exceptional customer focus; strong professional judgement.
  • Works well under pressure and adjusts to changing needs. Proven ability to multi-task while demonstrating composure and the ability to handle stress and tight timelines.
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills and telephone manners, with a strong professional demeanour. Personable, approachable disposition.
  • Highly developed problem solving, decision making, conflict management and negotiation skills, including the ability to successfully resolve performance and disciplinary issues.
  • Confidence in making day-to-day decisions and judgement to know when to escalate and seek Manager’s input or assistance.
  • Ability to handle confidential information and exercise discretion in dealing with staff and/or sensitive issues.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop team capabilities and cohesiveness through coaching and mentoring.
  • Excellent communications skills in English (verbal and written) are required. Fluency in French would be considered an asset.
  • Flexible schedule to accommodate nights, weekends and public holidays as business dictates.

As a member of the McCarthy team, you will have access to:

  • Outstanding benefits from day one, including insurance premiums paid by the Firm and wellness and technology reimbursements.
  • Competitive compensation and generous time off, including a day off to volunteer and a day off for your birthday.
  • A commitment to professional development and growth opportunities for our people at all levels, supported by a culture that fully embraces and encourages two-way feedback.
  • Strong community involvement and a commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.
  • A collaborative, cohesive culture that connects lawyers and business teams through collective purpose.

How to apply:

We invite you to submit your application to careers@mccarthy.ca. We thank all applicants for their interest in McCarthy Tétrault; however, only chosen applicants will be contacted. We regret that we are unable to respond to individual inquiries about application status. McCarthy Tétrault is an equal opportunity employer that fosters an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment. Please notify us if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process.

title: Dishwasher
description:
Dishwasher/Kitchen Helper

Company description

Toronto’s premier full-service custom events caterer; Brindleberry Catering and Events has been serving the greater Toronto area for the past decade! We are the culinary experts when it comes to east and west flavors! The numerous repeat business and referrals we have garnered over the years are a testament to our commitment and passion for food. We have a proven reputation in the culinary and food industry with our unique dishes.

Job description

Brindleberry is looking for a dedicated, organized dishwasher who enjoys working as part of a team in a fast-paced culinary environment. The Dishwasher’s duties include removing soiled plates and flatware from tables, washing them thoroughly, and resetting the kitchen in preparation for the next event. They may also restock items, unload delivery trucks, help prepare cook stations, clean appliances and machines, empty and clean trash receptacles, and other duties, as needed.

To be successful as a Dishwasher, you should be a committed, communicative team player with excellent time management skills. You should be able to prioritize tasks in a busy setting and adhere to all food safety regulations and be up to date with COVID-19 sanitation and procedures.

Dishwasher Responsibilities:

  • Ensuring the availability of clean dishes by washing dishes, pots, pans, and flatware, and resetting dining areas.
  • Preparing dining areas and kitchen for next shift by cleaning and restocking dining areas and cook stations.
  • Cleaning machines and appliances used in the kitchen, such as coffee makers, pots, and pans, mixers, etc.
  • Unloading and storing deliveries.
  • Sweeping and mopping floors, especially in the event that items are broken or spilled.
  • Taking out the trash and rinsing garbage cans.
  • Supporting other restaurant staff members by assisting with other tasks, as needed.
  • Reporting kitchen accidents or violations of food safety codes and procedures.

Dishwasher Requirements:

  • High School Diploma or equivalent.
  • Minimal work experience.
  • Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
  • Exceptional time management skills.
  • Ability to stand or walk for 8-hour shifts and lift at least 20 pounds.
  • Good working knowledge of accepted sanitation standards and health codes. Willingness to comply with all food safety procedures.

COVID-19 considerations:

To ensure the safety and well-being of our team members, we have implemented pre-entry COVID-19 screening questionnaires, mandatory usage of face masks and face shields, and plastic partitions to create separation.

Job Types: Part-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 6 months
Part-time hours: 20 per week

Salary: $16.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Night shift
  • On call
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
To ensure the safety and well-being of our team members, we have implemented pre-entry COVID-19 screening questionnaires, mandatory usage of face masks and face shields, and plastic partitions to create separation.

Experience:

  • Dishwashing: 2 years (required)

Application deadline: 2022-04-29
Expected start date: 2022-05-16

title: newSupervisor, Hospitality & Concierge Services
description:
Job Details

Description

Your Next Opportunity

Would you like to be a part of Canada’s leading and progressive Business Law firm?

McMillan has an exciting opportunity for a Supervisor, Hospitality & Concierge Services based in Vancouver. Our Supervisor, Hospitality & Concierge Services, provides leadership in delivering a first class client service experience to both our external and internal clients. This role oversees the operations of our hospitality team and manages the successful execution of all on site and off site events.

What You’ll Do

The main duties and responsibilities of this role include but are not limited to:

  • Oversee the operations of the Hospitality and Concierge Services department, including managing catering service, concierge services, reception, and managing all staffing requirements including schedule management, performance management, recruitment, training & development.
  • Initiate and champion client service process improvements and programs.
  • Lead menu planning and design for meetings and events, including creative décor and theme designs.
  • Plan and execute events and meetings, including coordination with external caterers and agency staff, invoice management and maintenance of event statistics.
  • Manage financials for all events and negotiate vendor contracts.
  • Ensure reception, client center, main kitchen and work cafes are maintained appropriately and meet required standards.
  • Build, develop and maintain effective working relationships with all operations departments.
  • Project support for department initiatives as required.

What You Bring

  • Exceptional client service skills.
  • Prior leadership experience in professional services, hospitality or retail environment.
  • Proven leadership skills in developing, motivating and supporting a team to ensure quality standards are met.
  • Proactive and takes initiative to enhance department processes and procedures to ensure a high level of client service and efficiency is achieved.
  • Strong technical skills (Word, Excel, Outlook, Power Point, and meeting room booking software).
  • An enthusiastic and energetic approach to work and ability to inspire and motivate others.
  • Excellent communication skills both verbal and written.
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple competing priorities.
  • Ability to develop relationships and work effectively with vendors and suppliers.
  • Flexibility to modify hours/schedule or work additional hours as required.
  • Flexibility to work in all areas of the department.

McMillan Offers You

Growth

Mentorship and Support

Training as Software Evolves

Commensurate Compensation and Benefits Package

Fun Work Environment

Continuous Learning & Development

McMillan = You

Inclusion and diversity are essential elements of our culture at McMillan which coincides with our core values of respect, teamwork, commitment, client service and professional excellence. We are extremely proud to be one of Canada’s Top Employers for Young People six years in a row.

At McMillan, we know we will achieve the most success by attracting and retaining the best talent, and by representing and supporting communities from which we draw our members, the communities in which we live and work and the communities to which we provide legal services.

We are a law firm that prides itself in sustained quality and excellence in service while fostering a positive and collegial work environment which nurtures mentoring inspires enthusiasm and professional excellence. We commit to putting our best efforts forward in achieving our goals, and the goals of our clients. You can help us in that journey!

Need another reason to consider McMillan? Let’s work together to help you achieve your professional goals and career development.

Let’s get started

If this position is you, and you reside in or around the Vancouver area, we look forward to hearing from you. We like cover letters too, so don’t forget to include one along with your resume when you click on the Apply Now button.


McMillan is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities in its recruitment processes. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please email us or contact us at 1.888.622.4624 to submit your accommodation request.

McMillan LLP is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and diversity. We respect and embrace the unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences of individuals at all levels of the firm. This enables us to provide innovative client service, contribute fully to our communities and advance our firm’s values.

To protect the health and safety of our firm members, McMillan LLP has introduced a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy across all office for everyone working in or visiting the firm. As such, all offers of employment will be conditional upon providing proof of full vaccination with a COVID-19 vaccination approved by Health Canada. Any requests for exemptions will be considered on an individual basis.

title: Warehouse - Day Whse Worker
description:
The Chefs' Warehouse is a specialty food distributor that began sourcing products focused on serving the specific needs of chefs who own and/or operate some of the nation’s leading menu-driven independent restaurants, fine dining establishments, country clubs, hotels, caterers, culinary schools and specialty food stores. We believe that we have a distinct competitive advantage in serving these customers as a result of our extensive selection of distinctive and hard-to-find specialty and center-of-the-plate food products, our product knowledge and our customer service. We serve the finest restaurants, hotels, caterers and gourmet stores around the country.

As a Warehouse Worker, you will be responsible for providing warehouse support including picking, packing, assembly, sorting, shipping, and receiving of orders to meet the facility’s productivity and quality goals within the establishment.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
1.Reads production schedule, customer order, work order, shipping order, or requisition to determine items to be moved, gathered, or distributed.
2. Moves materials and items from receiving or production areas to storage or to other designated areas.
3. Sorts and breaks down product by SKU, quantity, and product type.
4. Ability to use electric pallet jack as well as stand-up forklift is a must.
5. Effectively communicate with Receivers, Drivers, Driver Check-in, & Forklift Operators
6. Adhering to proper safety practices for truck and trailer pull process on a daily basis.
7. Sorts and stores goods in designated areas of the warehouse.
8. Responsible for the proper handling of all company issued equipment, including PPE, voice equipment etc.
9. Responsible for reporting all safety concerns in the work environment on timely basis.
10. Must wear company issued uniform.
11. Assembles customer orders from stock and places orders on pallets or shelves or moves orders to loading dock to prepare for shipping.
12. Label pallets with identifying information when instructed.
13. Opens bales, crates, and other containers when necessary.
14. Record amounts of materials or items received or distributed.
15. Accurately weighs or counts items for distribution within warehouse to ensure conformance to company standards. (Assists in billing process.)
16. Maintain a 99% accuracy rating of inventory records on a daily and weekly basis.
17. Responsible for the safe operation of all warehouse equipment daily.
18. Responsible for completing daily equipment inspection logs and working safe at all times.
19. Must maintain audit-ready sanitation standards in the work environment at all times in all areas of the warehouse.
20. Must securely palletize and wrap product to prevent damage during transport.
21. Must maintain product integrity with proper handling & report damage to management immediately.
22. Must follow all company policies and procedures.
23. Other duties as assigned.

Required Education and/or experience:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience

Required Skills and Abilities: Language Ability:
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret sales data and trends. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers or members of the business community.

Math Ability:
Basic math skills with addition, subtraction and multiplication. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.

Reasoning Ability:
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

Computer Skills:
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have advance level of expertise with Microsoft Word and Excel. Knowledge of, JDE, & other sales programs. Must be able to operate common office machines.

Work Environment:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Qualifications
  • Ability to lift to 60 lbs
  • Ability to manage time in a fast-paced industry.
  • Ability to safely use necessary tools and equipment.
  • Ability to work in a temperature-controlled environment.
  • Candidates must be reliable, responsible, and punctual, with a positive attitude and work well independently and with a team.
The Chefs' Warehouse is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, arrest record, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. Our management team is dedicated to this policy with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities and general treatment during employment.

title: Sous Chef
description:
We are seeking a Sous Chef with strong culinary experience in operations to lead our team and oversee the culinary program. The candidate must be creative, with in depth knowledge of industry trends and have strong technical and organizational skills. He/she must be goal oriented with an ability to develop and implement comprehensive plans. The candidate must have the knowledge and skills required to effectively run all kitchen operations including the ability to develop menus and concepts.

Company Overview:

At A Cappella Catering, we believe catering should mean an exceptional culinary experience for everyone we serve. Through owner-operated service we provide scratch made food, created from local and farm fresh ingredients.

Our business practice is future forward and socially responsible and we’re proud to be a part of this community. A Cappella Catering has been providing cuisine and service excellence to Edmonton and area for nearly three decades.

From banquets to barbeques, pancake breakfasts to boardroom lunches, cocktail receptions to conference catering, we are known in the city of Edmonton for delicious food, exceptional services, and superior value.

We are proud to be a caterer of choice for the city’s finest venues and most discriminating appetites. You will spot our name on the preferred caterers list for many select location. We have garnered a reputation for being easy to work with. We’re committed to continuing to provide our customers with superior value.

Summary of Responsibilities:

Reporting to the Executive Chef, Founder and COO, responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:

- Communicate daily with the Executive Chef for an update regarding planning, staffing, and internal procedures

- Assist in the directing of the culinary team's presentation and portioning of food according to our standard

- Completes daily food requisitions

- Assists in the training, and discipline in accordance with A Cappella Catering’s policies and procedures

- Completes data entry, purchases/invoices

- Manages labour costs and food purchasing

- Oversee production for banquet food operations with Executive Chef

- Mentor -- work with the cooks, trainees and support staff to deliver the Executive Chef's vision. Help train and develop them to make great food. Be a key part of an atmosphere that fosters teamwork and engages staff, while ensuring all are working safely

- Learn and then utilizing new culinary techniques, skills and recipes

- Oversee the safe production, preparation and presentation of food that will ensure a great guest experience.

Qualifications:

- College degree or certification in culinary field/hospitality field preferred

- Minimum 5 years cooking experience

- Minimum 2 years kitchen management experience required in both a la carte and banquet operations

- At least 3 years of progressive experience in food and beverage (culinary)

- Ability to communicate effectively with team members, departments and owner group

- Read, write and speak and understand English

- Ability to understand financial goals and accomplish them

- Ability to work extended hours when business necessitates

- Ability to perform medium work -- exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 20 pounds of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects

Requirements:

- Food Safe Certificate

- WHIS

- First Aid/CPR

- Equipped with own knives

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $23.00-$27.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • kitchen: 5 years (preferred)
  • Supervising: 2 years (preferred)

title: Start-up Community Programs Director
description:
Start-up Community Programs Director

Download the job posting: tinyurl.com/tarjumajob
Ask Us Anything: https://tinyurl.com/tarjumalive
Learn more: https://tarjuma.ca/connect/tarjuma-is-hiring/

About the Position
Tarjuma is seeking an initiator who works cooperatively and innovatively to cultivate a nourishing Muslim community, an implementor that translates a vision and values into sustainable programming, and a sheperd who supports people who are seeking, embracing, or renewing their faith from all walks of life.

How to apply
Please send a video of yourself (maximum five minutes in length) sharing how you’ve worked to make community spaces more welcoming and your resume. Applications will be accepted until a suitable candidate is found.

Year 1 Focus
In year 1, your priority will be to set the foundation for Tarjuma with the main focus being programming, administration, and finance. Your deliverables will include:

  • Create a sustainable small group learning & connection program (Tarjuma Living Rooms)(e.g. small groups in homes: Center DC, North Point Community Church).
  • Develop and deliver quarterly community learning workshops (e.g. Being Muslim, financial literacy, Marriage Mentorship, Grief & Bereavement, Faith for kids).
  • Develop and implement a 2 year programs plan & sustainability strategy for Tarjuma, design/test approaches to donor engagement, financial learning, revenue generation
  • Oversight of Jumu’ah in the Core, including Friday sermon mentorship program and Friday prayer downtown.

Key Responsibilities

Program Planning, Design, & Delivery

You will play the lead role in the design and delivery of Tarjuma’s programming, from small groups to events.

  • Develop programmatic resources, including content plans, volunteer roles and responsibilities, templates, and training materials
  • Foster partnerships and collaborate with local, national, and international organizations to develop and deliver programming (e.g. local caterers, social service agencies)
  • Prioritize hospitality in receiving and hosting special guests
  • Liaise with service providers to provide referrals to community participants when needed, including social workers, therapists, chaplains, and scholars

Volunteer & Community Coordination

  • Develop and administer processes for volunteer recruitment, training, and growth

Example of tasks for Tarjuma Living Rooms program:

  • Coordinate registration of participants, facilitators, hosts
  • Design content and prepare materials for Living Room sessions
  • Develop training and relevant materials, and train facilitators, hosts, helpers
  • Match hosts and participants (via matching session or registration design)
  • Organize check-ins with hosts, facilitators and helpers
  • Monitor program delivery & ongoing evaluation

Finances

  • Develop financial strategy, including identifying current needs, approach to fundraising, financial literacy plan for individuals/families, and donor engagement plan
  • Manage and track donations and foster relationships with past, existing and potential donors
  • Design and implement methods for donor appreciation
  • Ensure administration of annual tax receipts
  • Liaise with bookkeeper to ensure accurate financials are created annually

Communications

  • Develop communications strategy
  • Oversee the design and development of communications materials (e.g. pamphlets, posters, and website redesign)
  • Develop and administer schedule for communications, including social media, email, and community reports

Build roster of photographs by procuring photographers or volunteers

Administration

  • Create procedures for and manage financial, administrative, and communications platforms
  • Procure consultants, develop and manage contracts
  • Ensure completion and submission of annual provincial nonprofit and federal charitable forms
  • Support with preparation of Board and Committee agendas and minutes
  • Support with development of terms of references, policies, and procedures
  • Write and submit grant applications
  • Oversee partnership/memorandum of understanding (MOU) development with organizations

Approximate Time Commitment (subject to change)

  • Tarjuma Living Rooms Program (50%)
  • Special events (20%)
  • Programs Plan & Sustainability Strategy (15%)
  • Jumu’ah in the Core (15%)

Key Competencies & Skills

  • Embodies characteristics of a servant leader
  • Active listener and relationship nurturer with ability to provide healing/well-being-informed care
  • Creative risk taker and curator of beautiful spaces and experiences
  • Passionate about the big picture and scrupulous with detail and organization
  • Comfortable with ambiguity; able to work independently and collaboratively
  • Clear and intentional writer and oral communicator
  • Reliable and trustworthy
  • Familiar with community organizing methodologies
  • Able to design, implement and evaluate programs
  • Experience in project and event planning, coordination, and management
  • Experience with the following platforms is an asset: Slack, Planning Center, Zoom, Google Suite, GoDaddy, Instagram, FaceBook, Twitter, Square, and Rotessa
  • Graphic design is an asset
  • Understanding of restorative justice and/or conflict resolution is an asset

Reporting, Hours, & Compensation

Reporting: this is a permanent position located in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada, reporting to a board.
Hours: 40 hours per week (negotiable). Flexible schedule. Evening and weekend work will be required.
Salary range: CAD$50-80,000 per year (depending on experience).

About Tarjuma

Tarjuma is about nurturing well-being(s). It is a Muslim community on Treaty 6 Territory and Métis Homeland (Edmonton, AB, Canada). Tarjuma seeks to ‘translate’ the core of Islamic traditions and cultural legacies into a relevant context. As a nonprofit charitable organization, Tarjuma is focused on responding to the emerging needs of its growing community through unreserved welcome, connection, and spiritual cultivation. Tarjuma has provided a range of programming since 2013, including classes, practical workshops, and social gatherings. Tarjuma strongly values capacity building across generations and cultures in pursuit of collectively lifting the community. It strives for excellence and accessibility in all aspects of service and values holistic well-being.

Note: this job description might seem insurmountable. Much of Tarjuma’s efforts have been driven by a small number of dedicated volunteers, working from the side of their desk. The Start-Up Director will have the support of this dedicated and committed team of servant leaders. We know the perfect candidate does not exist, but we encourage you to apply if you’re passionate about growing community.

Work remotely

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $50,000.00-$80,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Application question(s):

  • The schedule is flexible, but must include evenings and/or weekends. Are you able to work evenings and/or weekends?

title: Foodservice Sales Manager
description:
About Sabert:

We are a leading global manufacturer of innovative food packaging products and solutions. Our company was founded in 1983 on a single mission: to enhance and advance the way people enjoy food . Today we design, manufacture and distribute a wide spectrum of packaging solutions for food distributors, restaurants & caterers, grocery stores, national food chains and consumer entertaining.


BASIC FUNCTIONS:

Achieve sales results expected by selling to and managing distributors as well as selling to end user operators in the assigned geographic region. The sales approach will be based on understanding the customer’s business needs and identifying product solutions that provide superior value to the customer and to Sabert

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Distribution Management
    • Conduct sales meetings and DSR training, produce, and create presentation that are impactful. Delivered solution based sales proven solutions.
    • Manage select distribution partners in the geographic region; develop positive working relationships; oversee and manage local marketing programs, trade spend, rebates, etc.; support brand SKU enhancement and development
    • Identify tier 1 distribution targets for growth
    • Develop and implement an annual sales and marketing plan in conjunction with each distribution partner to expand sales opportunities for Sabert products and achieve profitable revenue growth
    • Ensure new products are effectively introduced to distribution partners to achieve the desired revenue goals within the geographic region
    • Organize and support marketing events and activities as needed to support the attainment of business goals in the geographic region
    • Work with distribution partners to resolve open issues and concerns
    • Develop distributor and operator pipeline reports in the geographic region to support sales activities to the end user customers
    • Manage local and national distribution programs and ensure they are structured and achieve the expected outcomes and results consistent with a “Pay for Performance” philosophy
  • Sales Activities
    • Continually develop and pursue a list of qualified new end user customer leads and prospects
    • Meet with current and potential customers; understand customer needs and identify/propose product solutions
    • Follow-up with potential or current customers to develop new business opportunities via value-added selling
    • Work with customers and internal staff to accomplish the work needed to “close” sales
    • Manage current customer accounts and relationships; work to resolve open issues and concerns
    • Participate in marketing events and activities as needed to support the attainment of business goals in the territory
  • Administrative Activities
    • Provide accurate forecasts related to case/volume and revenue
    • Maintain and update appropriate databases and sales support systems relative to account activity, pricing, etc.
    • Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products, delivery schedules, merchandising techniques, etc.
    • Provide written and verbal updates on sales activity and competitive activity in the territory to management
  • General
    • Handle other projects and/or initiatives as needed

REQUIRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

  • Bachelors degree in an appropriate field - business, marketing, culinary school, foodservice management or packaging
  • A minimum of 5+ years of Sales experience, mostly in the Foodservice industry
  • Experience in managing Distributors
  • Experience in working with end user operators
  • Experience and understanding of the Packaging and/or Plastic Packaging business preferable
  • Valid Driver’s License

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILL, AND ABILITIES:

  • Ability to build rapport quickly
  • Excellent communication skills, especially listening, probing/questioning and presentation skills
  • Demonstrated ability in using consultative selling skills; persuasive skills
  • Analytical skills; able to evaluate a situation and outline a course of action; proven ability to understand the financial impact of options and decisions
  • Ability to work under pressure in a dynamic environment
  • Sense of urgency; proven ability to “close” a sale
  • Demonstrated negotiation skills
  • Project management skills; proven organizational and planning skills
  • Computer Literate-Word, Excel & PowerPoint
  • Results orientation
  • High level of personal initiative, energy and ownership for success; a self-starter

title: newDriver
description:
Globally we deliver over 320,000 authentic, world-class meals every day, these meals are dished up by our portfolio of brands - dnata, Alpha Flight Group, Alpha LSG and En Route. Working to stringent deadlines and exacting standards, we take pride in every smile our dishes evoke - a trait recognized by numerous airlines around the world. Over the years we have been awarded best caterer by a wide number of airlines and are driven by a desire to deliver for our customers, and their customers, every day. We are excited to be opening our 64th dedicated catering unit in Vancouver, Canada. Our Vancouver start-up is a unique opportunity to be part of a new team that will help us write the next chapter of our success story!

Why join dnata?

  • Be part of a small start-up team, with great opportunity for growth
  • Be part of a global award winning group
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Cover
  • Additional co-contributions towards your retirement fund
  • Paid annual vacation
  • Over-time premiums
  • Free daily meal
The Role:
Drivers are responsible for the safe transport and delivery of temperature controlled food and related goods from the catering facility to the aircraft.

Responsibilities:
  • Work safely at all times, insuring your own safety and the safety of your colleagues. Drive safely on airport property and public roads, adhering to specified rules, regulations and specific customer guidelines
  • Deliver temperature controlled food and related goods to the aircraft via dnata vehicles.
  • Conducting periodic vehicle checks to ensure they are serviceable and safe to drive. Insuring that all company vehicles are clean and refueled when required
  • Reporting any faults / issues of the vehicles to the respective person
  • Monitor deliveries for accuracy and security, delivering and collecting of any written communications or any items from / to contacts outside of the Company
  • Manually load and unload galley equipment and goods onto and off of trucks and aircraft.
  • Professionally interact with and provide superior customer service to onboard airline representatives and customers
  • Assist in other non-driving related tasks during down-time, as directed by management.
  • Maintain a valid drivers license and RAIC at all times, as well as abide by all road laws and safety operating procedures
Qualifications/ skills/ experience / knowledge:
  • Hold minimum of Class 5 license or Class 3 CDL
  • Be able to safely manually handle (lift) loads of up to 50 lbs
  • Have the right to work and reside in BC, Canada
  • Hold a current Restricted Area Identity Card (RAIC) OR be eligible for RAIC
  • Previous experience driving aircraft catering vehicles is highly advantageous
  • Previous experience driving in an airside / airport environment is highly advantageous

title: Chauffeur poids lourd
description:
*ENGLISH WILL FOLLOW*

POSTE: CHAUFFEUR PL

NOUS CHERCHONS EXCLUSIVEMENT DES PERSONNES DÉJÀ PRÉSENTE SUR LE TERRITOIRE CANADIEN.

Newrest offre des opportunités de carrière au sein d'un groupe qui recherche constamment de nouveaux talents pour nos nombreuses filiales réparties sur les cinq continents. Implantée depuis plus de 10 ans à Montréal, l'entreprise connaît une croissance fulgurante.

Newrest Montréal se concentre sur le segment de la restauration aérienne et a su, au fil des années, développer un savoir-faire ainsi qu'un professionnalisme certain auprès de ses clients.

Vous êtes rattaché au département Handling, et vous reportez aux différents responsables en respectant les niveaux hiérarchiques (Coordonnateur Handling, Directeur Adjoint Handling, et Directeur Handling).

PRE REQUIS :

  • Vous travaillez déjà à l'aéroport de P.E. Trudeau et vous êtes titulaire de la carte d'accès rouge
  • Vous pouvez être formé par Newrest pour conduire un camion lourd. Newrest finance le passage du permis Classe 3.
  • Vous avez déjà votre DA (permis de conduire en piste-aéroportuaire? Votre profil nous intéresse!
  • Si vous êtes titulaire du permis class 3 et que vous n'avez pas d'expérience sur l'aéroport, votre profil peut correspondre si vous cherchez un nouveau défi.


Fonction principale

Vous assurez le chargement et le déchargement de toutes les prestations et effectuez les livraisons sur piste ou tout autre point de vente en respectant les heures de livraison et les règles de sécurité.

Missions:

  • Contrôler la conformité du nombre de trolleys et armoires à livrer avant le chargement
  • Assurer le chargement des produits dans les véhicules conformément au plan d’armement
  • Assurer la livraison dans les délais impartis en respectant les plans d’armement
  • Effectuer le déchargement par zone (plonge, armement…)
  • Conduire un véhicule lourd ou léger en respectant la règlementation routière (sur route et sur piste)
  • Sécuriser tous les produits avant la livraison sur l’aéronef en plombant le matériel de transport (camion)
  • Assurer la conformité du chargement selon les procédures en place.
  • Assurer le nettoyage du véhicule et des abords du quai après chaque vacation
  • Communiquer tous dysfonctionnement à sa hiérarchie et à la régulation
  • Remplir les différents documents de sûreté (certificat…), sécurité et d’HACCP
  • Former les nouveaux chauffeurs

PROFIL

  • Être ponctuel et rigoureux
  • Avoir l'esprit d'équipe
  • Avoir un bon historique de conduite
  • Avoir une tenue et un comportement irréprochable
  • Détenir un permis de Classe 3 (Fort atout)
  • Détenir un permis DA (Fort atout)
  • Détenir un badge rouge d'accès à l'aéroport (Fort atout)
  • Avoir des notions sur les règles aéroportuaires (Fort atout)
  • Condition d’admissibilité de la SAAQ
  • Vous devez avoir accumulé 2 années d'expérience comme titulaire d'un permis probatoire ou d'un permis de conduire de la classe 5 (auto).
  • Vous devez avoir moins de 4 points d'inaptitude inscrits à votre dossier.
  • Votre permis de conduire ne doit pas avoir été suspendu ou révoqué, au cours des 2 dernières années, en raison d'une accumulation de points d'inaptitude ou d'une infraction au Code criminel commise au volant d'un véhicule.

NOUS OFFRONS:

  • Dîner gratuit
  • Assurance collective complète après trois mois
  • Possibilité d’évolution


Recherche d’antécédent judiciaire pour obtenir la badge aéroportuaire.


40h/semaine

Quart de travail : 12:00 à 20:30 et/ou 14:00 à 22:30 et/ou 16:00 à 00:30

Salaire :

  • $23.00/h
  • Prime de soir : 1$ / H entre 16:00 et 23:00
  • Prime de nuit : 1.5 $/ H entre 23:00 et 05:00


Les candidats retenus devront présenter, lors du processus de recrutement : une pièce d'identité avec photo, ses informations bancaires ainsi qu'un numéro de NAS valide.


JOB POSTING: HEAVYWEIGHT DRIVER


WE ARE EXCLUSIVELY LOOKING FOR PEOPLE ALREADY PRESENT IN CANADIAN TERRITORY.


Newrest offers career opportunities within a group that is constantly looking for new talents for our numerous subsidiaries spread over five continents. Established for more than 10 years in Montreal, the company is experiencing tremendous growth.


Newrest Montreal focuses on the airline catering segment and has, over the years, been able to develop know-how as well as a certain professionalism with its customers.


DRIVER (class 3)

With origins in Group Catair in 1996, and founded in Toulouse (France), Newrest is the only major catering company active in all catering and related hospitality segments including airline catering, buy-on-board, duty-free on board, rail catering, concession retail, contract catering, health care, education, remote site and support services.

With 2012 revenues under management of almost 1 Billion Euros and more than 25’000 employees world-wide in 49 countries, Newrest is also the second largest ‘independent’ airline caterer world-wide.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

You are working in the Handling department, and refer the different managers respecting the hierarchical levels (Handling Coordinator, Handling Director).


REQUIERMENTS:

  • You are already working at P.E. Trudeau's airport, and/or holder of the red access card
  • You can be trained by NewRest to drive a heavy truck. NewRest will finances the Class 3 license.
  • You already have your DA (driving license on the airport runway? Your profile interests us.
  • If you hold a class 3 license and have no experience at the airport, your profile may respond to our search if you are looking for a new challenge.


Main Function:

 You load and unload all services and make deliveries on tarmac or any other point of sale respecting delivery times and safety rules;

 Check conformity and quantity of trolleys and boxes to be delivered before loading;

 Ensure loading of products into vehicles according to plan galley;

 Ensure delivery on time, in accordance with the Plans of galley;

 Driving a heavy vehicle or light respecting traffic regulations (road and tarmac);

 Secure all products before delivery to the aircraft by sealing material (truck);

 Ensure cleaning of the vehicle and area around docks after each shift;

 Communicate any malfunction to hierarchy and dispatch;

 Fill the various security documents (certificate ...), safety and HACCP;

 Train new drivers ;

KNOWLEDGE:

  • Respect the galley plans
  • Respecting traffic regulations
  • Observe the proper use of equipment
  • Follow the procedures for health, safety and security

MANDATORY:

  • Diver's Air-side license (DA)
  • AVOP Security Pass
  • Previous experience on YUL tarmac airport is mandatory
  • Clean driving record
  • Class 5 or 3 / G or D Driving licence

Transport Canada eligibility condition to obtain your airport badge.

WE OFFER:

  • Complete group insurance, after three months.
  • Free lunch
  • Possibility of evolution

40h/ week

Availabilities: 12:00 to 20:30 and/or 14:00 to 22:30 and/or 16:00 a 00:30

Salary: $23.00/h


Evening bonus : 1 $ / Hours between 16:00 to 23:00

Night bonus : 1.5 $ / hours between 23:00 to 05:00


Successful candidates will be required to present, during the recruitment process: a photo ID, bank information and a valid SIN number.


PROFILE:

  • Be punctual and rigorous
  • Have a team spirit
  • Have a good driving history
  • Have an irreproachable behaviour and dress
  • Hold a Class 3 license (Asset)
  • Hold a DA permit (Asset)
  • Hold a red airport access badge (Asset)
  • Have knowledge of airport rules (Asset)


SAAQ eligibility requirements


  • You must have accumulated 2 years of experience as a holder of a probationary license or a class 5 driver's license (car).a
  • You must have less than 4 demerit points on your record.
  • Your driver's licence must not have been suspended or revoked in the last 2 years for demerit point accumulation or a Criminal Code offence committed while driving.


Transport Canada eligibility requirements

  • Criminal Record Search to obtain airport badge

title: Event Coordinator
description:
Event Coordinator

The West Avenue Cider Events Coordinator will plan and coordinate both internal and external events at The Cider House. These will range from weddings, parties, cider festivals, to farmers markets and tradeshows. You will use your superb organization skills,and adaptability to highlight your dedication to customer service. You’ll exhibit an excellent positive attitude and be willing to go out of your way to accommodate our guests and clients to exceed their expectations.

Term:

  • Full time between May and December
  • Part time between January and April (full time an option too)

Duties:

  • Be the main point of contact for all of our event clients. Keeping up to date with daily emails and coordinating and attending in person visits.
  • Detail all events and be the main point person representing West Avenue from initial meeting to final event completion.
  • Supervise and attend each event and be the point person for clients and staff.
  • Create weekly schedules for event staff
  • Make sure that each event is fully stocked in terms of alcohol, ice and food.
  • Work with other external event vendors (caterers, florists, ‘day of’ coordinators’) to make sure the clients feel confident and relaxed that their event will go off ‘without a hitch’
  • Organize external food vendors for food events at The Cider House.
  • Assist with preparing budgets and provide periodic progress reports to mgmt for each event project.
  • Anticipate guest needs and ensure that service exceeds expectations to ensure a memorable and amazing experience.
  • Manage on-site production and set up and tear down for events as necessary.
  • Follow up with clients with a thank you email within three days of the event.
  • Propose new ideas to management to improve the event planning and implementation process.
  • Perform other related duties required in day to day operations.
  • Coordinate Farmers Markets- liase with Market Managers and West Avenue staff to make sure our we are representing our brand consistently and efficiently.
  • Coordinate External Event attendance such as trade shows and beer and cider festivals to make sure our we are representing our brand consistently.
  • Own, Create and share Event calendar for Cider House employees and management.
  • Liase with other West Avenue Supervisors to make sure both internal and external events are staffed.
  • Work in the tasting room bar when needed.
  • Help administer, greet and care for guests at the Air B + B Cottage if needed.
  • Attend and work events as an ambassador of West Avenue when needed

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $45,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
We follow all provincial guidelines in regards to Covid 19.

Application deadline: 2022-04-22
Expected start date: 2022-05-02

title: Truck Driver - $20/hr
description:
How about driving a truck filled with Ontario’s most delicious, farm-fresh food, as part of a team that’s trying to make the world a more fair and more delicious place?


If the idea of good food, good people, and independence on the road sound good to you, we’d love to meet you.


We’re 100km Foods and we’re looking to add 1 commercial truck driver to our team. This is a full-time position with medical and dental benefits after 3 months and a company matching retirement savings plan after 1 year.


Why Work @ 100km Foods


100km Foods started to connect local farmers with urban markets. Through us, farmers get access to large, urban markets and urban people get access to delicious, farm-fresh food. It’s a win-win for all involved.


We deal fairly with farmers, allowing them to set their own prices, and we seek to treat all of our employees, suppliers, clients, and community with a high standard of fairness and cooperation. That led us to become a certified B Corp (ever heard of that?).


Working with us, you’ll get to be a part of that purpose. You’ll work with great people who care about what they do, who bring a positive attitude to work, and who like to have fun.


You’ll also have freedom to do your job and solve problems independently. In fact, the best drivers are the ones who can creatively resolve day-to-day problems – a crop that’s been delayed or an item that was left behind – keeping both farmers and clients happy.


You’ll also get lots of variety – approximately half your work week will be spent driving through southern Ontario farmland (approx. 100 km radius from Toronto), collecting items from our many farm partners, and then returning them to the warehouse. The other half of your week, you’re loading up your truck and making deliveries to some of Ontario's best chefs and restaurants.


If that sounds good, we’re looking for a driver for approximately 40 hours per week.

Wages start at $20/hour

Perks of the job include:

  • Medical and Dental Benefits, fully paid by the employer, after 3 months
  • At cost purchasing account for employees to buy groceries for themselves and their family at wholesale prices.
  • Company matching retirement savings plan after 1 year

Qualifications


Absolutely essential:


  • You are at least 25 years of age (for insurance reasons)
  • Minimum 3 year commercial driving experience verifiable from a previous employer and/or insurance company
  • You have a valid G Ontario driver's license with a clean abstract
  • You can lift and carry up to 50 pounds
  • You are fluent in English

Ideally, you also have experience in these areas:


  • Experience doing a customer service job
  • Experience using a hand truck, dolly or similar equipment
  • Excellent knowledge of Toronto and southern Ontario driving routes
  • A food handler’s certificate and/or experience in food handling or distribution

How to Apply


Please attach your resume and cover letter to this site We will review applications as they are received. Thanks to everyone who applies; we’ll contact those selected for further discussion..


About 100km Foods


100km Foods Inc. is an award winning 100% local food distribution company in Toronto, Ontario. We provide a direct connection between chefs, caterers and retailers in Toronto and producers in Ontario to purchase, sell and distribute locally grown food directly from farms to customers in Southern Ontario. In 2010, 100km Foods Inc. was awarded the Ontario Premier's Award of Excellence in Agri-Food Innovation for the creation of a distribution model which supports the growth of the local food economy in Ontario. Our customers include many of Southern Ontario's premier fine dining establishments, top hotels, and independent retailers.

title: Bartender/Ticket Taker - Oakville Centre
description:
Job Details:
Part-Time (Non-Union T)

Posting Status:
Open to current Town of Oakville employees and external applicants

This posting is for current and future opportunities and will be filled on an as needed basis. Applications will be considered for any openings that become available between now and June 30, 2022.

Job Responsibilities:

The Oakville Centre has a 497 seat theatre tiered over 17 rows (stairs) as well as a 120 seat studio theatre on the lower level. This position is part of the front of house team and will be required to:

  • Have a good understanding of performances, theatre policies and bar products and policies in order to assist and provide excellent customer service.
  • Sell and service beverages, snacks and artist merchandise using cash register, credit/debit machine and manual cash transactions.
  • Ensure that alcoholic beverages are served in accordance with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission.
  • Take an opening and closing inventory of stock and cash floats.
  • Receive and put away stock.
  • Set-up and clean-up bar for service at performances and/or receptions.
  • Handle or re-direct enquiries from patrons, sponsors, retail clients, artists and caterers.
  • Assist ushers with program preparation, greeting and seating patrons.
  • Take tickets (both manually and with electronic scanners) and ensure that purchased seats have been correctly designated.
  • Keep the front entrance, auditorium and washrooms presentable.
  • Know and assist with medical emergency and evacuation procedures.
  • Participate in mandatory regular staff meetings.
  • Wear the designated uniform.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications/Skills:

  • Currently enrolled in or completion of secondary school.
  • Previous customer service and problem solving skills in a fast paced environment, including working experience in the service or retail industry is required.
  • Must be of legal age to service and sell alcoholic beverages (18) and hold a Smart Serve (SIP) certificate.
  • Applicants who do not meet the age requirement to serve alcohol will not require Smart Serve certification.
  • Previous knowledge about theatre services and performances an asset.
  • Ability to work evenings, weekends and holidays is a requirement of this position.
  • Successful candidates, who are new hires and/or who have not performed in this position previously will be required to provide a satisfactory criminal record check, with vulnerable sector screening, dated within the last 30 days as a condition of employment.

Applications for this position must be received at oakville.ca in the employment section by no later than midnight on June 30, 2022.

DATED: January 4, 2022

The successful candidate will be required to submit proof of full vaccination in accordance with the town’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy and Procedure. Accommodation requests for new hires that are unable to get vaccinated against COVID-19 for reasons protected under the Ontario Human Rights Code must be made in writing to the Human Resources department

This job profile reflects the general details considered necessary to perform the principal functions and shall not be construed as an interpretation of all work requirements inherent in the job. Applicants are required to demonstrate in their applications and in the interview process that their qualifications for the positions match those specified. Applicants may be required to undergo a skills assessment and/or testing.

We thank all applicants and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: CSJ - Kitchen Helper | Saskatoon West
description:
COME JOIN OUR TEAM!

Building Brains is a dynamic organization that is changing the landscape in early childhood education. It focuses on children's brain development while providing an environment that is representative of the best early childhood care programs within Canada. Our quality child care, preschool programs build strong brains for life. Through natural light-filled spacious rooms and learning materials, we offer an innovative and welcoming environment that is captivating and stimulating for both adults and children. We are currently Looking for a enthusiastic individual to join our team for 8 weeks in the role of Kitchen Helper as part of the Canada summer job grant program.

**Kids U has won the Gold Winner status for the Calgary Herald/Sun Readers choice awards! Best Daycare & Best Preschool 2021 !**

Tasks and Responsibilities:

  • Maintaining a clean and organized kitchen environment
  • Washing dishes in accordance to AHS specifications
  • Safely storing or disposing of leftover food
  • preparing food service containers for return to caterers
  • Portioning food for the classrooms
  • Preparing food to be delivered to classrooms
  • Deliver food to classrooms
  • Collecting dishes, utensils, and serving containers from the classrooms after meals
  • Checking the quality of the food being served through taste tasting
  • Offering housekeeping, disinfecting support in areas where needed

Components of the Position:

  • scrubbing dishes and serving containers
  • Lifting and carrying up to 25 lbs.
  • Safely use and handle sharp materials such as box cutters, can openers and knives
  • Safely handle hot and cold containers
  • Safely lift and carry boxes
  • Push, pull and move rolling racks and carts safely around the kitchen
  • Standing for long periods of time
  • Repetitive tasks and body movement
  • Bending, leaning and reaching

The successful role holder will need to have a positive attitude, quick thinking, problem solving and customer service skills and the ability to fulfill competing priorities.

This position is a part of the Canada Summer Jobs Program with funding provided by Service Canada. Candidates must meet the following eligibility requirements to be considered:

  • Be between 15 and 30 years of age at the start of employment
  • Be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or a person on whom refugee protections has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
  • And legally entitled to work according to relevant provincial legislation and regulations (international students on a work/study permit are not eligible for the Canada Summer Jobs Program)

TIME SPENT WORKING TOGETHER

This Position is 35 Hours per Week, Monday-Friday The Position will start in June 2022 for 8 weeks. You will be working in Building Brains, Calgary Centennial (BB) Campus Saskatoon.

LOCATION
Building Brains Early Learning Centre
2317 Hanselman Pl,
Saskatoon,
SK S7L 6A9,
Canada

Compensation: $ 14.00 Per Hour

"Interview Process : Remote Hiring
Full Time Position, Temporary Hire"

We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note that only those applicants for further consideration will be contacted.


Kids U & Building Brains is an Equal opportunity Employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates and encourage Aboriginal people, visible minorities and people with disabilities to apply. we are committed to championing an inclusive workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, national origin, and other protected characteristics.

title: Cold Kitchen Production
description:
Marigolds and Onions, one of Toronto’s most sought after Catering & Events Company since 1991 is looking for a professional to be part of our culinary team.

We are looking for new talent to help keep abreast with the latest developments in the evolving world of catering service and event management. All you need is enthusiasm, patience and perseverance to strive to be the best.

One of Toronto’s top caterers is looking for a part time prep cook for our Cold Kitchen. We are looking for flexible availability including weekends.

Job Summary

Cold Kitchen is responsible for the daily production of orders such as:

· Cutting and portioning cold kitchen items such as: fruit, cheeses and salads to any given specifications

· Preparing, through to completion, menu items according to given specifications with an eye for presentation and quality

· Packaging all produced items in specific containers based on reports

· Arranging finished products on platters, garnishing and packaging for delivery

Qualifications:

· Have a high level of knife skills and be able to work safely in a kitchen environment

· Have 2 years of kitchen experience

· Be able to work in a fast paced kitchen area producing high quality products

· Be detail orientated and be a quick learner

· Perform kitchen duties in accordance with food safety and cleanliness guidelines.

Compensation:

· An attractive compensation package and a generous benefit package will be offered to the suitable candidate
Marigolds and Onions - Good Company Makes for Great Events

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 10-20 per week

Salary: $17.00-$20.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
We are a double vaccinated facility

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • York, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • kitchen/cooking: 1 year (required)

Language:

  • English (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Food Handler Certification (preferred)

title: Chef exécutif / Executive Chef
description:
Newrest recherche un Chef exécutif pour soutenir ses projets au Canada.

Sous la supervision du chef de camp, vous gérerez le personnel de cuisine, planifierez les menus, superviserez la production alimentaire en conformité avec les normes de Newrest et le contrat du client.

MISSIONS :

  • Planifier les menus en consultation avec le chef de camp
  • Répartir les tâches au personnel de cuisine
  • Prendre en charge les opérations en l'absence du chef de camp.
  • Organiser toutes les ressources au sein de la cuisine et des autres secteurs
  • Superviser la production alimentaire selon les normes de l'entreprise, en mettant l'accent sur la présentation, l'hygiène et l'économie, et avoir des connaissances en boulangerie.
  • Planifier et calculer le coût des menus en coordination avec le chef de camp.
  • Être responsable de l'attribution des tâches aux autres membres du personnel de cuisine.
  • Être responsable de la mise en œuvre de la politique et de la discipline de l'entreprise dans la zone de production.
  • Développer et former les compétences du personnel de cuisine afin qu'il puisse prétendre à une promotion.
  • Veiller au nettoyage et à la propreté des tables de travail, à la réduction du gaspillage et à la propreté de la cuisine.
  • Connaître et respecter toutes les règles et procédures de sécurité
  • Superviser efficacement le personnel de cuisine pour s'assurer que toutes les règles et procédures HSE sont respectées et que les dangers, les quasi-accidents et les accidents sont correctement signalés.
  • Veiller à sa propre hygiène et à celle de tout le personnel de production.
  • Surveiller, aider, trier et maintenir les stocks de viande, de poisson, de légumes et d'articles surgelés.
  • Participer à la réalisation des inventaires
  • Vérifier la qualité des aliments reçus et les empiler dans les boîtes à aliments et autres matériels dans un ordre acceptable.

PROFIL :

  • Minimum 5 ans d'expérience en tant que cuisinier / chef cuisinier / chef cuisinier.
  • Avoir des connaissances et des compétences dans la préparation de menus internationaux.
  • Une expérience sur site « remote » est un réel plus
  • Connaissance des outils informatiques
  • Anglais courant, le français est un plus
  • La satisfaction du client sera votre priorité
  • Capacité à gérer un personnel multiculturel
  • Rigueur
  • Orientation vers les résultats
  • Résistance aux situations stressantes
  • Bien organisé, rigoureux et méthodique mais suffisamment d'adaptabilité aux contraintes locales.

CONTRAT : Contrat à durée indéterminée - Date de début dès que possible

LIEU : Canada (Travail à distance)

SALAIRE : Selon l'expérience et le profil

Le Groupe Newrest, spécialiste de la restauration hors-foyer, est aujourd’hui le seul caterer à intervenir sur l’ensemble des secteurs de la restauration et des services associés : catering aérien, buy-on-board, duty-free à bord, restauration concédée, bases-vie et services de support, catering ferroviaire, concessions de restauration aéroportuaires et autoroutières.

Avec plus de 29 500 collaborateurs dans 57 pays, Newrest vous offre des opportunités de carrière en France et à l’international au sein d'un Groupe qui est en recherche permanente de nouveaux talents pour ses filiales sur les 5 continents. Rejoindre Newrest, c'est participer à une aventure entrepreneuriale passionnante offrant des opportunités de carrière unique.

Pour postuler, veuillez envoyer un courriel à dorval.rh@newrest.eu

MERCI DE NOTER QUE NOUS CHERCHONS DES CANDIDATS DÉJÀ PRÉSENTS SUR LE TERRITOIRE CANADIEN AVEC UN DOCUMENT VALIDE DE TRAVAIL.

______________________________________________________________________

Newrest is looking for an Executive Chef to support its projects in Canada.

Under the supervision of the Camp Boss, you will manage kitchen staff, plan menus, supervise food production in compliance with Newrest standard and client contract.

MISSIONS:

  • Plan menus in consultation with Camp Boss
  • Allocate duties to Kitchen Staff
  • Take charge of the operation in the absence of Camp Boss
  • Organize all the resources within the Kitchen and other areas
  • Supervise food production to the companies standard, with particular emphasis on presentation hygiene and economy, in addition should also be knowledgable in bakery products
  • Plan and cost menus in co-ordination with the Camp Boss
  • Be responsible for allocation of work to other Kitchen Staff
  • Be responsible for implementing company policy and discipline in the production area
  • Develop and train Kitchen Staff in skills in order to be eligible for promotion
  • Ensure proper mopping and cleanliness of worktables, minimum wastage and kitchen cleanliness
  • Know and observe all safety rules and procedures
  • Effectively supervise Kitchen Staff to ensure all HSE rules & procedures are followed and hazards/near miss and accidents are properly reported
  • Ensure proper grooming and hygiene of self and all production staff
  • Oversee/assist/sort out stores and maintain stores including meat, fish, vegetable, and frozen items
  • Assist in taking of inventories
  • Check quality of food received and stacked in food-box and other material in acceptable order

PROFILE:

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as Cook / Head Cook/ Chief Cook
  • Having knowledge and skills in the preparation of international food
  • A remote experience is mandatory
  • IT tools awareness
  • English fluent, French is a plus
  • Client satisfaction will be your priority
  • Ability to manage a multicultural staff
  • Rigorous
  • Outcome orientation
  • Resistance to stressful situations
  • Well organized, rigorous and methodical but enough adaptability to local constraints.

CONTRACT: Permanent contract – Starting date as soon as possible

LOCATION: Canada ( Remote position)

SALARY: Depending on experience and profile

The Newrest Group, a specialist in out-of-home catering, is today the only caterer to operate in all sectors of catering and related services: airline catering, buy-on-board, duty-free on-board, concessionary catering, life bases and support services, rail catering, airport and motorway catering concessions.

With more than 29,500 employees in 57 countries, Newrest offers you career opportunities in France and internationally within a Group that is constantly looking for new talent for its subsidiaries on 5 continents. Joining Newrest means taking part in an exciting entrepreneurial adventure offering unique career opportunities.

To apply, please send an e-mail at dorval.rh@newrest.eu

PLEASE NOTE THAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR CANDIDATES WHO ARE ALREADY PRESENT IN CANADA WITH A VALID WORK DOCUMENT.

title: newCorporate Concierge
description:
Get started on an exciting career at Element!
Element employees make a difference in the lives of others every day. We are re-defining the fleet management industry to be people first, then business – delivering on our promise of a superior client experience. This takes hard work and innovation, and we need more like-minded people on our team.
What We Need
We are looking for a Corporate Concierge to join our Element team. As the largest pure-play fleet manager in the world, we provide unmatched products and services and solutions to our clients.
At Element, employees play a critical role in delivering value to customers and ensuring an exceptional client experience. We are committed to the success of our clients, employees, and investors by fostering a culture where every employee can make a difference!
Are You:
  • Polished and professional with a can-do attitude?
  • An effective problem solver with the ability to work independently in a fast paced environment?
As the Corporate Concierge, you will be the face and voice of Element, performing a broad range of administrative duties for both internal and external customers. There will be a high level of visibility in this role and exposure to key leaders in the organization.
A Day in the Life
  • Answers main reception phone and screens calls for leadership teams.
  • Tech savvy - assist team in technology setups for client/customer experience showcase areas
  • Provide communications to organization regarding pivotal events, i.e. building related issues, company gatherings/celebrations and general facility information.
  • Liaise with building staff for security, maintenance, cleaning and other office related matters.
  • Ensure compliance with office policies such as access control and visitor process.
  • Manage vendors (ordering, invoicing, reconciliation, etc.) including caterers, snack and beverage and others as necessary.
  • Ensure that conference rooms and break/shared areas are tidy, stocked with supplies and ready for the next session.
  • Welcome new employees and assist with first day tasks.
  • Monthly updating of floor plan of office teams and maintaining accurate headcount and seating data
Requirements
  • High School Diploma or equivalent. Post graduate degree highly desirable
  • Minimum of two years’ experience in an administrative customer-facing role
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Thrives in a fast-paced corporate environment
  • Strong sense of responsibility and dedication to work independently
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs
#LI-SJ1
What’s in it for You
  • A culture of innovation, empowerment, decision-making, and accountability
  • Comprehensive health and welfare benefits that serve the needs of you and your family and foster a culture of wellness
  • Additional benefits and amenities, including paid time-off programs (vacation, sick leave, and holidays)
  • Hybrid work environment for most positions
Applicants will be required to undergo a background check only if and after a conditional offer of employment has been extended.
Beginning January 1, 2022, Element requires new hires to provide their COVID-19 vaccination status as of their start date. This requirement is a condition of employment at Element and must be provided prior to commencing employment. If working in an Element office, full vaccination against COVID-19 may be a requirement of employment. If you are unable to receive the vaccine due to a health condition or because it is prohibited as a result of your sincerely held religious beliefs, you will have an opportunity to request a reasonable accommodation.
Element Fleet Management and its wholly owned subsidiaries are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability, national origin, Aboriginal/Native American status, protected veterans’ status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application and interview process are available upon request. Should you require an accommodation with our hiring process please send an email to
talentacquisition@elementcorp.com
or call (800) 665-9744.
Read more about our
Culture
.
Learn about the
Technology
and
Fleet Services
we offer our clients.

title: Cooks/Cashiers/Shift Leaders
description:
Canuel Caterers is a food and beverage company offering food service in education, corporate catering, corporate dining and sport and entertainment services. We are an established company with 27 years of growth and counting. We offer a competitive benefits package to full time employees and welcome the desire for advancement within the company.

We are currently hiring full and part-time cooks, cashiers and shift leaders for our cafe located in the Poirier Sports and Leisure Complex in Coquitlam open 7 days a week.

Requirements:
-Food Safe Certificate
-Anyone +19yrs must have a SIR Certificate
-Flexible Availability

On-site training will be provided for the right candidate.

We can’t wait to hear from you!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Part-time hours: 4-40 per week

Salary: $16.00-$18.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

title: Event Chef
description:
We are the leading company in our industry in the Montreal area for over 20 years. We are hiring an experienced CATER CHEF to take the lead ON EVENT and to help us keep growing. If you're dedicated and ambitious, we are an an excellent place to grow your career. Don't hesitate to apply.
Responsibilities for Caterer

  • Attend weekly meetings
  • Participate and oversee the production of menu items
  • Ensure quality of final product meets or exceeds standards
  • Package all food for safe and secure transportation
  • Insure proper use and rotation of perishable goods
  • Ensure all staff are adhering to safety and health regulations
  • on event Chef take the lead and manage the team
  • Make sure all food is served to our standard and minimised the waste
  • Can take the lead on event of 500 guest ( station or banquet)

Qualifications for Caterer

  • Some College (preferred)
  • 5+ years in a kitchen environment
  • 2 years in a management role
  • Firm understanding of basic baking and cooking protocol
  • Ability to follow detailed directions without error
  • Familiarity with industrial kitchen equipment
  • Comfortable overseeing a team of subordinates
  • A drive to work safely and efficiently
  • Direct the team on event, and is able to work with deadlines and time line
  • Willingness to work nights, weekends and holidays
  • Good leadership and team work

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Part-time hours: 30-50 per week

Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Montréal, QC H2S 2M7: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Cooking: 1 year (preferred)
  • Chefs: 1 year (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-04-15
