title: Facilities Administrator
description:
APEGA Career Opportunity:

Facilities Administrator

Full-time, Permanent
Location: Calgary
Competition #22-10

Want to be part of a team that makes a difference? Come be part of the change.

Since 1920, APEGA has been regulating the practices of engineering and geoscience to serve the public interest in Alberta.

We are looking for energetic individuals who thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, and challenging environment. You need to be committed to serving the community with integrity, accountability, and innovation, and have a desire to deliver exceptional service. If you reflect these values, have the knowledge, skills, and abilities to make a difference through your work, and are passionate about acting in the best interest of public safety – then come be a part of our diverse team!

Together we can help shape the present and future practices of professional engineers and geoscientists of Alberta.

Position Summary

Reporting to the Manager, Office & Facilities Services, the Facilities Administrator contributes to the efficient and professional management of the APEGA office by being the primary contact for APEGA's Meeting Rooms.

This includes being responsible for scheduling and assisting with in-house activities, including booking, set up & take down, catering, cleanliness, A/V needs, registration, etc. The Facilities Administrator will also maintain the meeting rooms and kitchen facilities, ordering supplies, and ensuring organization and adequate inventory, and providing fist-level support for property management inquiries and concerns.

Responsibilities

  • Coordinating the use of and manage all meeting room calendars for APEGA’s meeting rooms and conference space for internal staff, volunteer committees, and external parties.
  • Initiating contract creation and invoice completion for rentals to external parties.
  • Providing professional meeting and tier 1 technical support for all events held within APEGA Meeting Rooms.
  • General oversight of all technology and office services equipment, ensuring excellent working order, organization, and cleanliness, escalating issues to the IT department when necessary.
  • Providing basic A/V training to staff.
  • Setting up and on-the-spot trouble shooting of audiovisual needs.
  • Liaising with Administrative Assistants to ensure meeting requirements are clearly communicated and achieved.
  • Coordinating and executing of the complete catering life cycle including researching menu options; working the administrative assistants or external parties to choose a menu within budget and on theme; working with the vendor to arrange for necessary catering and setting up, monitoring, and clearing catering and dishware.
  • Developing and maintaining strong vendor relationships with caterers, suppliers, and other service providers.
  • Liaising with the Property Management, on behalf of the Manager, Office & Facilities Services, when necessary.
  • Coordinating and overseeing office maintenance, repairs, and housekeeping that is regularly scheduled or as needed.
  • Supporting internal staff arrivals, departures and relocations with their seating, workspace cleanliness, assigned keys, mailboxes, moving bins, deficiencies, and special requests.
  • Providing back up support for Receptionist and Office Services Administrator.
  • Managing the day-to-day implementation of the Safety, Health, and Environmental Management Program.
  • Performing health and safety audits, investigations, and inspections.
  • Participating in the Safety, Health, and Environmental Committee.

Competencies, Skills & Attributes

  • Core competencies: Exemplifying Integrity, Fostering Communication, Results Orientation, Service Excellence and Teamwork.
  • Functional Competencies: Adaptability, Attention to Detail, Inventory/Supply Management, Planning and Organizing, and Problem Solving.
  • Knowledge of Meeting Room and Health and Safety Procedures.
  • A/V technologies used in the APEGA meeting spaces including both physical equipment and digital platforms including A/V diagnosing and trouble shooting.
  • Safe food handling procedures.
  • Strong customer service skills and excellent problem-solving skills.
  • Microsoft Office (Outlook).
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written).

Qualifications

  • Post-secondary diploma in a related field with 2-3 years of administrative experience in a professional setting.
  • Experience working with Microsoft Office is required.
  • Prior experience in property management administration, event planning, customer service, or within a hospitality environment is an asset.
  • This position keeps a full-time in office schedule.

How to Apply

Closing Date: Until successful candidate is found.

We acknowledge all candidates working in their area of expertise may build their knowledge, skills, and competencies in several ways. We welcome candidates from a breadth of backgrounds, who may have equivalent skills and competencies to the ones listed above. There may be APEGA positions posted that have specific regulatory requirements, and in keeping with those requirements, APEGA will follow the guidelines that we are bound by. All candidates are considered with the objective to enhance APEGA’s people and culture.


APEGA’s Vaccination policy and protocol is currently suspended requiring agency contractors and staff to be fully vaccinated and required to show proof of vaccination. This policy and protocol may be reinstated at any time in alignment with public health measures.

If you are interested in this position, please submit your cover letter and resume, including your salary expectations, as one pdf document (file name: LastName_FirstName.pdf) to the People Experience Team at peopleexperience@apega.ca.

Please note, each submission needs to clearly indicate the competition number of the position you are applying for. If you are submitting a resume for multiple positions, please ensure you send a separate submission for each competition.

We acknowledge all candidates working in their area of expertise may build their knowledge, skills, and competencies in several ways. We welcome candidates from a breadth of backgrounds, who may have equivalent skills and competencies to the ones listed above. There may be APEGA positions posted that have specific regulatory requirements, and in keeping with those requirements, APEGA will follow the guidelines that we are bound by. All candidates are considered with the objective to enhance APEGA's people and culture.

Thank you for your interest in APEGA.
Only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Manager, Banquet and Event Services (Conference Centre)
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW: The Globe and Mail is a national icon and Canada’s most recognized media brand. We’re also an international award winner for data visualization, design, and creative storytelling. A digital innovator with a global client list for our in-house AI-powered optimization, prediction and automation platform. And a place where Canadians come for the best journalism in the country. We aim to reflect Canada in the stories we tell and in our workforce. The Globe is a proud partner of Pride At Work, Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion, and a signatory of the BlackNorth Initiative. We understand our staff have lives outside of the office and offer flexible work arrangements and support programs. We also provide training and mentorships to staff to ensure you’re able to grow and challenge yourself and your abilities. No matter what your role at The Globe, you’ll be part of an organization dedicated to making a difference to Canada.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Globe and Mail Centre’s Manager, Banquet and Event Services, is responsible for the delivery of venue events, leading a team of full-time, casual and agency staff, and meeting superb standards of customer care. An individual with a passion to exceed client expectations, this position oversees the in-house venue and beverage services, and works in collaboration with preferred caterers, AV supplier and other vendors for seamless event execution. Bar/beverage duties include the preparation of beverage service orders, management of inventory, team training, and evolving business practices to improve services and profitability.

The Manager, Banquet and Event Services, ensures high safety, hygiene and health standards are upheld by all staff, and that bar services adhere to A.G.C.O and Toronto Health standards. This role ensures the venue is operated with utmost in business ethics.

Reporting to the Managing Director, Conference Centre and working collaboratively with the Centre’s management team, including the Operations Manager, Event Managers and Sales Managers, this is a full time role with flexible hours including early mornings, evenings and weekends.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Overall responsibility for delivering event services, contributing to the achievement of service and profit targets through the implementation of strategies and procedures for a growing event venue business.
  • Providing exceptional customer service, cultivating a warm, engaging and welcoming environment for clients and guests, and promoting a collaborative team environment with all staff, suppliers, vendors.
  • Designing, evolving and achieving event floor standard operating procedures and service objectives.
  • Conducting recruitment and training initiatives, performance management and on the job coaching for venue & beverage supervisors, bartenders, beverage attendants, security guards, greeters, coat check attendants, and other staff, ensuring all team members are meeting service and performance standards and protocols.
  • Building and maintaining professional relationships with staff, senior management, vendors, agents and suppliers.
  • Multi-tasking and balancing priorities under pressure, staying calm and focused in stressful situations.
  • Demonstrating high personal integrity, ensuring that all financial gain or any benefits are done so in the name of the company only.
  • Advising Event Managers on floor plans, product selection and staffing to ensure service levels are appropriate and efficient.
  • Updating and evolving beverage menus and service methodologies, advising on product selections to improve offerings, efficiencies and profitability.
  • Ensuring all events are meeting A.G.C.O., Health and Safety, and Smart Serve standards, complying with & implementing all legislative and licensing requirements.
  • Inventory management, including ordering, coordinating deliveries, maintaining stock levels, product rotation, quality control, returns and expense management, reporting, as well as glassware/barware rentals and inventories.
  • Managing stock and equipment distribution and return for individual events, along with consumption sheet and POS system setup and reconciliation. Complete product and billing documentation and facilitating return of products to inventories and/or suppliers post-event.
  • Securing off-list products for custom orders, and managing timely returns of excess inventory. Managing donated/corkage product deliveries, preparation and supplier return for fundraising events.
  • Taking initiative in the care of venue facilities and taking steps to protect assets, including cleanliness, repair and maintenance, reporting any issues as required.
  • Supporting client site tours, educating and guiding clients and vendors on menu selections, and custom consultations for specialty menus and services.
  • Ensuring cash and billing procedures are adhered to and strictly monitored.
  • Ensuring bar, beverage and venue equipment and facilities are properly cleaned, maintained, updating logs and records, and liaising with vendors as required.
  • Administration of venue services including ensuring event details and billings are accurate. Maintaining program systems, calendars and databases.
  • Providing post-event analysis, and responding to client feedback.
  • Represent The Globe and Mail at meetings and events as requested.
  • Other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
  • Previous hands-on experience leading venue, banquets beverage and/or catering services teams at event venues for corporate and private functions, preferably in a Banquet Manager role.
  • Experience facilitating training and coaching programs for staff teams, and creating manuals, procedures and job aids in the hospitality industry.
  • Entrepreneurial drive to grow a new business and increase profitability. Demonstrated business improvements in past roles, with strong analytical skills.
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills, administrative and organizational skills with the ability to manage a large and variable workload, and the ability to ensure the accurate completion of high volumes of detailed work.
  • Ability to build relationships with clients, colleagues and stakeholders.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with ambitious goals and multiple priorities, with a willingness to work flexible hours.
  • Bar product knowledge, including hands-on bartending and event beverage preparation experience, WSET Intermediate Wine and/or Spirit Certificate or comparable an asset.
  • Inventory management, billing/invoicing systems and POS system experience.
  • SmartServe and Food Handling certifications and familiarity with food/beverage industry best practices.
  • Proficiency in all Microsoft Office applications including Intermediate skills in Excel, Outlook, and Word.
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs is an asset.
  • Post-secondary diploma/degree in Hospitality.
Applications will be considered until a suitable candidate has been found.

VACCINATION POLICY:
All offers of employment with The Globe and Mail are conditional upon the candidate being Fully Vaccinated. To be Fully Vaccinated is defined as someone who has received the full series of a vaccine or a combination of vaccines accepted by the Government of Canada (currently Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca, Janssen) and has received the last dose at least 14 days prior to their start date. To prove they are Fully Vaccinated, all new hires will be required to provide evidence by emailing a copy of their vaccine dose administration receipt(s) to Human Resources prior to their start date. Those seeking exemption based on one or more of the protected grounds in the Human Rights Code will need to provide their request for accommodation to Human Resources for approval. If the accommodation request is not approved and the candidate is not Fully Vaccinated, any offer of employment will be revoked.

THE GLOBE AND MAIL IS DEDICATED TO DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION IN THE WORKPLACE

The Globe and Mail is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. We believe this strengthens our business and our journalism. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, regardless of race, ethnicity, culture, gender, sexual orientation, religion, socio-economic status, age, and physical ability. As required by the Federal Contractors Program, The Globe also tracks the proportion of staff in the four Employment Equity categories (Women, Aboriginal Peoples, Persons with Disabilities, and Members of Visible Minorities) to ensure we are reflecting the areas in which we work.

The Globe and Mail offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

title: Line Cook / Prep Cook
description:
Simply Foods is a fast growing catering company with an exciting opportunity to take local food to the next level.

Our mission: To make simple, quality food accessible to everyone.

We are currently renovating our kitchen facility in Delta, with the goal of expanding our service offerings which will also include opening an exciting new bistro concept on-site! We are temporarily operating out of a commercial kitchen in Burnaby until May.

As a high volume caterer with a passion for providing meals to our community's most vulnerable, we service a range of different clients and programs throughout Metro Vancouver, 7 days a week.

As a valuable Prep Cook, you are responsible for ensuring the rest of the kitchen team has everything they need to succeed, so strong attention to detail and a positive attitude are a must!

We're looking for someone who:

  • can be self-reliant but can also work well in a team
  • has the hustle and a solid 'can-do' attitude to get stuff done quickly, safely, and efficiently
  • is able to lift up to 50lbs
  • can carefully review and follow daily BEOs (Banquet Event Orders), catering menus, and preparation sheets
  • understands proper portioning control and plating food as per recipe specifications
  • can label and stock food ingredients on shelves in an organized manner
  • understands proper food safety protocols and sanitation guidelines according to health authority standards (clean as you go, date-stamping, temp controls, etc.)
  • is comfortable with standard manners of food preparation involving: meat/poultry, fruits/vegetables, dairy, grains, and dry ingredients
  • has experience with batch-cooking and high volume production of sandwiches/wraps, sauces, pastas, salads, and other meal components (we deliver over 1,000 meals a day to schools!)

What we need from you:

  • a strong passion for food and helping your community
  • patience and willingness to learn as we grow
  • ability to adapt to problems, new opportunities, and change
  • schedule flexibility (you will be on a set schedule, but due to COVID or other health factors, we may ask you to support the team on various shifts when needed)
  • drivers license and access to a vehicle (an asset but not a requirement)
  • minimum 1-2 years high-volume kitchen experience

If this sounds like a good fit, we would love a chance to meet you and discuss further!

Please visit www.simplyfoods.ca for more information about our mission.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $17.00-$19.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

COVID-19 considerations:
Masks in the kitchen are recommended but not required at this time. Standard COVID precautions still apply, as staff will be asked to stay/go home if not feeling well or exhibiting symptoms.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Delta, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • Cooking: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Food Safe, SafeCheck, Food Handler or equivalent (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-01
Expected start date: 2022-05-01

title: Camp Boss
description:
Newrest recherche un Camp Boss pour ses projets au Canada.

MISSIONS:

Administration:

  • Contrôler les commandes et les inventaires des différents services (y compris le département maintenance)
  • Prendre en charge le suivi des commandes et des denrées stockées
  • S’assurer que la qualité des produits et des conditions de stockage sont conformes avec les normes internes
  • Appliquer et faire appliquer les standards qualités et les règles de sécurité
  • Informer le client de la qualité et de la composition des menus
  • S’assurer que les menus préparés par le chef sont conformes aux exigences du client


Management:

  • Organiser le planning des équipes, fournir les documents demandés par le directeur pays pour suivre la masse salariale
  • Superviser et participer à la formation du personnel
  • Mener des inspections régulières (cuisines, restaurants, magasins …)


Relation client:

  • Améliorer l’image de marque de Newrest sur le site et informer la hiérarchie de tout mécontentement du client.
  • Développer de bonnes relations avec le client


PROFIL:


  • Au moins 3 ans dans une position similaire à un niveau international
  • Capacité à utiliser l’outil informatique
  • Français et Anglais courants


Savoir être et savoir-faire :

  • Capacité à gérer une équipe multiculturelle
  • Rigueur
  • Capacité à rentabiliser un projet
  • Résistance au stress
  • Sens de l’organisation, de la méthode et respect des contraintes locales


TYPE DE CONTRAT : CDI à pourvoir dès que possible.

LOCALISATION : Canada (travail à distance)

REMUNERATION : Selon profil et expérience.

Le Groupe Newrest, spécialiste de la restauration hors-foyer, est aujourd’hui le seul caterer à intervenir sur l’ensemble des secteurs de la restauration et des services associés : catering aérien, buy-on-board, duty-free à bord, restauration concédée, bases-vie et services de support, catering ferroviaire, concessions de restauration aéroportuaires et autoroutières.

Avec plus de 29 500 collaborateurs dans 57 pays, Newrest vous offre des opportunités de carrière en France et à l’international au sein d'un Groupe qui est en recherche permanente de nouveaux talents pour ses filiales sur les 5 continents. Rejoindre Newrest, c'est participer à une aventure entrepreneuriale passionnante offrant des opportunités de carrière unique.


Pour postuler, veuillez envoyer un courriel à dorval.rh@newrest.eu

MERCI DE NOTER QUE NOUS CHERCHONS DES CANDIDATS DÉJÀ PRÉSENTS SUR LE TERRITOIRE CANADIEN AVEC UN DOCUMENT VALIDE DE TRAVAIL.

Newrest is looking for a Camp Boss for its projects in Canada.

MISSIONS:

Administration:

  • Control the orders and inventories of the different departments (including the maintenance department)
  • Take charge of the follow-up of orders and stored goods
  • Ensure that the quality of products and storage conditions are in accordance with internal standards
  • Apply and enforce quality standards and safety regulations
  • Inform the client of the quality and composition of the menus
  • Ensure that the menus prepared by the chef comply with the customer's requirements

Management:

  • Organize the team schedule, provide documents requested by the country manager to monitor the payroll
  • Supervise and participate in staff training
  • Conduct regular inspections (kitchens, restaurants, stores ...)

Customer relations:

  • Improve Newrest's brand image on site and inform management of any customer dissatisfaction.
  • Develop good customer relations

PROFIL:

  • At least 3 years in a similar position at an international level
  • Ability to use IT tools
  • Fluent in French and English

Skills and know-how:

  • Ability to manage a multicultural team
  • Rigor
  • Ability to make a project profitable
  • Resistance to stress
  • Sense of organization, method and respect for local constraints

TYPE OF CONTRACT: Permanent contract

LOCATION: Canada ( Remote Position)

REMUNERATION: According to profile and experience.

The Newrest Group, a specialist in out-of-home catering, is today the only caterer to operate in all sectors of catering and related services: airline catering, buy-on-board, duty-free on-board, concessionary catering, life bases and support services, rail catering, airport and motorway catering concessions.

With more than 29,500 employees in 57 countries, Newrest offers you career opportunities in France and internationally within a Group that is constantly looking for new talent for its subsidiaries on 5 continents. Joining Newrest means taking part in an exciting entrepreneurial adventure offering unique career opportunities.

To apply, please send an e-mail at dorval.rh@newrest.eu

PLEASE NOTE THAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR CANDIDATES WHO ARE ALREADY PRESENT IN CANADA WITH A VALID WORK DOCUMENT.

Butcher Assistant/ Packer

We are a custom wholesale butcher supplying meat products to many of your favorite restaurants, caterers, and convention centers within the GTA and southern Ontario. Our small but efficient team is committed to provide our customers excellent service and product.

title: Commis Chef + Kitchen Supervisor
description:
We are looking for talents to join our team as a Commis Chef/Kitchen Supervisor for our sandwich and culinary production in our wholesale and catering department. If you are fun, creative, energetic, motivated, positive, and willing to learn and share knowledge, you are the person that we are looking for!

Job Type: Full-time; 5 work days a week
Competitive industry pay based on experience

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead and supervise an intimate and dynamic production team

  • Train newly hired production staff

  • Coordinate production team schedules

  • Prepare all inventory, stock rotation and ordering

  • Prepare products according to company standardized manuals

  • Prep work for wholesale sandwich production

  • General maintenance, cleaning and tidying of the kitchen

Qualifications

  • Eligible to work in Canada

  • Has obtained a Foodsafe Certificate level 1 or above

  • Strong organizational skill and time management skill are required

  • Prior experience in a culinary setting is required

  • Ability to perform with consistency

  • Class 5 driver license is an asset

title: DZ Driver
description:
CLS Catering Services (part of LSG Sky Chef & Cathay Pacific) offers you the opportunity to be part of the inner workings of an exciting industry in a diverse and dynamic environment.

  • We are looking for 1* permanent FULL TIME Driver*. The selected candidate must be able to work rotational Monday to Sunday, possible statutory holiday. Rotational shifts; morning, afternoon and nights.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Receive confirmed meal checks and release notification prior to removing items from the refrigerators for deliver.
  • Deliver company products and equipment to and from warehouse, cargo facilities, aircraft or other locations as required using hi-lift vehicles.
  • Load and offload carts, trollies, equipment and supplies onto and off aircrafts as per flight specifications.
  • Place delivered items into correct cabins and belly stowage locations.
  • Guide drivers into and out of aircraft galley door and belly locations as required.
  • Monitor aircraft registration, arrival and departure times to prioritize work assignments.
  • Complete all driver reports and associated forms on a daily basis.
  • Complete daily vehicle safety inspections. Report any defects on hi-lift vehicles to the Operations Supervisor.
  • Perform bagging and storing of wet ice cubes.
  • Refuel company vehicles as required.
  • Perform all tasks in a safe and hygienic manner.
  • Maintain regular housekeeping for all vehicles.

We are looking for:

  • Ability to read and write in English.
  • Able to stop, bend and repetitively lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 pounds.
  • Must have at least 3 years of practical experience.
  • Valid DZ license.
  • Holds a valid air brake certificate.
  • Clean driving abstract.
  • Meet all MoT requirements and airport regulations.
  • Must be reliable, professional and presentable.

In return, we offer an excellent compensation program including competitive salary, free parking (accessible by bus), comprehensive healthcare and dental benefits program, free uniform and tools are provided for the position, safety shoes reimbursement, and hot meal supplied when working. Please note that all employment is contingent upon the selected candidate’s successful clearance of all compliance requirements such as a clear medical and criminal record.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Join the CLS Catering Services Team! CLS Catering Services Ltd. is a joint venture of Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd. & LSG Sky Chefs, the world’s largest airline caterer and provider of integrated services solutions. These include catering, buy-on-board, in-flight equipment logistics, consulting and lounge services. The company’s extensive know-how in culinary excellence and logistics has led to its’ successful entry in adjacent markets, such as train services and retail. In addition to providing catering service for airlines, we service retail customers such as Starbucks. CLS Catering Services operates in Toronto, Vancouver and Calgary airports and has been an industry leader in Canada well over 30 years.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Discounted or free food
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • driver: 3 years (preferred)

Language:

  • English (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • DZ/AZ Licence (required)
  • Canadian Residency or Work Permit (required)

Application deadline: 2022-04-07

title: newDelivery Driver
description:
Company description

KILO-BEAUX GATEAUX is a manufacturer of quality desserts specializing in cakes, cheesecakes, pies and individual desserts. Our dessert making story began a little over 30 years ago. Now working under one roof, we’ve grown into one of the most beloved and respected dessert manufacturers around. Servicing various clients including restaurants, hotels, caterers, retail establishments and distributors across Canada.

Our company commitment is simple:

To exceed customer expectations by anticipating their needs, the use of quality ingredients and providing impeccable customer service. We love our cakes and you’ll surely love them too!

Job description

Main functions

  • * Provide exemplary customer service;
  • * Make deliveries to our customers;
  • * Receive payments from customers;
  • * Assist in the preparation of deliveries;
  • * Monitor transport to destination and meet delivery schedules;
  • * Provide quality customer service;
  • * Work in accordance with company policies and procedures;
  • * Know and apply road safety rules;
  • * Perform other tasks requested and defined by his superior

Requirements and skills required

  • * Have knowledge of the streets of Montreal and the boroughs;
  • * Be diligent, punctual, responsible and conscientious;
  • * Be organized and resourceful;
  • * Knowing how to manage your time;
  • * Have initiative and a good capacity for adaptation;
  • * Have one (1) year of experience in a similar position (an Asset)
  • * Must be in good physical condition (essential).
  • * Bilingual (French and English) (an asset)
  • * Availability Day shift from Tuesday to Saturday 7 a.m. (45-50 hours / week)

Why come and work at Kilo Desserts - Beaux Gateaux

  • * Training / learning and development;
  • * Social advantages;
  • * Full-time position and job stability;
  • * Rewarding job;
  • * Good management;
  • * Accessible by public transport (Metro Namur or de la Savane);
  • * Salary according to experience;

Work remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $17.00-$20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care

  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

-We follow safety COVID regulations.

Education:

Experience:

  • delivery driver: 1 year (preferred)

Language:

  • French (preferred)
  • English (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Drivers License Class 5 (preferred)

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (preferred)

Expected start date: 2021-06-10

title: newKitchen Assistant (Taggart Family Y location) , Child Care S...
description:
Position: Kitchen Assistant (Taggart Family Y location) , Child Care Services
Location: 180 Argyle Ave, Ottawa, ON K2P 1B7
Type: Full-time contract ends May 16, 2023. Preferred start date May 16, 2022 with an hourly rate of $15.00.
Preferred start date: Monday, May 16, 2022
Closing date: Thursday, May 12, 2022

Overview:

As one of the largest charitable community service organizations in Canada, the YMCA-YWCA of the National Capital Region responds to critical social needs in the community and works to provide lasting solutions. Serving thousands of people across our region annually, we are a leader and valued partner in creating a vibrant and healthy community where everyone belongs and can reach their full potential. This position requires a commitment to the Y mission and core values of responsibility, honesty, caring, respect, and inclusion, which form the foundation of all Y programs and services.

Working for the Y

Are you looking to use your skills and unique gifts to make a real difference in your community? The YMCA-YWCA of the National Capital Region is a great workplace committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, where different backgrounds, experiences, and identities are appreciated and celebrated. The YMCA-YWCA provides hundreds of employees with meaningful jobs and the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of individuals and the health of our communities. We recognize the contributions of our staff through innovative practices, great benefits, and growth opportunities. Whether you are starting out in your career or a seasoned professional, you will find many exciting opportunities to achieve your personal and career goals. Some of the benefits of working for the Y include:

What we offer

At the Y, you will be part of a vibrant and diverse network of people whose shared vision is to change lives and make our communities home to the healthiest children, teens, adults, and families.

Our competitive wage and benefit package include:

  • Free Y membership.
  • Discounted Y program fees (including health & fitness programs, child care, and camps)
  • Access to an Employee Assistance Program

What you offer?

The Kitchen Assistant is accountable to the Senior Coordinator and will function as a team member responsible for overseeing the function of the kitchen, ensuring that meals and afternoon snacks are delivered to the program rooms in a timely fashion. The Kitchen Assistant will also provide support to the teachers during busy transition times at the lunch hour allowing Teachers the time to focus on the children.

The Kitchen Assistant must be courteous and professional in dealing with parents, all members and the general public, exemplifying YMCA-YWCA values, and maintaining a high standard of work ethic.

Some of the tasks of this position include:

  • Deliver lunch to the program rooms.
  • Ensure that staff members have the necessary items for lunch distribution.
  • After lunch, ensure all leftover food and dishes are tidied up and stored according to Public Health Guidelines
  • Clean, wash, sterilize and store all dishes as per Public Health Guidelines.
  • Carry out housekeeping duties, as required.
  • Thoroughly rinse all catering dishes supplied, leaving them with the hot box to be returned to the caterer.
  • Set out afternoon snack and appropriate dishes on the trolleys for staff.
  • In consultation with child care coordinator, program staff and the caterer, ensure that appropriate substitute meals and snacks are provided for children with food allergies and/or dietary restrictions.
  • Attend staff meetings and training seminars as required.
  • Develop and maintain constructive and open communication with staff


What qualifications and abilities are we looking for?

At YMCA-YWCA of the National Capital Region, we strive to ensure our employees are a fit based on their strengths, interests, and future goals.

The successful candidate will have the following:

Education

  • Minimum current Food Handler Certificate
  • Current Standard First Aid and CPR ‘C’ with AED Certifications
  • Obtain Food Handler certification

Language

  • Fluent in English; written and oral

Experience, Abilities & Skills

  • Basic knowledge of child development and experience working with children
  • Highly motivated, enthusiastic and responsible individual with strong leadership skills committed to the healthy development of children
  • Highly motivated, enthusiastic and responsible individual with strong leadership skills committed to the healthy development of children
  • Ability to perform all physical aspects of the position, including frequently moving around, bending, reaching, and lifting up to 50lbs
  • Demonstrates strong support and commitment to community activities, representing the YMCA in a professional manner

Additional Requirements:

  • Applicants must already have a valid permit to work in Canada.
  • Criminal Reference Check for the Vulnerable Sector, not more than 6 months old is required
  • As a condition of employment, in accordance with the COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement Policy for Staff and Volunteers, you are required to provide proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have a valid exemption.
  • Annually all staff must complete the mandatory training for the Protecting Children, Youth, and Vulnerable Persons, and submit the certificate of completion.
  • Must have a thorough understanding of YMCA-YWCA policies, procedures, and guidelines.
  • Letter of good health from physician prior to beginning position
  • Immunizations and Tuberculosis test are up to date prior to beginning position


Core Competencies:

Communication: Communicates in a thorough, clear and timely manner and supports information sharing and goal achievement across the Association.
Integrity: Demonstrates responsible behaviour at all times and maintains high ethical standards.
Teamwork: Participates actively in a team for organizational effectiveness. Creates an atmosphere of trust amongst all team members.
Concern for Health and Safety: Acknowledges and understands how to manage and educate others of risk and harm reduction.
Creativity and Innovation: Plans and implements quality programming in a developmentally appropriate environment.


About diversity and inclusiveness at the Y:

Inclusiveness is a part of our core values and we are committed to ensuring the diversity of the people and communities we serve as well as our staff. We welcome candidates from racialized groups, invisible minorities, Indigenous People, women, persons with disabilities, and persons who identify as 2SLGBTQ+.

How to apply?

All internal applicants must inform their supervisor of their intention to apply for the position. Internal applicants can apply only after completing the probationary period of their current job unless approved by People and Culture.

Applications must be submitted to the YMCA-YWCA of the National Capital Region, and all cover letters should be addressed to Kesha Murray. Please send applications to the Director, Child Care Services, Kesha Murray (kesha.murray@ymcaywca.ca) Taggart Family Y location.

Thank you for your interest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

The YMCA-YWCA of the National Capital Region is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please advise in advance if you require any accommodation during this process. We believe all people have the right to live free from discrimination or harassment of any kind.

title: Venue Supervisor (Conference Centre)
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:
The Globe and Mail is a national icon and Canada’s most recognized media brand.

We’re also an international award winner for data visualization, design, and creative storytelling. A digital innovator with a global client list for our in-house AI-powered optimization, prediction and automation platform. And a place where Canadians come for the best journalism in the country.

We aim to reflect Canada in the stories we tell and in our workforce. The Globe is a proud partner of Pride At Work, Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion, and a signatory of the BlackNorth Initiative. We understand our staff have lives outside of the office and offer flexible work arrangements and support programs. We also provide training and mentorships to staff to ensure you’re able to grow and challenge yourself and your abilities.

No matter what your role at The Globe, you’ll be part of an organization dedicated to making a difference to Canada.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
Reporting to the Manager of Hospitality and Event Services, Venue Supervisors are responsible for ensuring events at The Globe and Mail Centre are executed in a professional, safe and successful manner, and that the client, vendor and guest experience reflects superb service standards.

These positions are casual hourly positions. The work schedule is assigned on an as-need basis for booked events, and varies in length and may include weekends and/or evenings and/or night shifts depending on the nature of the event. Shifts are a minimum of four hours.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Opening and securing premises before and after the event, facilitating the arrival and departure of all other contracted staff, vendors, clients and guests.
  • Ensuring that the venue is run according to the Event Agenda as set out by the Events Manager and AV Production Manager, in a safe, orderly and professional manner in accordance with the conditions of all employment, health and safety, fire, and building regulations, as well as Globe and Mail procedures that include, but are not limited to: liquor licenses, fire code/fire lane policy, sound restrictions, health & safety requirements.
  • Ensuring clients, vendors and caterers are fully informed of, and adhere to, policies and procedures during Event set-up, production, and tear-down.
  • Communicating and organizing any special arrangements client’s request (within protocols).
  • Monitoring client/attendees reactions to find opportunities to exceed expectations and handle complaints, if any, ensuring client/attendees full satisfaction.
  • Ensuring the security, organization and reporting status of stock, goods, equipment and facility rooms.
  • Ensuring operational and service procedures and checklists are completed and with attention to detail.
  • Providing and/or monitoring bartending services in accordance with laws, protocols and procedures.
  • Providing and/or supervising set-up/tear-down duties as per the Event Agenda.
  • Inspecting the pre-set space as per Event Agenda for proper event/equipment set up; assisting or rectifying any deficiencies with appropriate vendor/supplier.
  • Ensuring high levels of cleanliness, safety, and hygiene of the venue are maintained in accordance with Public Health and Venue Protocols. This includes kitchens, bar and washrooms, and identifying hazards and problems if they arise.
  • Monitoring, supervising, and reporting on the work of the Event security, custodial and all other contracted staff/vendors.
  • Proper communications with Loading dock Staff and Building Security to coordinate deliveries and pick-ups.
  • Ensuring waste is disposed of properly and clients, vendors and caterers adhere to the waste policies of the facility.
  • Adhering to uniform requirements.
  • Work as a team with fellow Venue Supervisors and Management to ensure a smooth transition between shifts. Submitting an event report electronically after each event to The Globe and Mail Centre Management Team and reporting any incidents.
  • Overseeing Beverage Supervisor/Bar Staff.
  • Prepare and ensure cash float, deposit, reconciliation and unused drink tickets are deposited according to the cash bar policy and procedure.
  • Contacting the Manager on Duty in the event of an emergency.
  • Confidently and professionally representing The Globe and Mail, and communicating our mission and mandate upon request.
  • Continually strive to maintain the elevated standards of service and environment throughout the venue
  • Other duties as required.
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • 3+ years in an events/hospitality environment, meeting the needs of a wide variety of clients and other stakeholders with superb organization and customer service skills, preferably in a dedicated venue.
  • Must have previous Event/Banquet Manager/Supervisor experience.
  • Must have an understanding of event, alcohol service, catering and hospitality procedures.
  • Ability to trouble-shoot and solve problems under pressure.
  • Ability to connect with clients, colleagues and stakeholders to establish positive and productive ongoing relationships.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with ambitious goals and multiple priorities.
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs. as required, and comfortable with equipment set up/ and tear down duties.
  • Must have SmartServe certification.
  • Food Handling Certification and familiarity with hotel/food/beverage industry best practices is an asset.
  • First Aid: CPR-C is an asset.
  • Willingness to work flexible hours.
VACCINATION POLICY:
All offers of employment with The Globe and Mail are conditional upon the candidate being Fully Vaccinated. To be Fully Vaccinated is defined as someone who has received the full series of a vaccine or a combination of vaccines accepted by the Government of Canada (currently Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca, Janssen) and has received the last dose at least 14 days prior to their start date. To prove they are Fully Vaccinated, all new hires will be required to provide evidence by emailing a copy of their vaccine dose administration receipt(s) to Human Resources prior to their start date. Those seeking exemption based on one or more of the protected grounds in the Human Rights Code will need to provide their request for accommodation to Human Resources for approval. If the accommodation request is not approved and the candidate is not Fully Vaccinated, any offer of employment will be revoked.

THE GLOBE AND MAIL IS DEDICATED TO DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION IN THE WORKPLACE

The Globe and Mail is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. We believe this strengthens our business and our journalism. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, regardless of race, ethnicity, culture, gender, sexual orientation, religion, socio-economic status, age, and physical ability. As required by the Federal Contractors Program, The Globe also tracks the proportion of staff in the four Employment Equity categories (Women, Aboriginal Peoples, Persons with Disabilities, and Members of Visible Minorities) to ensure we are reflecting the areas in which we work.

The Globe and Mail offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

title: newCook - Indian Cuisine
description:
Globally we deliver over 320,000 authentic, world-class meals every day, these meals are dished up by our portfolio of brands - dnata, Alpha Flight Group, Alpha LSG and En Route. Working to stringent deadlines and exacting standards, we take pride in every smile our dishes evoke - a trait recognized by numerous airlines around the world. Over the years we have been awarded best caterer by a wide number of airlines and are driven by a desire to deliver for our customers, and their customers, every day. We are excited to be opening our 64th dedicated catering unit in Vancouver, Canada. Our Vancouver start-up is a unique opportunity to be part of a new team that will help us write the next chapter of our success story!

Why join dnata?

  • Be part of a small start-up team, with great opportunity for growth
  • Be part of a global award winning group
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Cover
  • Additional co-contributions towards your retirement fund
  • Paid annual vacation
  • Over-time premiums
  • Free daily meal
The role
The Cook will be responsible for managing all aspects of food preparation and production in an environment that meets sanitation guidelines. The duties can range from preparing ingredients to be cooked, to maintaining temperature and Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HACCP) logs as required; and maintains appropriate dating, labeling, and rotation of all food items.

Responsibilities:
  • Prepare Mise-en-place.
  • Prepare food items in accurate and standard portion and quantities.
  • Prepare meals as directed and according to recipe, menu specification and expected standard.
  • Attend to any last minute additional meal order or menu changes due to flight delay.
  • Ensure all prepared foods are properly labeled with Day Sticker.
  • Ensure meals are prepared according to Work Order timings and are blast chilled accordingly.
  • Ensure personal and food hygiene practices are followed accordingly to standards set by Quality Assurance Department.
  • Help to maintain general cleanliness in the Kitchen area and as well as the equipment for Kitchen use.
  • Observe and practice safety rules and regulations.
  • Ensure food temperatures are within standard limits.
  • Provide training, supervise and assign job to junior staff.
  • Ensure meals are prepared according to specifications.
  • Minimize wastage during food preparation.
  • Inform immediate superior if any equipment or utensils are damaged or not working.
  • Undertake any other duties assigned by immediate superior
Qualifications/ Skills/ Experience / Knowledge:
  • High school diploma or general education degree (GED) required
  • Culinary certification or degree from a culinary school preferred
  • Red Seal candidates are encouraged to apply
  • Minimum 3 years' experience in food service or restaurant experience required
  • Familiarity with general kitchen equipment and appliances
  • Strong working knowledge of food preparation techniques, cooking methods, and safety and sanitation practices

title: caterer cook
description:
Specific Skills

  • Train staff in preparation, cooking and handling of food
  • Clean kitchen and work areas
  • Maintain inventory and records of food, supplies and equipment
  • Prepare and cook complete meals or individual dishes and foods
  • Plan menus, determine size of food portions, estimate food requirements and costs, and monitor and order supplies

title: Pastry Cook
description:
We are looking for talents who are passionate in baking bread such as focaccia, and baked goods, while also providing a unique experience for customers. If you are fun, creative, energetic, motivated, positive, and willing to learn and share knowledge, you are the person that we are looking for!

Job Type: Part-time; Flexible work days based on business needs
Potential growth into a full-time or leading position
Competitive industry pay based on experience

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Ensure all baked goods are prepared and presented according to specifications

  • Understand and memorize all pastry items on the menu

  • Sample ingredients, mix, and finish products, ensuring standards, quality and created flavour profiles are met

  • Perform inventory checks and notify management of supply levels

  • Eager to learn and be trained on the multiple pastry techniques

  • Eager to create and produce new recipes with the culinary team

  • Ensure production schedules and timelines are met

  • Maintain an organized and clean prep/work area

Qualifications

  • Eligible to work in Canada

  • Has obtain a valid BC Foodsafe Certification

  • Prior experience in a pastry-serving establishment with a minimum of 1 year experience

  • Strong organization skill and time management skill are required

  • Ability to demonstrate a strong knowledge of ingredients and suppliers

  • Ability to perform with consistency

  • Class 5 driver license is an asset

title: newKitchen Supervisor/Commis Chef
description:
About The Company

The Caterer Inc started in 2014 in Vancouver and since then, we have grown to serve 7 communities across Vancouver and North Vancouver. We are located in North Burnaby, near Production Way Skytrain Station. Our team is made up of members from different nationalities around the world, creating a rich environment with global knowledge. Our environment is loving, creative, and team spirited. We are opened 7 days a week and our hours are flexible.

About The Position

We are looking for a great candidate to join our team as a Kitchen Supervisor for our sandwich and culinary production for our wholesale and catering department. If you are fun, creative, energetic, motivated, positive, and willing to learn and share knowledge, you are the person that we are looking for!

Duties Includes

  • Work closely and leading a dynamic team
  • Prepare all inventory, stock rotation and ordering
  • Prepare all products according to company standardized manuals
  • Prep work for all the mise en place required for our wholesale sandwich production
  • General maintenance, cleaning and tidying of the kitchen

The Right Candidate Will Possess:

  • Eligible to work in Canada
  • Has obtained Food Safe Certificate Level 1 or higher
  • Strong organizational skill and time management skill are required
  • Previous experience in a culinary setting is required
  • Supervise an intimate team of sandwich production staff, manage work schedules
  • Train newly hired production staffs
  • Ability to perform with consistency
  • Valid Class 5 driver license is an asset

Work Schedule

Full-Time; Tuesdays - Saturdays; 9am - 5pm
NO early hours or late night shifts.
NO work days on Statuary Holidays

Daily Pay Rate: $150 - $170
Negotiable based on experience and probation.

This is a long-term position. We offer plenty of opportunities for personal, and professional growth within our team. We appreciate all interested candidates, but we will only reach out to successful candidates.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $150.00-$170.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Executive Assistant – Family Office
description:
Not just a job…
a community
a partnership
a team

Our Family Office is currently hiring for an:

Executive Assistant – Family Office

This is an exciting opportunity to assist the Family Office and become a pivotal part of its' future. Primarily supporting in a business context, there will be some personal support over time, mainly events, travel and other duties as assigned. This is a new role and with the wide and sometimes complex environment/investments the family are involved in, you must have an understanding and interest in business and finance and be a self-starter able to bring much to the table. You possess the ability to carve out and define your position, deal with a range of stakeholders and work with Senior team members of the Family Office and external professionals when required. You are able to work independently with top communication & organizational skills, build strong relationships quickly and comfortable working alone for periods of time. Flexibility and a hands on proactive approach is needed. You will report directly into the Family Office executives and liaise with the Family Office on matters.

SKILLS & ABILITIES:
  • Ability to exercise absolute discretion, confidentiality and diplomacy in your day-to-day dealings on the phone and in person.
  • Genuine appreciation for an understanding of protocols, discretion and professionalism, is able to accept and assume responsibility, and has the ability to interpret and make decisions in accordance with prescribed procedures and practices of the company. Takes initiative to isolate and solve problems.
  • Ability to relate to all levels of personnel and demonstrate good interpersonal skills when dealing with customers, staff & management.
  • Must be able to work independently with little supervision and in a team environment.
  • Superior communication skills, both written and verbal with the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of personnel both within the organization and outside suppliers and contractors.
  • Highly organized and able to multitask effectively and work under changing priorities. Strong and accurate attention to detail with strong administrative skills.
DUTIES, RESPONSIBILITIES, & TASKS:
  • Proactively creates and maintains effective workflow and communications to accomplish the work of the Family office which includes the handling of a variety of projects and tasks simultaneously both administrative and of a personal nature.
  • Manage incoming calls, prioritizing appointments and proactively resolving scheduling conflicts.
  • Organizing and booking travel arrangements.
  • Prepare and/or edit internal and external letters, company-wide communication, memos and mass emails.
  • Assist with the preparation of business presentations & reports, including text, content and electronic presentations.
  • Maintains the image of the Family office by ensuring that all correspondence prepared for the Family Office adheres to a consistent and professional standard as communicated.
  • Provides support to Committees by typing, preparing, distributing, minutes. As well as the preparation of agenda packages, arranging meeting dates, times and rooms and invite lists. Attends meetings as required to record minutes.
  • Completes special projects as assigned.
  • Vacation coverage for other Executive or Administrative Assistants as required.
  • Organize and coordinate functions and special events (create invitations, venue bookings, liaising with caterers, event rentals).
  • Timely coordination and processing of various bill payments.
  • Coordination, review, and filing of various correspondence.
  • Other duties as required.
ATTITUDE & CHARACTERISTICS:
  • Caring.
  • Honest.
  • Passionate and proactive.
  • Enthusiastic self-starter who strives for excellence.
  • Willingness to learn and grow.
EDUCATION & KNOWLEDGE:
  • Minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience as an executive assistant or senior administrative position.
  • Completion of a 2-year office admin program or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Intermediate to expert level competency with Microsoft Word, Excel and Power Point as well as managing files and documents in the Windows environment.
GENERAL REQUIREMENTS:
  • Support and demonstrate the attributes of the London Drugs Brand Framework.
  • Understand and adhere to Company policy regarding the usage of internet access and e-mail usage, where applicable.
  • Be familiar and comply with all related company policies.
  • Understand and operate within the guidelines set out in the corporate privacy policy and other corporate communication relating to privacy issues.
  • Must be flexible with hours of work.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
  • Will be required to work independently.
  • Will be required to work indoors with overhead florescent lighting.
  • Will be required to work in an open space office environment.
  • Must have access to a vehicle, hold a valid driver’s license and passport and be willing and able to travel as required.
HEALTH & SAFETY:
  • Be aware of and promote safety standards to ensure both employee and customer health and safety.
  • Create and maintain a safe, fair, and harassment free environment for all employees.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
  • Will be required to spend long periods of time sitting.
  • Extensive computer work is involved, which includes typing and reading from a computer screen.
We offer advancement opportunities through our promote-from-within policies, salaries commensurate with experience, as well as a comprehensive benefits program including:
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, prescription drug and vision coverage for you and your family
  • Employee Discount Program
  • Employee Recognition Program
  • Company matched RRSPs
  • Ongoing In-House Training & Education Courses
  • Employee Family Assistance Program (Confidential counseling)
  • Community Involvement

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, we DO NOT use third party recruitment services.

We may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: Indigenous Event Planner
description:
Indigenous Event Planner

Job description and duties

Coast Mountain College (CMTN) invites applications for a term full-time Indigenous Event Planner. The appointment will commence as soon as possible and end October 3, 2022. A flexible schedule is required as some evening/weekend work and some travel we be necessary. Salary will be in accordance with the BCGEU Support Staff Scale, Level 11.

Duties: Based in Terrace, Prince Rupert, Hazelton, or Smithers, the Event Planner will organize and manage events (i.e.: FNC 25th Year Celebration, Orange Shirt week, Galts’ap Day) from conception through to completion. Responsibilities include conceptualizing theme ideas, planning budgets, booking venues, liaising with suppliers and clients, creating and sending out invites, managing logistics, and presenting post-event reports.

Responsibilities and tasks will include:

  • Event planning, design, and production, managing all project delivery elements within budget and time limits; identifying event expectations, brainstorming and implementing concepts and themes

  • Organize facilities and manage all event details such as decor, catering, entertainment, transportation, location, invitation list, special guests, equipment, promotional material, security, lighting, sound equipment, displays, stages, any other essential items required

  • Conduct market research, gather information and negotiate contracts for vendors such as florists, caterers, and entertainment

  • Monitor delivery of goods and services, ensuring contract terms are satisfied; adhere to insurance, legal, health and safety obligations

  • Hire key volunteers and manage staff, as well as special guest appearance(s), MCs, entertainers for the event, providing guidance and supervision

  • Work with marketing and public relations to promote and publicize event and design materials

  • Proactively handle any arising issues and troubleshoot any emerging problems on the event day

  • Other related duties (of similar scope and complexity) as required

Qualifications

A post-secondary diploma Event Management, Hotel Management, Hospitality, Marketing, or other related field along with a minimum of three years of experience working as an Event Coordinator / Planner, demonstrating a proven track-record of creative, successful events (a portfolio of previously managed events such as weddings, meetings, parties, corporate events will be an asset). An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.

Required knowledge, skills and abilities include:

  • In-depth knowledge, understanding, and connection with local Indigenous communities

  • Demonstrated knowledge with the Truth and Reconciliation call to action

  • A valid Class 5 Driver’s License

  • Expert time management, problem solving, and communication skills

  • Strong leadership, negotiation, and planning skills

  • Experience managing budgets and expense tracking

  • Advanced knowledge of Word, PowerPoint, Adobe, and Excel

  • Ability to manage multiple projects independently and lead teams effectively

  • Ability to remain calm and collegiate under pressure and maintain a positive customer-service attitude

Application information

Respond in confidence by submitting a cover letter and current resume, quoting competition #22.050B to:

Coast Mountain College, Human Resources & Payroll Department

Email: apply@coastmountaincollege.ca

NOTE: Only complete applications (with a cover letter and resume included) received to the above noted email address will be considered.

CMTN provides quality learning experiences that help prepare our students for successful, positive futures. We celebrate the diversity of our northern and Indigenous populations and reflect this diversity in our programs, services and workforce. In accordance with CMTN’s strategic plan, we encourage applications from Indigenous individuals.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Closing date
This competition will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected.
Competition number
22.050B
Job status
Open
Posting type
Support
Audience
Open to both internal and external candidates
Department
  • Indigenization
Campuses

title: Office Services Assistant
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO


The Office Services Assistant provides front desk coverage, assistance with facilities maintenance, meeting and event coordination as well as any administrative requirements in general for the Montreal office. These duties are performed with the highest level of customer service. As a member of the Office Services team, you will:

Facilities & Coordination:
  • Handle maintenance calls to building representatives (i.e., temperature control, bulb replacement, general repairs etc.) and follow through until all issues are resolved
  • Manage purchasing of kitchen and office supplies; routinely restock kitchen and office supplies as needed
  • Maintain overall appearance of conference rooms, workspaces and kitchen daily; provide assistance if immediate clean-up of a public space is required until a porter arrives
  • Facilities duties to include, but not limited to:
    • Maintaining overall appearance of the office
      • Check all conference rooms, communal areas, offices and workstations throughout the day to ensure that all work areas are clean, and supplies are fully stocked
      • Check all printers to make sure they are fully stocked with paper and functioning properly; dispose of any client confidential materials that have not been picked up from the previous day
      • Coordinate recycling/shredding efforts
      • Perform other projects as assigned or required (quick errand outside of the office for urgent request of materials)
    • Kitchen coordination
      • Responsible for overall cleanliness and organization of office kitchen and ensure proper maintenance of kitchen equipment
      • Replenish kitchen supplies throughout the day
      • Take weekly inventory of supplies and order as necessary
      • Facilitate catering order placement and clean-up for any all-staff or internal meetings

Events & Special Projects
  • Assist with research, logistics and set-up for both internal and external events; manage food orders from outside caterers; process invoices, manage budgets and identify opportunities for savings
  • Provide support with any special or internal projects such as annual review of vendors, pilot of new room booking tools etc.
  • Other duties as needed.

Hospitality
  • Greet visitors in a professional and courteous manner
  • Communicate effectively and professionally via phone, email and in-person with all levels of BCG staff, clients and guests
  • Obtain information to promptly direct callers to appropriate BCG / external resources
  • Handle guests’ individual needs during their visit, including registration, office assignment, direction of car and food service requests and administrative/logistics support
  • Maintain meetings and events calendar, ensuring all meetings are entered in the room booking reservation system.
  • Other duties as needed.


YOU'RE GOOD AT


There are a few key things we look for – do you have what it takes to step into these shoes?
  • High customer service orientation – highly responsive, strong interpersonal and communication skills, wants to deliver great results at all times
  • Meticulous attention to detail and follow-through; perform tasks with high degree of accuracy and efficiency
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills; ability to meet deadlines
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to successfully manage competing priorities, keeping constant sight of the overall objectives
  • High degree of flexibility in a demanding, fast-paced and frequently changing environment
  • Sweats the small stuff – strong attention to detail and accuracy, particularly when under pressure
  • Organized – excellent at time and project management, has clear systems and composure to deal with multiple tasks at once and ensures everything gets done in a timely manner
  • Relationship-oriented – extremely people focused with a certain 'joie de vivre' and the ability to develop effective working relationships with the Consulting Team, clients, and the wider Business Services Team (BST)
  • Good judgment – highly professional and diplomatic (dealing with consultants who can be very demanding at times can be a challenge, but a challenge you're up for), knows when to ask for help or advice, is perceptive and practical
  • Trustworthy - discreet (you will be privy to confidential information)
  • Team player – proactively seeks opportunities to help others, will go above and beyond in order to get the job done


YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)


  • 1-2 years in an office or customer services environment
  • Ability to spend significant time walking and standing
  • Ability to lift and deliver large packages
  • Ability to work within a budget
  • Flexibility to work overtime
  • Computer literacy required with good knowledge of Outlook, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint
  • Language requirement: Bilingualism (French and English, spoken and written), essential.


YOU'LL WORK WITH


Our business management and operations team members work to ensure that BCG is running smoothly, efficiently, and productively. We are made up of executive and administrative (or case team) assistants, visual service artists, receptionists, facilities staff, and the team leaders and office coordinators who manage these operations and business management jobs.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION


Candidates should be aware that BCG currently maintains a policy requiring all US & Canada based employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. BCG is an equal opportunity employer and will provide a reasonable accommodation to those unable to be vaccinated for medical or religious reasons where it is not an undue hardship to the company to do so as provided under applicable federal, state, provincial and local law.

title: On-Call Flex Driver
description:
We are always looking for on-call flex delivery drivers base on the needs of business and demand. This position does require someone with a very strong punctuality and time management. Whether you’re saving up for something big or you just want to make some extra money, you can maximize your earnings by taking on delivery by demand when you find a little extra time throughout your day. Flex drivers are paid by the job, depending on the distance or service of delivery assigned. As a delivery partner, you’re in and out of your vehicle, and actively engaged in delivering smiles to happy customers. It’s a driving gig that keeps you on your feet.

Job Type: On-Call; Flexible work schedule based on business needs
Potential growth into a part-time position

Qualifications

  • Eligible to work in Canada

  • Valid Class 5 driver license

  • Have a mid-size or large vehicle and mobile device for communication

  • Ability to lift up to 25lbs

  • Flexible availability

title: Kitchen Manager
description:
Canuel Caterers is a food and beverage company offering food service in education, corporate catering, corporate dining and sport and entertainment services. We are an established company with 27 years of growth and counting. We offer a competitive benefits package to full time employees and welcome the desire for advancement within the company.

We are currently hiring a full-time kitchen manager for our cafe located in the Poirier Sports and Leisure Complex in Coquitlam open 7 days a week.

Responsibilities include:

- Cooking and food preparation
- Inventory
- Corporate catering
- Food costing
- Quality Control
- Scheduling
- Ordering

Assets include:

- Flexible availability
- Previous café experience
- Previous management experience
- Serving it right

Requirements:

- Food Safe Certificate

The wage is negotiable and on-site training will be provided for the right candidate. We can’t wait to hear from you!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $1.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

title: newCook - Western Cuisine
description:
Globally we deliver over 320,000 authentic, world-class meals every day, these meals are dished up by our portfolio of brands - dnata, Alpha Flight Group, Alpha LSG and En Route. Working to stringent deadlines and exacting standards, we take pride in every smile our dishes evoke - a trait recognized by numerous airlines around the world. Over the years we have been awarded best caterer by a wide number of airlines and are driven by a desire to deliver for our customers, and their customers, every day. We are excited to be opening our 64th dedicated catering unit in Vancouver, Canada. Our Vancouver start-up is a unique opportunity to be part of a new team that will help us write the next chapter of our success story!

Why join dnata?

  • Be part of a small start-up team, with great opportunity for growth
  • Be part of a global award winning group
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Cover
  • Additional co-contributions towards your retirement fund
  • Paid annual vacation
  • Over-time premiums
  • Free daily meal
The role
The Cook will be responsible for managing all aspects of food preparation and production in an environment that meets sanitation guidelines. The duties can range from preparing ingredients to be cooked, to maintaining temperature and Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HACCP) logs as required; and maintains appropriate dating, labeling, and rotation of all food items.

Responsibilities:
  • Prepare Mise-en-place.
  • Prepare food items in accurate and standard portion and quantities.
  • Prepare meals as directed and according to recipe, menu specification and expected standard.
  • Attend to any last minute additional meal order or menu changes due to flight delay.
  • Ensure all prepared foods are properly labeled with Day Sticker.
  • Ensure meals are prepared according to Work Order timings and are blast chilled accordingly.
  • Ensure personal and food hygiene practices are followed accordingly to standards set by Quality Assurance Department.
  • Help to maintain general cleanliness in the Kitchen area and as well as the equipment for Kitchen use.
  • Observe and practice safety rules and regulations.
  • Ensure food temperatures are within standard limits.
  • Provide training, supervise and assign job to junior staff.
  • Ensure meals are prepared according to specifications.
  • Minimize wastage during food preparation.
  • Inform immediate superior if any equipment or utensils are damaged or not working.
  • Undertake any other duties assigned by immediate superior
Qualifications/ Skills/ Experience / Knowledge:
  • High school diploma or general education degree (GED) required
  • Culinary certification or degree from a culinary school preferred
  • Red Seal candidates are encouraged to apply
  • Minimum 3 years' experience in food service or restaurant experience required
  • Familiarity with general kitchen equipment and appliances
  • Strong working knowledge of food preparation techniques, cooking methods, and safety and sanitation practices
